All images, components, game mechanics etc. shown of the game are subject to change per manufacturer's requirements and/or the publisher's preference for what is in the best interest of the game and the backers.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Over the last two years, we've worked hard to complete the most difficult and time-consuming tasks involved in publishing Necromolds so that the manufacturing process can begin the moment the campaign ends. This includes injection mold modeling, artwork, layout for print, playtesting, and more. We've created an exciting list of stretch goals that will not compromise cost or delivery time.

We've also partnered with world-renowned tabletop game manufacturer Panda Game Manufacturing, who have brought you award-winning games like ROOT, Wingspan, and Pandemic. As fans of the project themselves, Panda reached out to us directly and we have worked together to make sure Necromolds will be a high quality, unique game that you won't hesitate to bring out at game night!

Logistics, shipping, and fulfillment will be handled by Quartermaster Logistics, who have worked hard to offer our backers the best shipping prices possible. QML has been trusted and recommended by many of the most successful board game campaigns on Kickstarter, and they are another company we're proud to be working with.

Speaking personally... there may always be unforeseen delays and I can only promise to be transparent and honest with all backers. Necromolds is a very unique game with unique manufacturing challenges. That uniqueness is why it is so fun to play, and also why our pre-campaign work has been so thorough. As the creator and designer of Necromolds, it means everything to me that it succeeds... and success doesn't mean reaching the campaign goal - it means every single backer has a smile on their face as they smash their monster armies at their game table!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

GOAT Dice are handmade D20s that have a visual swirling effect when rolled. This is a very visual Kickstarter, and you will need to watch the videos to see for yourself. Each individual dice has a video below! There are 10 total dice, be sure to watch them all!
Massive increases to production have been made; new equipment, hired help, and a more efficient process means that all dice will be shipped before September of 2020. This is still an overestimate, they may arrive sooner.
Orders will be filled by backer number, meaning the first orders in go out first. If you haven't ordered and want your product faster, don't wait any longer!
What you see in this Kickstarter is not what you get, because what you will get is even better. The funding has allowed me to make some major improvements to the dice. The improvements: higher quality colorant for the resin, higher quality acrylic for the numbers, better equipment to make molds for a more perfect dice, and improved sanding process to eliminate small imperfections.
Some individual dice have gotten improvements, read the message under each one. You will be able to see the full improvements before finalizing any selections.

updates.update_content:
There are no custom master dice.
So 3d printed masters allow dice creators to customize size, font, and other aspects of the dice. I've wanted my own custom masters since before this Kickstarter launched, but they're not cheap and not too many people make them so wait times can be very long. The success of the Kickstarter really motivated me to get them, so about 1 1/2 weeks into this project I started to seek them.

Beautiful candies.
Link: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/flamingflamingo/roll-your-fate-dice?ref=2ndyw3
A lot of people contact me to share their Kickstarters, but I don't want to because it would be spam most of the time, but Mittin over at Roll Your Fate has been instrumental the success of my Kickstarter. He was available to answer all my questions and really helped me get through a lot in the first few days. His campaign only has 4 days left, so this might be your last chance to snag these awesome dice and support someone who supported me.

updates.update_userinfo: Quickie Friday Update (production, quality, and great news.)
updates.update_content:
Good news, everyone!
The winner of my Facebook giveaway reached out to me and is now getting their reward. If you're lost as to why this is good news, check out my last update, and for real; read all the updates. 
Production.

Issues with Facebook led to an unfortunate consequence. 
So shortly after the launch of this Kickstarter the influx of traffic to my Facebook got it locked. This was part due to the ads that I started to run and of course people finding me after seeing the Kickstarter. I had to upload a picture of my face and my government issued ID, but they disabled my account despite me doing that, and now it's disabled permanently. The reason why: I wasn't using my real name, I was using the name 'James Goat-Dice'. I do not like Facebook and how they conduct their business and had no interest in using their platform in any capacity other than reaching my backers and future customers. I cannot just change the name and move on, in fact I can't do anything because there is no way to contact Facebook.

updates.update_userinfo: Delay on mystery colors, increased quality, production news.
updates.update_content:
I feel bad sending out so many emails to everyone. I hate to spam, but I want to be transparent and this is the only way. 
Mystery colors.
I was going to announce my 4th mystery color today, but I am not happy with the colors as I was when I first made it. At the end of the day I want to make something that I love and want to use, so I will remake this one with my higher standards and release it Tomorrow or Friday. As of right now both will be released by end of day Friday unless I run into any issues.

Its my first time, be gentle. 
At this point there will be no 'add ons' per se. Yes in my original campaign it said there were going to be with prices and everything, but here's the thing; I thought you could do that on Kickstarter itself. I had researched a whole bunch of campaigns and took notes on what they were doing and decided that I too would offer add ons.  But it turns out you need a 3rd party pledge manager to get that done and I would be happy to use one if I needed the other services they offer but I just need add ons and its a bit wasteful with the rest. My project and its rewards are so simple that a post campaign 3rd party add on manager just isn't worth the hassle.

Welcome to our new adventure!
This time the crosslances studio will take you inside an epic battle that will see soldiers of human armies (paladins), sylvan elves, and evil knights of chaos in opposition!
Are you ready to sharpen your 3D printers?
they are not regular miniatures that you buy and put on a shelf, they are miniatures for your 3D printer! By buying this, you will receive .stl files to print miniatures directly with your own 3D printers, while cozy at home!


               -if you already own a 3D printer, it's cheap and also funny, you will print unique and incredible quality models
-If you don't own a 3D printer, it can be an opportunity to buy one! Prices for a printer are already low and accessible to anyone. You can still use a service like: 3D hub, shapeways, or any other that are crowding on the net.
-No shipping cost! Anywhere in the universe, you just download the files and print!
-You can print it as many times as you want, for you and your friends.
-You can decide any printing dimension, from miniatures to real size titan sculptures!- You can use these miniature for other games, as proxies in games like ninth age or fantasy football.
PLEASE NOTE - This Kickstarter is for digital files (STLs) to make all these items on your own home 3D printer - these are not physical goods **
For the realization of the miniatures and the scenic, photographed in this kickstarter, two printers were used: Tevo tornado (filament), Kudo Bean (dlp-Uv).
For the realization of the miniatures it is necessary the use of some supports, for which we used the chitubox software, and we are happy to share with you the settings used.
Remember to add some supports in the most critical points.
For a correct 28mm scale miniature print, it's suggested a good quality printer, with at least 100micron resolution, so that all the details of the miniature are visible and the high quality of the sculptures is adequately exalted.
Don't be afraid if your printers have lower specs, you can still print them giving up to some details, or print in a bigger scale(suggested for filament print), getting over the printer problem.
To obtain superior results, the use of a resin printer is recommended. But excellent results can also be achieved with the filament
Free files Example stl files
free download:
https://www.crosslances.net/2019/11/15/free-files-example-stl-files/
Instead all the scenic pieces are ideal for filament printers, without any support necessity.
When battles are raging in the world there are always those who choose to be part of the factions of evil and those of good. Paladins fight for light and peace, faithful to the sun god, these brave fighters protect their golden cities, do you want to fight in the path of light too?

The tower is built in three distinct sections: base, center and top. So that the center is modular and the height of the tower can be decided
Wood elves don't like war but when the threat of other armies comes closer, they surely know how to defend themselves and counterattack!
The wood elves live in the woods and forests, they worship the goddess of nature, if you also want to defend mother earth, then you know which side to take

The tower is built in three distinct parts: base, center and top. So that the center is modular and the height of the tower can be decided

               Unlike the paladins, the chaos warriors have given their soul to evil and darkness, their hearts are dark and full of evilness, always ready to give vent to their weapons!
The knights of chaos worship evil and darkness: demons, devils and any evil entity.
If you don't have any pity on anyone in battle, then the chaos is right for you!

The tower is built in three distinct parts: base, center and top. So that the center is modular and the height of the tower can be decided
 This miniature is our gift for you!
Yes exactly, you will just need to pledge any level, even just 1 euro and you will be able to download immediately!
You will find the download link in the updates as soon as you made the pledge.
Now our regular customers know that we are not used to classic add-on methods found on many kickstarters.
We will not include stretch goals, but we will listen to all your suggestions during the campaign and we will try to sculpt as many pieces as possible based on your requests.
In the meantime, here you have some sculptures that you can receive for free in the € 22 or higher packages.


               Crosslances studios is founded by 3 artists and their commons passion for the world of games. Students at the Comics courses in Florence, made by the greebo games sculptures, they approached the world of miniatures. It has actually became a revelant studio in the world of miniatures and digital miniatures prototyping. Our products can be found in many places, we had collaborations with: Labmasu, Megalith Godslayer, Hidden Dreams, Minuteman miniatures, Fireforge , and many others

The distribution of files should take place by December 20, but we are committed to shorten time as much as possible.
As soon as your payment is registered on kickstarter, we will immediately and individually send the files, so that you can have them as fast as possible, and maybe to be able to print them for Christmas!
By buying these files you will be allowed to:
- print the 3D miniatures
                 - print them for friends
                 - Print in 3D and resell the printed miniature in 3D
                 -use render-prints and other byproducts of the file for promotional purposes.
                 -modify the file according to needs and educational purposes
                 - Modified byproducts files may be sold printed in 3D
  -use the models as parts of a video game
  Not allowed:
- Use the files to create molds for mass production
                 - sell the files for profit
                 - distribute the file to third parties
  For non-granted points, please contact the study crosslances, with which you can find an agreement.
It is asked in addition to cite Crosslances Studios wherever possible.
For all the remaining details we stick to the common creative.
Refer to legally binding General Terms and Conditions to learn more about conditions regarding extracting product from end product created, which applies to all models under any license.

campaign.story:
Chess has been a game that was part of our lives as we grew up. As long as we can remember, our parents enjoyed playing a game of chess with friends, while having a glass and telling stories.
Motivated by these memories, we decided to take a game that has been played for over 1500 years and create a set of uniquely crafted glass pieces that pay homage, but also add a new dimension to this iconic classic game. 
It was a journey of over 12 months that got us to the point where we are ready to create the moulds so all we need is your support to start the production!
The process of developing the final chess pieces was as important to us as the result itself. From modern 3D printing, to an old school approach to glassmaking, our designs slowly progressed to a stage where we now partner with a factory that uses high precision technology to make our full set which requires no less than 72 simultaneous injection points. 
The old school approach taken in the development of the final glass pieces
The result speaks for itself.
The Glass Knights are also a collection of the most refined shot glasses ever, that you can use to create a twist and a completely new playing experience, or simply flip the board over and you have yourself a tray of unique glass shots for your next party.
You asked yourself how come the drink doesn’t spill everywhere, right? We took care of that. The food grade silicone is placed on the end of the piece in less than a second and it creates a seal that ensures that not a single drop of your precious liquid escapes.

In addition to the fun element, we wanted to create a chess board that wouldn’t need to be hidden away when you’re not playing. 
Quite the opposite. In fact, we designed the Glass Knights board and pieces down to the most minute details so that you would be proud to display it in your living room or office.
Rest assured that almost every person walking in the room will stop and pick up the pieces.

We were ruthless in the engineering of each piece to add intricate details on the glass, while ensuring they are durable so you don’t have to worry about dropping them. That is why finding the right factory that could create such a quality piece of glass narrowed the search down to only a few that had the technology to manufacture the Glass Knights.

Aside from the visual aspect, we know just how important is the feel and the weight of each piece. The smooth surface of the glass and the intricate details, combined with just the right thickness, make from each piece an experience to play with.

The Glass Knights is created with kids in mind too! Aside from the fact that you don’t have to worry about your kids dropping the glass pieces because they are made from one tough tempered glass, the pieces can be filled with sweets or dried fruit. 
That will take their enjoyment of the game to the next level. The only downside may be that it’s your responsibility to go down to the store and get the tasty rewards. Once you’ve done that, you can have your free time while they play away!
Although we don’t recommend going around throwing your Glass Knight pieces, we did thousands of iterations and reiterations to create the ideal tempered glass that can be dropped and live to play another game. 
The Executive Set is the add on that can raise your game to the ultimate level.
We introduced the handcrafted wooden board that glows in the dark in a limited edition that will be capped at only 100 pieces. Each will have a unique serial number as proof of its authenticity.
If you decide to upgrade to the Executive Set, simply choose the appropriate reward level. The only thing left is for you to enjoy it. You deserve it.
Each Executive Set wooden board requires over 15 hours to handcraft.

When designing the Glass Knights, we wanted to go beyond any expectations from a normal chess piece set and make every element have at least one function.
That is exactly what we did with the thermoformed containers that house each glass piece, as well as double as ice cube trays.
Now with each full set, you will have 36 of the most unique ice cubes that are shaped as chess pieces! 
Getting the right dimension and weight is also something we looked closely at in order for you to feel the weight of each piece, while also ensuring the optimum thickness of the glass to make withstand pretty much all accidental drops from day to day scenarios.

To make things even more excited, we are introducing two free upgrades once we smash our first stretch goal.
Part 1: Three Box Colors To Choose From
That’s right! You will be able to choose the color of your Glass Knights box so that it best fits with your style or house and office design.
PART 2: Water-Resistant Box 
In addition, we know that you may want to take the Glass Knights box out to the pool or simply don’t want to have to worry about spilling liquids inside. That is why the 100K Stretch Goal will also mean that we make the box water resistant!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Creating a Kickstarter project without a doubt can pose a lot of challenges. We acknowledged this and that is why we set out to diminish to a minimum each risk by working with a team of fellow Kickstarter creators that have successfully launched 11 crowdfunding projects.

We then started to analyse each aspect and reached the conclusion that most of the challenges arise in the pre-production preparation which defines the quality and pace of the actual production process.

To diminish this risk, we narrowed our partnership to two factories which we worked closely with for over 6 months to ensure that when we launch the Kickstarter project, the Glass Knights chess board and glass pieces are at the stage where every detail is worked out, without the need to make any further changes, before creating the final metal molds and starting the production. 

We look forward to embarking on this journey with you as our backers and members that helped found the Glass Knights!

updates.update_content:
Hey there Trolley Fans!

We hope you're all staying safe, healthy, and off the trolley tracks as much as possible. We just wanted to reach out on this lovely Tuesday morning and let you know about another web comic-related Kickstarter that the fine folks at Skybound are working on:

Hey there young Kickstarts!

We’ll do you the favor of sparing you the “in these trying times” message and just say that we genuinely hope you are doing well.

We also have some exciting news! Trolley Tom is BACK and needs your help more than ever, to help make his decisions for him. This time, he’s deciding who’s been naughty and who’s been nice… that’s right, he’s not just Trolley Tom anymore, get ready for .

Hello all you Trolley Hoppers!
This campaign has been a whirlwind, and we’re thankful that you all took a chance on us and backed it! It was incredibly fun, so thank you guys for that! Now that the vast majority of games have been out for a bit, things are winding down slightly on our end. We wanted to give you guys an update on how things will be  moving forward.
Numbers wise, the campaign is 91% completed. The other 9% represents backers who have either never responded to their PledgeManager email or backers who started it but didn’t actually finish it. Of course the PledgeManager system isn’t perfect, and it’s possible you never got your email. I tried to help by posting several updates reminding you all to do it, just in case you didn’t get your email, but I'm aware those may have also slipped through the cracks. Even though we were trying to cover all the bases, we understand that everyone has different circumstances, and things may have still been missed accidentally. I’m here to let the remaining 9% of you know that there’s no need to worry! You will still get your games, and, in fact, your entire original orders, unaltered! Since the PledgeManager is locked, you’re not able to complete your orders on your end anymore. In order to still get your games, you can reach out to me, Maya, at  for help putting your address in and getting you on our weekly batches. Moving forward, we’ll be sending out small weekly batches to get your games to you. I submit the batches to QuarterMaster every Thursday, and they get shipped out the next week. You can also shoot me an email if you’re just curious about tracking or any sort of updates with your order in general. Now that things are really winding down, we won’t be doing regular updates anymore. Here’s a bunch of links to all of our websites and social media which will alert you of new games and new fun in general!

updates.update_content:
Hey Everybody!
We hope you all are enjoying your holiday season so far! I’ve slipped and fallen on ice 3 times, so I’m clearly doing amazingly. We’re sending you this update just to fill you in on where we are right now as far as shipping. We had a really great time at PAX Unplugged! We were able to meet a bunch of you guys while at the con, and it was rad playing the game with you! You guys have some weird humor and apparently a lot of murder secrets, but I guess we all know whose fault that is. We’re very excited to get you your games.
Locking the PledgeManager

Hey y'all!
So, a little more info about the delay. There were quite a few things that factored into us missing December as the estimated fulfillment window. It isn't actually very hard to be off on an estimate by a month. There is a lot that goes into making something on the other side of the world and then shipping it to all corners of said earth.
We added the Tram Sam mini pretty late in the campaign, and we had to get that mold started much later than the other molds. Typically, molds take 30-45 days to make, and there is no speeding those up. We really wanted to give you guys a great quality Tram Sam miniature, so we knew that was going to make our timeline a little tighter. As expected, it did.

Every JourneyQuest film is produced under the Shared Cinematic License Agreement which allows you to remix, create, adapt, and distribute works set in the world of Fartherall. These are films funded by you for you. 
Note that anything marked with "kickstarter exclusive" is an exclusive item for Kickstarter backers (or from other crowdfunding platforms), with remaining stock available through conventions and special promotions only.  
Take a moment to like and follow our social media and community accounts on the services you use (ZOE Facebook • JourneyQuest Facebook • Twitter • Instagram • Twitch • Discord • YouTube). Then encourage your friends and fellow JourneyQuest fans to do the same – these signups allow us to build enthusiasm for the campaign and communicate important updates.
Additionally, this year we are adding Quests to our campaign. We know that our fans are our best promoters and we want to celebrate this! For all backers at any level, we will add exclusive digital rewards to your pledge for every quest completed.  
 *Final Quest rewards are contingent upon Kickstarter campaign success.
Throughout the campaign, our livestream studio will host JOURNEYQUEST’S MOST VICTORIOUS CHARACTER, Fartherall’s epic bracket competition. Your votes throughout the week determine which character will arise victorious from their encounter.  Every Thursday at 6pm Pacific, we will announce the winners of the current week's matchups and immediately go into live polling for the next round's winners who will be announced at the end of the livestream. In the final week of the campaign, we will live stream a 5-hour campaign countdown and finale on Friday, July 12th. 
In addition to the game, we will host regular JourneyQuest watch parties complete with live commentary. Be sure to watch the "Upcoming Events" section above as well as our social media channels to make sure you don't miss a thing! 
SHIPPING
IMPORTANT: WE CHARGE FOR SHIPPING AFTER THE CAMPAIGN IN BACKERKIT, NOT IN KICKSTARTER.
Do NOT add shipping fees to your pledge now. 
Anything that you pledge over the cost of a reward level will not count as credit in BackerKit and will go directly to the JourneyQuest 4 production. Only give more than a pledge level if you want us to spend your additional contributions making JourneyQuest 4 even more awesome.
FULFILLMENT
The JourneyQuest 4 campaign will be fulfilled by our partners at Ship Naked, who maintain shipping depots in the United States, Canada, Germany, and Australia. Barring circumstances outside our control (like tariffs or trade wars) we will fulfill physical rewards from those depots.
 What will shipping cost in BackerKit?
 International Backers: expect to pay around $7.75 in BackerKit for base shipping on the $50 reward.
 United States Backers: expect to pay around $5.75 in BackerKit for base shipping on the $50 reward.
All shipping estimates are subject to change but will reflect the best market rates we can find when fulfillment begins.
JourneyQuest is created by an ever-growing team of talented and passionate actors, producers, crew, and support staff. Together, we've not only produced three seasons of JourneyQuest, but the ongoing Gamers series, Dark Dungeons, Demon Hunters, Attacking the Darkness, Strowlers, and much more. 
While our budgets are still a fraction of what Hollywood spends, doing it right means taking care of our cast and crew. Your support is what lets us keep telling original stories that you can't find anywhere else!
We are excited to shoot this season in British Columbia with talented Canadian director Joanna Gaskell, the co-creator of Standard Action.
Showrunner and writer Matt Vancil has once again lent his talents to a hilarious season four script and will oversee production.
Producer Tony Becerra returns to oversee production. He is joined by Mike Waverecan, a producer from M1 Films. M1 Films joins Zombie Orpheus for production of this season.
Social media coordinator Lee House will add his considerable talents to spreading the word about this campaign far and wide.
Of course, it wouldn't be JourneyQuest without our phenomenal cast. This season we're thrilled to bring back Christian Doyle (Perf), Alyssa Kay (Nara), Fran Kranz (Silver Tom), Kevin Pitman (Glorion), Brian Lewis (Carrow), Emille Shimkus (Wren), Jesse Lee Keeter (Rilk), Bob Sapp (Karn), Samara Lerman (Assassin), and many more! 
Zombie Orpheus Entertainment is pleased to team up with The Fantasy Network, a fan-supported, creator-distributed streaming service, to broadcast every JourneyQuest episode. In addition to works from Zombie Orpheus Entertainment, The Fantasy Network distributes original programming from Arrowstorm Entertainment (Mythica), The Forge Studios (The Rangers), Recursor.tv (Nina Unlocked) as well as numerous independent producers (AFK, One Hit Die, Ren the Girl With the Mark). While many titles are available on The Fantasy Network for free, your pledge of $10 or more unlocks one month of Fantasy Network subscriber-exclusive access.
We will be using BackerKit for pledge management after the campaign. A BackerKit survey will be sent to all backers several months after the Kickstarter campaign has completed. You will be able to update your address, add shipping fees and shop our pre-order store for any additional items from our back catalog that you would like to add to your shipment. 
Our shipping partners at Ship Naked will be handling warehousing and shipping for our campaign from their warehouse in the US. If we have a sufficient number of international backers, we will utilize their warehouses in Canada, Germany and Australia as well.
World of Fartherall is available for your storytelling and art under ZOE's new Shared Cinematic Universe License Agreement (the SCULA).
What does this mean?
It's like the Open Gaming License and Creative Commons had little license babies: it's an agreement that gives you permission to create, adapt, and release your own derivative works within the world of Fartherall!
Check out the web page for the full details, but the fast and dirty summary is that as long as you abide by the terms of the agreement, you have the freedom to create non-commercial AND commercial Fartherall derivatives. Make a roleplaying game. Shoot a web series. Create your art. Sell it if you want. Or give it away. It's your choice.
You, the fans, have made these works possible and this new agreement helps us give back. Come and play, you're invited!
Just remember to Share Alike, Transform (don't copy), provide accurate Attribution, and don't break the law.
Plus, if you want your creations to become a canon part of the world, we offer a path to make them official. And a cool seal. It's pretty awesome. 
ZOE and JourneyQuest are committed to cultivating healthy, inclusive communities where everyone is welcome. We extend that mission to improving representation both on screen and behind the camera. We're stronger when we work together to achieve common goals!
We welcome fans old and new to the community that will come together during this Kickstarter campaign and remind everyone that hate speech is not tolerated in this space. 
Our moderators are trained to help if you experience harassment in any ZOE-managed social arena. If we happen to miss it when it happens, please don't hesitate to reach out and let us know, so that we can take action to resolve the issue.
We are always happy to assist! If you have a question that was not answered here, please send us a message through Kickstarter or via the contact form at zombieorpheus.com.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While we work hard to mitigate our risks, the unforeseen can always throw a curve ball. Sometimes we have to recast a role at the last minute. Sometimes we have to redo work in post if it doesn't meet our standards. Sometimes product gets delayed at the manufacturer. And any time international travel is involved, we have to be prepared to adapt and adjust with circumstances outside our control. But with a nine-year track record of crowdfunding success at Zombie Orpheus Entertainment, our reputation should speak for itself. 

Additionally, we now have excellent relationships with manufacturers, our fulfillment partners at Ship Naked, the team at BackerKit, and everyone else who's part of making sure that our campaigns are completed to your satisfaction. 

Our pledge to you is that we will always do our utmost to deliver on our commitment to excellence.

NOTE: We have budgeted for rewards and production based on current treaties, exchange rates, and tariffs. Given political volatility in the USA and elsewhere, we want to make special note that our plans may require significant revision should domestic or global turbulence affect the production of JourneyQuest Season Four.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello everyone!
Several backers have requested updates.
The pandemic continues and we are still waiting for it to be safe to shoot. Once a potential production timeline becomes clearer we’ll have so much more to share. In the meantime, we’re working on scripts, podcasts, livestreaming, and other projects that can be done safely from home. Thanks for your patience as we put the safety of our cast and crew first!

updates.update_userinfo: Want a copy of the Deluxe Fartherall Companion? Kickstarter is live now!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
A huge thanks to the 836 backers who participated in our animation survey. The results were incredibly helpful as we discerned a way forward. (Want to see the detailed responses? Scroll to the end of this update!)
THE NEW PLAN

Hi everyone!
It feels like a year has passed since our last update, even though it's just been a month. What a strange, whirlwind period we have entered. In one sense we're in a complete holding pattern... and in another we've never been so busy. Here's what's happening at Zombie Orpheus as we adjust to life in isolation.
ZOECON IV – April 24-25

Dear JourneyQuest Cast, Crew, and Backers–
As you know, the global situation regarding COVID-19 continues to evolve on a daily basis. With that in mind, the JQ production team wanted to reach out and share detailed information about our plans.
The crucial news is that after assessing new guidelines issued this morning by Washington State health authorities, as well as the increasing infection rate in the Seattle area, we have determined that we are unable to continue with production as planned.

campaign.story:
Update July 24 - LAST DAY! Yet another stretch goal, announced today: a bonus story by John C. Hocking for all backers! Stretch goal bookmarks for all! And more stretch goal news, and The Legion of the Skull returns! All subscribers receive four stretch goals! First, a copy of "Cubicles of the Magician's Skull"! This booklet compiles the hilarious missives from the immortal sorcerer Skull who is our leader, publisher, and mascot! And secondly, a never-before-published Morlock story by James Enge, plus a new story by John C. Hocking! And a new bookmark! Additionally, backers at the Legion of the Skull level will receive a booklet of essays on sword-and-sorcery literature!
Tales From the Magician's Skull is a printed fantasy magazine dedicated to presenting all-new sword-and-sorcery fiction by the finest modern crafters in the genre. These stories are the real thing, crammed with sword-swinging action, dark sorceries, dread, and ferocious monsters -- and they hurtle forward at a headlong pace. 
Last year, we published issues #1 and #2 to great acclaim. The stories were well-received, and the fans demanded – more! MORE! We hear you, fans, and the Skull is prepared to grant your desire!
This Kickstarter launches issues #3 and #4, as well as subscriptions to future issues! 
Publication Schedule
Our goal is to publish Tales From The Magician’s Skull twice a year, with issues released in March and September each year. Issue #3 is complete and ready for printing, with a September release date. Issue #4 will release in March 2020, and others will follow bi-annually thereafter. Upon reaching issue #666, the Skull will travel to a higher plane and the magazine will end.
Subscriptions
Subscriptions are available at a 10% discount from single-issue pricing. Subscriptions are 4 issues in duration and are offered in print and PDF format. Just select the appropriate pledge level.
Print Format
With our first Kickstarter, we included a stretch goal to print the magazine on a luxurious textured, tan-colored paper stock that conjured memories of the pulp papers of years past. We love this format and will continue to print the magazine using this paper stock. It does mean a higher funding threshold, which we believe is worth it.
Interior illustration by Samuel Dillon
Issue #3
Issue #3 is brimming with 80 pages and contains 7 stories, each featuring a full page black-and-white illustration. When appropriate to the tale, maps to strange lands and martial arenas are included as well. Each story has been written, edited, illustrated, and laid out in classic pulp magazine format. A bonus section translates elements from each story - creatures, magic items, and more - into Dungeon Crawl Classics game terms. 
Issue #3 features fiction by James Enge, John C. Hocking, Howard Andrew Jones, Violette Malan, Joseph A. McCullough, Sarah Newton, and William King. The magazine is edited by Howard Andrew Jones and published by Joseph Goodman of Goodman Games, with layout by Lester B. Portly. An appendix by Terry Olson provides DCC RPG game statistics based on some of the stories.
Each story is lovingly illustrated by industry stalwarts, and issue #3 features art by Samuel Dillon, Justine Jones, Doug Kovacs, Brad McDevitt, Russ Nicholson, Stefan Poag, Matthew Ray, and Chuck Whelan. The cover is by the legendary Sanjulian.
Issue #4
We have already started recruiting stories for issue #4 but there is still more work to do. Our target release date is March 2020, and all will be complete by then!
Interior illustration by Samuel Dillon
Here are the stories in issue #3!
The Face That Fits His Mask, By William King
He could change in mid-spring, tear out the man's throat, feast on his bones, drink his blood. The beast of the change gibbered in the back of his mind, begging to be unleashed. His fingers splayed, his nails began to lengthen….
By That Much, By Joseph A. McCullough
“You claim not to know me, and that is probably best for you, but do me a last service. If you can, gather what remains of my body and give it a suitable place to rest.” 
Tyrant’s Bane, By John C. Hocking
Someone in the garb of a royal guardsman came out of the stairwell.  His blue armor was covered with blood and there was a fist-sized hole in his cuirass through which Benhus could see the wall behind him.  There was a sword in each hand and, as he advanced, the dead man lifted both weapons.
Five Deaths, By James Enge
The heavy stone door moved easily upon its hinges; Morlock pulled it open and stepped through cautiously. Lernaion was about to follow when there was a sudden bodiless screaming and the door slammed shut.
The Forger’s Art, By Violette Malan
His head wore a surprised look when it landed a few feet away. The body slumped to the ground, pumping out blood onto the grass. 
“Why do people always talk too much?” Parno wiped his sword clean on the dead stranger's tunic.
The Second Death of Hanuvar, By Howard Andrew Jones
Hanuvar twisted, parried a blow that would have caved in his skull, and lost his balance. He saw the pit yawning, and the flame more than twenty feet below.
The Wizard of Rememberance, By Sarah Newton
The memnovore towered over him, its mouth distending into a translucent sleeve of slime. Acid burned Suven’s flesh, and he screamed. In the demon’s larval embrace, he prayed for oblivion.
Table of contents page for #3
Maps 
This is a small detail, but we think it's important. The early issues of pulp literature occasionally included illustrated maps and diagrams to help the reader understand the fantastic places being explored by pulp heroes. 
Tales From the Magician's Skull does the same. Doug Kovacs, famous for his fantastically illustrated maps in the role-playing-game space, has provided illuminated maps to explain some of the stories' locations. 
The T-Shirt
"There is no greater honor than to wear my visage upon your frail husk," says the Skull. "And now you can achieve this honor with a mere 25 of your monetary units. Dollars, I believe they are called." Simply select the T-shirt pledge level if you only want a tee. If you want a tee in addition to the magazine, select the magazine pledge level you want and add +$30 (which is $25 T-shirt cost plus $5 shipping).
Back Issues
We still have copies of issues #1 and #2 available. Select the appropriate pledge level to purchase these back issues while they last!
 Shipping Costs 
Physical copies will be shipped as they are ready. When you make your pledge, shipping charges will be applied. They are as follows: 
USA: $5 per issue
Canada, UK, and EU: $10 per issue
New Zealand and Australia: $15 per issue
Rest of world: $20 per issue 
Interior illustration by Justine Jones
 Game Statistics for DCC RPG 
Goodman Games is the publisher of this magazine, and also the publisher of the Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game (a.k.a. DCC RPG). Tales From the Magician's Skull will include a short appendix at the end of each issue with DCC RPG game statistics for the monsters, non-player characters, and magic items that appear in the stories. The inimitable Terry Olson has provided the DCC RPG stats. 
A Closing Word From The Skull

campaign.story:
The Dark Trails RPG is a game which pays homage to the popular weird West genre.  It can be used as a standalone game or as the perfect complement to a growing line of products that all utilize the rules found in the Dungeon Crawl Classics (DCC) RPG.   As a player, you’ll find a wealth of material that allows you to assume the role of one of 11 unique classes, with descriptive names like: the Calavera, the Bedlamite, and the Sin-Eater.   As a Judge, you’ll find over 400 pages of material giving you a wealth of resources for designing and running fantastic adventures set against the haunted landscapes of an unforgiving weird West. 
You may be wondering about the above mentioned game that Dark Trails is tethered to. Dungeon Crawl Classics is a Fantasy RPG written by Joseph Goodman of Goodman Games. Since debuting in 2012, the book has gone through seven (7) printings and spawned a wonderful community of passionate gamers both new and old. DCC continues to grow by leaps and bounds by way of exciting adventures penned by some of the best writers in the industry, including third-party publishers using the system to fuel their own creative fires.
Fortunately, the Dark Master (Joseph Goodman) has granted permission to include a modified version of the DCC ruleset within the pages of Dark Trails to make it the first 3rd party published work to include the necessary rules for play. You don’t need anything other than the Dark Trails RPG to play the game aside from some dice, paper, and pencils. 
Some of the DCC rules were purposefully left out when weighed against their place in a weird West setting, but these omitted rules can easily be added to Dark Trails should you own a copy of DCC and wish to include them.
 This Kickstarter funds the standalone hardcover book for the game. Funds raised will be used to pay for additional art, editing, and layout for a quality book made by traditional offset methods to ensure it is as durable as it is beautiful. 
 Dark Trails is the product of three years of writing and playtesting by author David Baity. You may remember David from his first DCC adventure “Carnival of the Damned” published by  Purple Sorcerer Games. While David has handled the majority of the writing chores with the Dark Trails RPG, lots of folks have thrown their name into the hat to help flesh out the magic and bestiary sections. Daniel J. Bishop, Brandon Goeringer, Bob Brinkman, Diogo Nogueira, and Jeff Scifert are just a few of the talented minds that have worked their magic to make Dark Trails something truly special.
For one of the two editions of the game we've commissioned none other than the legendary SanJulian to grace us with a beautifully painted cover filled to the brim with "weird." You can see a few more of SanJulian's DCC covers below, and be sure to check out his website  for several works you've probably seen grace the covers of your favorite novels and other publications over the years.
Who else is on board to help to bring the world of Dark Trails to life? Over the last two years, the author has recruited some of the best up-and-coming artists in the industry. The Dark Trails RPG currently features work by Angga Augustiya, Todd McGowan, Christopher Torres, Simon Todd, Danny Prescott, Adam Slivka, David Hoskins, Aaron Robinson, MARCINs, David Coppoletti, and Diogo Nogueira.
Additional funds raised by the Kickstarter will help continue to fund new art from the above-mentioned artists, in addition to work by Stefan Poag, Peter Mullen, and Bradley K. McDevitt, just to name a few!
 Dark Trails will be printed in two editions (standard and limited edition), both are hardcover books  8.5” x 11” trim size. The books will be printed in the USA by offset printing methods to ensure the quality of the book meets consumer expectations.  Currently, we plan to keep the interior printed in B&W on 60# paper and stitched binding. 
 The standard edition will feature a full-color cover painted by iconic artist, Sanjulian (Creepy magazine, Vampirella, etc.) while the limited edition will feature a leatherette cover, accented with metallic foil stamping and an embossed version of the Dark Trails RPG logo. The ultimate goal with the limited edition is to create something that looks like it was pulled right out of the Old West! 
Below, you can see mock ups of each book to give you an idea of what we're visualizing. The painting used to represent the standard edition is not the final Sanjulian cover, and both covers are subject to change. 
A mock-up of the standard edition. This is not the actual cover and all elements are subject to change
A mock-up of the limited edition leatherette edition. All elements are subject to change.


 The weird West genre is certainly well represented in the RPG industry, but those wishing to find a fully developed weird West RPG that utilizes a class-based system based upon the DCC RPG will be sadly disappointed. Dark Trails fills a niche for a DCC based weird West RPG by providing 11 original character classes paired with innovative rules designed to leave your players feeling like they’ve just spent several hours adventuring in a Western landscape where the emphasis is placed upon the weird!


You’ll find several classes to choose from within the pages of the book, so let’s give you a basic rundown of what you’ll find. 
Bedlamite: Absent-minded inventors constantly constructing inventions that defy all logic, including “wondrous” contraptions that are brought to life by their creator’s sheer force of will. Bedlamites often become addle-brained and introverted, preferring the company of their automatons to that of their allies.
Calavera: Spirit-mediums, most often female, that can both see and speak to the nearby dead wandering the closest regions of the Spirit Lands. The calavera shines like a beacon in the night to the restless dead, eager to have her deliver a message, or perform one last task that will put the spirit to rest. Aiding in those tasks marks her as a veritable queen of the underworld and the dead are not only willing to share some of their dark secrets but also have been known to reach across the grave to protect their only connection to the land of the living.
Gambler: With the big changes running through the weird West, the gambler could be called the chosen paladin of Lady Luck, able to manipulate the ebb and flow of chance like an occultist weaves arcane energy. Gamblers alter the probability of events going on in their surroundings and have a skill set that favors thievery and subterfuge.
Gunslinger: Sometimes, a poor soul is cut down before their time, and when that person is a law-dog or hardened soldier even death isn’t enough to discourage them from staying in the fight. These restless spirits possess the guns they died with and send out a call to those deemed worthy of carrying them. Gunslingers find their uncanny skill at gunplay supernaturally elevated by the spirits of vengeance that choose them.
Luchador: A luchador is most often a person noble of heart seeking the thrill of martial combat in and out of the sacred ring. In addition to high-flying acrobatics coupled with raw strength and fortitude, luchadores gain the ability to tap into their inner spirit, channeling it through their masks for supernatural effects.
Mountebank: The typical “snake oil salesman” of the frontier, these amateur alchemists and full-time showmen find that the events of the Seven Days of Night have unlocked a doorway to the mind that reveals recipes that defy all logic and, once brewed, resemble the magic potions of legend.
Mystic Monk: Trained in the sacred art of martial arts and schooled by master philosophers, the mystic monk is a humble warrior wandering the weird West in search of enlightenment. In addition to being a master of martial arts, the mystic monk can summon his inner chi, a virtual battery of spiritual energy used to perform superhuman feats.
Occultist: Occultists devote their lives to the mastery of the ambient arcane energies constantly flowing around all living things, learning to weave and channel them to miraculous effect through spell work. Occultists are considered master investigators and have a nose for all things arcane and unusual.
Revelator: The revelator serves as a bastion of faith to those seeking refuge from the madness infecting the world. They can perform divine healing and miracles in addition to serving as a bane to evil creatures—both living and dead—all while serving as a pillar of faith to those that still believe in the comforting words of The Good Book.
Sin-Eater: During the Seven Days of Night, no souls were granted passage to the Underworld and instead were cursed to wander the Spirit World where they were preyed upon by creatures native to the realm, or worse, taken as slaves by their own kind. Charon, lord of the ferrymen, knows an abundance of restless spirits could potentially unravel the barrier between worlds. Some ferrymen are hand selected by their lord to return to the surface world in order to shepherd lost souls to the afterlife and destroy those that prey upon them by using River Rites and the soul-aegis, a weapon that strikes fear in the hearts of the wicked.
Tommyknocker: Sometimes, a soul is just too pissed off to pass on and needs to get a slice of vengeance before taking that ride into the sunset. Tommyknockers are walking corpses for almost all intents and purposes, but the strength of their soul is such that it acts as a furnace, providing a means to animate its corpse-shell to take care of unfinished business. In addition to an unnatural strength, the tommyknocker is one of the toughest hombres found in the weird West.
If you’re a fan of the DCC magic system, you’ll be familiar with how things are done. If you’re new to DCC styled magic you’re in for a real treat! Spells can be cast multiple times if you continually roll high enough. Roll low and you might lose the spell for a day, or worse, suffer from the effects of corruption! On top of being able to cast known spells multiple times, the total of your roll means potentially casting that low-level magic missile spell with effects so strong that you just might wipe the playing field with your trusty “finger guns.” In addition to a full complement of spells and miracles found within the pages of Dark Trails, you can import any of the 120+ existing spells found in the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG into your game, should you own the book.
You’ll find over 150 spells, wondrous contraptions, elixirs, and miracles within the pages of Dark Trails, but we didn’t stop there. In addition to the above, you’ll find a reliquary of beneficial and cursed magic items, along with rules and tables for crafting magical firearms. 
The author of the Dark Trails RPG really wants to present you with a game that has some innovative rules that help capture the feel of a Western-themed game. You’ll find several interesting mechanics scattered throughout the book (some that you may even wish to port to your DCC game), but the main rules that make the Dark Trails RPG a horse you’d want to throw a saddle on include:
New rules for firearms that incorporate a standard poker deck, including specialized critical hit and fumble tables.
Boons & Hexes represent a run of good/bad luck your character might be having during a typical session. They’re awarded based on things like exceptionally good/bad die rolls, true heroics, and great role playing.  Boons earned can be spent for in-game perks, while Hexes increase your chances of receiving more disastrous results on fumble and fear charts. In addition, they affect how NPC interactions pan out—consider the unlucky cowboy to have a dark cloud following him around.
A new system that replaces the “standard” alignment mechanics found in most RPGs. The new system helps tell the story of how decisions determine the path a character may walk and how that path affects their reputation when dealing with NPCs.
An innovative system for fear and madness that simulates a character’s ability to handle both physical and emotional stress during the adventure, including an extensive list of mental disorders for those who slip too deeply down the rabbit hole!

 Lot's of folks are hard at work putting their twist on the weird West genre. For starters, you can check out Thick Skull Adventures "The Last WIll and Testament of Obediah Felkner." Author Stephen Newton is close to launching his exciting take on a weird West adventure that blends perfectly with the Dark Trails RPG. You can find more info at Thick Skull Adventures 
You can also take comfort in knowing some talented up-and-coming writers in the gaming community have become so inspired by past playtests that they’ve taken the initiative to start writing Dark Trails adventures. 
There’s no bigger compliment for an author than to learn folks think enough of their game to create material before the book is even released! The author has big plans to produce both free and paid content once the book is released into the wild. This includes supporting those who wish to produce their own Dark Trails material!
You’re going to love the bestiary in this book! Over seventy-five creatures have been pulled from the works of Lovecraft and the pages of folklore from all around the world! Several notable folks have thrown their passion into helping make the bestiary something special, including but not limited to: Daniel J. Bishop, Jon Hook, Brandon Goeringer, Bob Brinkman and more! 
You’ll also find that several included creatures contain charts with all sorts of tweaks and nasty surprises to make each encounter terrifying and unique!

Sometimes, a Judge has a hard enough time wrangling up a posse, let alone coming up with a trail-ready adventure to keep'em busy! Don't you worry, partner, we got you covered! You’ll find a complete 0-1st level action-packed adventure included within the pages, and a ready-made town filled with personalities to get you started on the trail.  As we reach stretch goals, more material gets added.  
 What Kickstarter would be worth its weight in whiskey if it didn't have some awesome stretch goals to sweeten the pot? We hope we'll see some of these reached, and if you surprise us and beat them all, we'll just have to up our game and bring something bigger to the table!
US $12,000: Congrats to the posse! Check your irons and saddle the horses cause we ride at dawn!
US $14,000: We’ll throw in a satin ribbon bookmark in both physical versions (standard and limited edition) of the book.
US $16,000: We need a bigger zoo! As it stands, there are 75 creatures for you to pluck from the pages of the book, but the author thinks you could stand for a little extra tooth and tentacle! If the project hits US $16,000, we’ll raise the count to 100 agents of darkness!
US $18,000: The Dark Trails RPG already comes with a bountiful arcanum filled with wondrous contraptions, potent elixirs, and powerful spells, but there’s room for more! If we reach the US $18,000 mark, we’ll add an additional 50 spells and miracles to raise the total entries to 200!
US $20,000: How do you expect to get around in the weird West without a map to properly represent the states and territories as they currently stand? The Seven Days of Night brought about supernatural changes to all things, including much of the land! If we reach US $20,000, we’ll bring on master cartographer Jared Blando to craft a black and white map to be used for end sheets.
US $22,000: Dark Trails is filled to the gills with 11 playable classes, but there’s room for one more, as we love even numbers! If we can reach US $22,000, author Pete Spahn (Operation White Box) has agreed to throw a 12th class into the book.
US $24,000: Judges bringing the weird West to the table are going to need something pretty to spruce up those custom screens, and it needs to be as functional as it is purdy! Once we hit the US $24,000 mark, we’ll make PDF screen inserts and have one of our artists create some original full-cover art to show the players.
US $26,000: The limited-edition hardback already comes with foil stamping, but if we can reach the US $26,000 mark, we’ll throw some “shiny” on the standard-edition cover and spine as well!
US $28,000: The Dark Trails RPG already comes with an adventure to get you up and running, but if we reach the US $28,000 mark, we’ll include a second adventure penned by the legendary Daniel J. Bishop! Daniel is eager to have a go at bringing terror to the world of Dark Trails, and we’re excited to be able to include an adventure from his twisted mind.
US $30,000: Remember that black and white map we mentioned way back at US $20,000? Well, let's bump it up to full color to get a real taste of what a Western map might look like back in the day! Take a gander at Jared's color work.
US $34,000: We're going to offer up a form fillable character sheet for both the funnel style and higher level character sheets! Now, you can show up to the campfire with a spiffy character sheet on your favorite electronic device!
US $36,000: Bob Brinkman, my go to guy for all things Cthulhu, has agreed to lend a hand by way of writing a complete adventure to add to the growing library of material available for the Dark Trails line! Bob has a long list of writing credits to his name (DCC, MCC, Lankhmar DCC and Dying Earth MCC) and can also be heard on the amazing Sanctum Secorum Podcast . 
All backers will receive the digital PDF version of the yet to be named adventure for free by way of DriveThruRPG at the time of fulfillment. The adventure will also be made available as a physical add-on at the discounted price of $12.00 (retail $15.00). Expect to see this adventure sometime in the 1st quarter of 2020.
US $40,000: I can't let my friends hog all of the fun, so at this level you'll have another adventure thrown into the stew-pot written by yours truly! Don't take my word for it! Ask anyone who's played through my published adventure "Carnival of the Damned".or in any of my convention games, and you'll get the idea of how much creepy I inject into all things related to RPGs! 
All backers will receive the PDF version of the yet to be named adventure for free by way of DriveThruRPG at the time of fulfillment. The adventure will also be made available as a physical add-on at the discounted price of $12.00 (retail $15.00). Expect to see this adventure sometime in the 1st quarter of 2020.
US $44,000: I'm totally stoked to announce this one! If you've played Dungeon Crawl Classics then chances are you've played, or run an adventure by the legendary DCC author,  Michael Curtis ! Michael is the main man behind the popular Chained Coffin boxed set , and the soon to be released Lankhmar boxed set . This is in addition to a treasure trove of other Dungeon Crawl Classics adventures.
Michael has agreed to lend his talents to a Dark Trails adventure! I can't tell you how excited I am by this stretch goal, and if you're a DCC fan I'm sure you'll be just as giddy! 
All backers will receive the digital PDF version of the yet to be named adventure for free by way of DriveThruRPG at the time of the adventures fulfillment. The adventure will also be made available as a physical add-on at the discounted price of $12.00 (retail $15.00). 
Due to Michael's busy schedule we can only promise that the adventure will be delivered sometime in 2020. 
US $47,000: What kind of scoundrel would I be if I didn't offer you up a poster of the magnificent cover Sanjulian painted for the project. If we reach the 47K mark you will receive one folded 11x17 poster of the cover image free of charge. Free? Yep, that's right, amigo!It's my way of saying thanks for saddling up for this weird posse on the trail! Posters will ship with all standard and limited edition versions of the Dark Trails RPG. 
US $50,000: What would make for an awesome new stretch goal for the Dark Trails RPG campaign? How about if I throw in another original adventure penned by none other than the legendary Harley Stroh? Yep, polish yer' boots up cause Harley's coming to the dance, and he's loaded for bear! 
For those not familiar with Mr.Stroh, you can check out his amazing contributions to the hobby through the years here.  Harley is well known for the amazing "Peril on the Purple Planet" boxed set in addition to a slew of adventures that most folks consider a must have when running Dungeon Crawl Classics! 
All backers will receive the digital PDF version of the yet to be named adventure for free by way of DriveThruRPG at the time of the adventures fulfillment. The adventure will also be made available as a physical add-on at the discounted price of $12.00 (retail $15.00).You will be invoiced separately for shipping once it is ready for fulfillment. 
Due to Harley's busy schedule we can only promise that the adventure will be delivered sometime in 2020. 
 US $53,000: Hang on to your hats, partner! I'm not done with you quite yet when it comes to DCC writers! How about if we throw one last original adventure into the stew-pot to see just how hungry you really are while you're waiting in the proverbial chow line ? I can personally attest to the madness festering in the mind of the DCC madman known as, Brendan LaSalle! Anyone who has ever attended a convention where Brendan was a guest will agree that this man has an addictive energy about him that makes for one of the best judges you'll ever get to roll bones with. 
Brendan is responsible for several exciting DCC/MCC adventures, and is the creator of the addictive Xcrawl RPG (And version is currently in the works for the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG!). If you are lucky enough to find a seat at one of his games, tell him Baity sent you and see what sort of horrific death your character suffers!
All backers will receive the digital PDF version of the yet to be named adventure for free by way of DriveThruRPG at the time of the adventures fulfillment. The adventure will also be made available as a physical add-on at the discounted price of $12.00 (retail $15.00). You will be invoiced separately for shipping once it is ready for fulfillment. 
Due to Brendan's busy schedule we can only promise that the adventure will be delivered sometime in 2020. 
US $55,000: You will receive a free folded copy of the map being created for Dark Trails by Jared Blando! I've been searching for a company that can handle the task, and I think I've finally settled upon a good choice. The exact dimensions of the map have yet to be determined, but you will have something close to a 34"x 22" map. Final size will depend upon folding dimensions, as we want to be sure the map will fit neatly inside the cover of the hardback. Maps will ship with all physical standard and limited editions of the Dark Trails RPG. 
US $56,000: With all the content included in the Dark Trails RPG you're going to need another way to keep those important sections marked! We're going to throw in a second ribbon bookmark to help keep you from forming blisters on your fingers while flipping pages! Bookmarks will only be included in physical copies of the standard and limited edition book!

Need some fancy doo-dads to help your time on the trail go a little smoother? We've got a few items that just might help ease you into the saddle.
Physical copy of Bob Brinkman's stretch goal adventure $12 : You'll receive a physical copy of the stretch goal adventure written by the author. Shipping to be determined at the time of fulfillment.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Backing someone with no Kickstarters under their belt can certainly make one hesitant to pull the trigger on any project. 

Author David Baity has been an active member in the DCC community for several years and made sure the project was near completion before launching any form of crowdfunding to help wrap the book up. He has spent several thousand dollars of his personal funds over the years to purchase art, promotional items and freelance writing with the larger chapters of the book. 

With the rough draft complete, work will begin immediately at the end of the Kickstarter, with editing and layout handled by a team of talented veterans with several products under their belt. Additional art has already been commissioned along with the gathering multiple quotes for a quality hardback book that really represents the years of hard work put into the Dark Trails RPG.

In short, we've tried to cover all of our bases before launching the Kickstarter and feel the risk to you as our backer has been minimized. We hope to make this the first in a long line of products to keep your weird west games going for years to come.

updates.update_userinfo: One Tube to Rule Them All
updates.update_content:
Heya, everyone!

I wanted to wait until the last minute tonight to post an update, in hopes I'd have something super cool to share with you on the core book. Sadly, I don't have the news I thought I would, but I do have some cool news, so let's get the core book update out of the way first?
As I wrote about in the last update, we're in the final stages of readying the document to go to print. Some things were apparent while we were going through the final pass. First, Gilbert commented on some of the pages having too much "white space", which I agreed with. I'm way over budget on art, so I'd hoped we could get by with it, but when Gilbert brought it up I knew it needed to be addressed and immediately hired some of the regular Weird Frontier artists to kick something out fast, and the end result is the art that will fill up those ugly pages with too much "empty". Take a look at a couple of the pieces.

Heya!

I just wanted to give you guys an update on where things are right now. It has mostly been a waiting game to get the final edits plugged in and turned in to Matt for layout. We've taken everything that folks have submitted by way of the living bug-squashing document and added the things we found on our own to make one master list. While there were a few that were left out we still made a long list of changes to make to the document. 
The list of changes was submitted to Matt to plug into the layout this week and he's already gotten the document back to me. The only thing that remains is to make one last pass and make the index. As you can tell by the size of the document this is no small task, but we're on it and I'm hoping we'll be wrapped up by end of next week. Once we have the index I'll get the updated PDF to you and also submit the document to the printer.

I have the correct color dice on hand from Chessex and the dice bags were delivered today.  I hope you like the bags! I loaded one up for its modelling shoot and it comfortably ate 225 d6's, so you'll have plenty of space for those bones you love to throw.

I wanted to send out a quick update that relates to any third-party publishers that may be interested in creating something for the Weird Frontiers RPG. Those of you that are familiar with DCC/ MCC published by Joseph Goodman of Goodman games probably already know that Joseph supports, and often carries zines, adventures, and related merch created by third-party publishers.  Weird Frontiers wouldn't exist were it not for Joseph's generosity and strong desire to create such a broad and creative community!
I'll be following in Joseph's footsteps by offering the same option to those aspiring to create their own material for the Weird Frontiers RPG following the OGL that can be found in the back of the Weird Frontiers RPG, or the DCC/ MCC books.

I wanted to drop an update on you today to let you know what we've been up to since the release of the PDF document.  Before I get started I want to remind everyone that the PDF is currently out for backers, so if you haven't received it please reach out to me by way of a message here, or by e-mail at weirdfrontiersrpg@gmail.com

Typo Hunt- I'll be finishing up going through the document this evening looking for anything that needs a small tweak, or for typos. I'll be submitting my list to Gilbert Isla to compile with the online document you folks have been gracious enough to submit for us! I'll leave the ability to report any bugs open until this Sunday,  April 11th, so submit anything you find by following the link

campaign.story:
Beholden to the gods of dice and dungeons, Eldritch Foundry brings miniatures from the far reaches of the outer planes. But not any miniatures. Our expert team of Gnome Wizards work tirelessly to bring the most customizable and powerful figures for your character. Our sleek, seamless, flash-less miniatures are unrivaled in appearance and each is blessed by a team of Clerics. 
    Can’t find the perfect miniature for your Dwarven Fighter?  
Eldritch Foundry.
    Are the only miniatures available carrying a broadsword instead of a warhammer? 
Eldritch Foundry.
    Is the figure’s beard too short for your perfect avatar? 
Eldritch Foundry.
    Through dark and forbidden rituals, we have given you, the player, the ability to select everything about your character. Complete customization is now in the hands of the player. Whatever hands, head, tail, wings, clothes, weapons, and practically anything else you can think of, we can do. Even the most mundane of coin purses will look amazing on your character – through our high-quality 3D printing.  
 This project combines everything you want from a miniature - the original creative art, with the best quality that can be found for a customized unique printed miniatures.
*Warning: Miniatures may contain bonus Experience Points 
     The Eldritch Foundry has partnered with the leading US 3D printer manufacturer, 3DSystems, and our in-house printers utilize the most advanced technology available on the market. As such, we are printing at a quality that is substantially higher than anyone else. We print at about 40% higher definition than anyone else on the market.
Most miniatures currently available on the market are printed at around 50 microns. An Eldritch Foundry miniature is printed at around 32 microns. In addition, we use wax supports. This process means your miniatures will have no flash, no mold lines, and no seams. 
       Our character creator interface is like nothing you’ve seen before, except perhaps in video games. We have developed a one-of-a-kind character creator to a look and feel that closely resembles the character creators in Baldur’s Gate, Planescape, Torment, or even Skyrim (well, at least the starting bit). The interface is intuitive and easy to use, while providing for a maximum level of customization for your miniature.
    Each and every character choice, from race and class, to armor and weapons, has a unique lore associated with it. We have partnered with several brilliant writers (most notably- the amazing Patrick Stuart!) to create a lore that is as unique as our character creator. 
    This process, from the unique character creator to the expansive and in-depth lore,  makes creating a high quality and custom miniature more immersive and helps create a world-building experience.
       We have developed the first and only conditional marker base for your miniatures. This base allows for the quick and easy identification of conditional statuses of your character, without the need for conditional rings or milk jug rings. The conditions available on your unique Eldritch Foundry miniature base include poisoned, restrained, concentration, deafened, petrified, grappled, blinded, and frightened. We have even provided conditional marker bases that are blank, if you prefer to draw your own. We’ll even have an option where you can choose which conditions you want on your base (but that’s a bit more down the line).
      In order to bring you the finest quality miniatures, every piece is first individually drawn by gentle hands of our Tiefling concept artists. Then, these sketches are animated, given sentience, and turned into 3-dimensional models.  Our miniatures are then crafted from these models by an expert team of Gnome Wizards. This process is designed to bring you the highest-quality, unique, and magically enchanted miniatures possible. 
      To bring you more, we must first provide offerings to the lords of darkness and miniatures, who enslave hapless concept artists for no less than 99 years. These concept artists provide us with all the exquisite art, in order to bring the most realistic and beautifully rendered miniatures to you, the player.  Through this project we intend to bring you more items, races, mounts, perhaps a campaign setting, and even a little thing we think of as "the bits box".
       The Eldritch Foundry's founders are gamers, like you. We would like to let gamers take their character from the imaginary and make them a reality. To provide miniatures of the highest quality, both in the form of the model and in the quality, while using the latest in 3D printing quality available. More than that, table-top gaming is a community experience. As such, we provide services both with online sales and through friendly local gaming stores.  
Enjoyable and intuitive site - for the quick and easy customization of your characters.
Unique and original craftsmanship -of all the items, armor, weapons, clothes, and accessories your character will ever need.
Built-in status indicator bases - for quick and easy identification of character status' 
New origin lore written for Eldritch Foundry - making the character creation process much more immersive and interesting. 
Quality 3D printing - showing the finest detail available on the market, exactly as designed by you, the player.
      The Eldritch Foundry, a group of nerds and geeks dedicated to bringing the most unique and customizable miniatures available. We are committed to improving your games. And we are enthusiastic about our mission.
The Eldritch Foundry loves the TTRPG community- and acts on it with a business model that is geared towards helping your local gaming store thrive. We incentivize foot traffic by offering free shipping if you send your avatar to your local gaming store. We share in every miniature sale made within store grounds, and for every miniature sent to stores.
Retailers- feel free to reach out, we'd love to discuss this in person!
Our partner FLGS, Knight's Watch Games:
  "Eldritch Foundry is a revolutionary company that bridges the gap between producers, retailers and customers.  The ability for a customer to design, purchase and pick-up their customized miniature at the brick and mortar store facilitates better relationships between buyer and seller, guarantees a better shopping experience, and higher customer satisfaction. The immersive process of personalizing a character and reading the powerful descriptions for the various options makes building your dream character super entertaining!" - Brenda and Paraic Mulgrew of Knight's Watch Games
The Eldritch Foundry is a firm believer that the TTRPG community is just that- a community. We strive to work with everybody- from stores, to local artists, to gaming streams, and beyond. As such, we've begun partnering with the D4 D&D stream (go check them out!) to provide their gaming miniatures.
We've also started working with artists from the community which we love- first and foremost- the Griffon's Saddlebag (you can see his Retaliating Shield on some of our minis, even!).
      Based on past experience, we will be charging shipping after the Kickstarter concludes, based on the actual costs incurred to ship. We will collect this via our pledge manager after the campaign ends. This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping is rarely one size fits all.
US shipping (to your local gaming store)- FREE!
Rest of the world - shipping will cost $10.
 What is the Eldritch Foundry?
      We are two friends, who quit our day jobs, and founded Eldritch Foundry. We provide miniatures of the highest quality, both in the form of your miniature’s model and in the quality, while using the latest in 3D printing technology available. This process will give your miniatures a sleek, seamless, flash-less appearance not available in any other product on the market.
How do the miniature coupons work?
      All rewards for “custom miniature coupon(s)” are presented as coupons, and as such, are good indefinitely. This allows you to redeem at any point and even for future releases and features.  
When will the Miniatures Ship?
      Tricky question! Our full Character Foundry will be up and running August 1st, when we debut at Gen Con. We are currently gunning for a weeks turnaround (1-2 days to print, 3-6 days of shipping in the US), but a two week turnaround is a bit more likely (especially if we have a huge backlog). 
It should be noted that we will be adding more and more items, races, weapons and… stuff(?) as time progress, so if you have a specific idea for your mini, look up our development schedule on our site!
What about international shipping?
      Shipping to the US is free of charge. Shipping to Western Europe is going to add about 10$ on top of your pledge level.
How do I select more than one pledge goal?
     In Kickstarter you can only really select one pledge goal, but no worries. If none of the pledge levels are just right, pick the one closest to what you want, and you can adjust upwards later in our backer kit. 
Retailers - What are the typical cost of an Eldritch Foundry miniature in a retail store?
      Our current pricing point for a single miniature is about MSRP 35$. The conditional marker base should add another 10$ on top of that. Oversized models will run you about 10$ extra. 
We’re still looking into “bits” pricing and quantities, so that’s a big WIP right now.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
1) Development challenges

 We have been accepted as exhibitors at Gen Con 2019. As such, we have a hard deadline to have our character creator site up and running by August 2019. With this in mind, our current plan is to launch as soon as possible, with various additional features being introduced later on in the development phase. These additional features, which are being considered non-essential for initial launch, are thus marked down as a phase 2. For example, these additional features consist of features like “bits” purchasing and social media sharing with cool filters are lower on our priority list.
 In all regards, development of the product is largely complete with high-quality highly detailed miniatures. This project is intended to raise capital in financially reasonable way.


2) Asset creation:

 Our asset creation timeline is very much dependent on how successful the Kickstarter campaign is. Our current funding is enough to let us reach Gen Con 2019 with an already assembled asset library of high Fantasy weapon and armor sets, and the base races of Humans, Elves (& half-Elves), Dwarves, Goliaths and Halflings.
 The greater our success, the faster we hope to add additional assets and features to the system. However, there is an upper limit to how fast we can add additional assets, while still maintaining a high-quality of production. We will have a production schedule posted on our home website once we see how far ahead, we are. This will allow Eldritch Foundry fans to come and see new products and plan ahead for when their favorite race and genres come online.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
