I started modeling and sculpting my own 3D chibi anime miniatures during Christmas time in 2018. The journey that brought me to this point was that I had already collected all of the sets of chibi minis I could find on the market to paint for my D&D campaign, but I found out that the company I was following would no longer be making minis.
I love playing D&D, but once I had set my sights on a more anime style, the usual minis just wouldn't cut it. The first 5 minis in the Starter Pack are actually the original 5 players' characters in the campaign I'm currently running.
There are a few reasons I'm running this campaign. The first is that I invested some start up funds in getting together the illustrations for these ten. I plan to invest funds from this campaign into more illustrations for future projects.
The second reason is that I plan to look into more tools like a drawing tablet, zBrush, which I see many others in the space using with amazing results, and increased marketing efforts to build a social media presence I can go to for ideas and inspiration.
My final reason for running this project is a very long way out, but I've been inspired by fantasy board games that use minis like these and I'd like to one day make my own. If I can continue to create models and illustrations, it will be that much easier to convert them into collectible characters. 
Please Note: This campaign IS NOT for a boardgame, and it IS NOT for physical merchandise. The rewards include digital .STL files for 3D printing and .PNG files for digital art.

Pirate Warlock Sereva:
Anime Mini Pirate Warlock Sereva
Anime Miniature Pirate Warlock Sereva
Sereva comes from a family of very wealthy merchants, but her own father had her kidnapped by pirates at a young age for acting too free spirited; a quality he feared in Sereva’s mother. 
Rather than act like a damsel in peril, Sereva put her leadership skills and business savvy to work and was able to become the captain of the pirates who once captured her.
Sereva derives her magical abilities from a mermaid spirit she made a pact with out at sea and believes she is destined to find the magical item said to control the very waves: The Heart of the Sea.
Steadfast Fighter Cimon:
Anime Mini Steadfast Fighter Cimon
 From the northern reaches of Andraste, Cimon serves the Kingdom of the walled city of Locaste with great pride. The brother of an exiled fortune teller and a dragon master, he grew up struggling to make an honorable name for his family.
Cimon’s blue scimitars hold a secret. Sent to him by his mysterious brother, he continues to find clues about his own path, and that of his family.
The swords themselves aren’t the only piece of the puzzle. The note that came with them included writing from his brother, but also writing from an unidentified source.
Orphan Rogue Mahi:

Mahi is a young wood elf who was orphaned at a very young age. Not knowing her parents, she grew up feeling isolated and was met with great hardship even trying to find daily meals.
Naturally, she honed her skills to ensure her survival. Stealing food meant living another day, and this is what drove her forward.
Mahi enrolled in the military and protects her kingdom to achieve her two simple goals: Get 3 square meals a day and find friends to share them with.
Alice of Ravens:
 Alice grew up in a large family with five older siblings. Being the youngest in the bunch, she found herself overshadowed by their vast range of talents.
Once her family moved from the magical floating city of 
Eukalade to the non-magical walled city of Locaste, Alice dearly missed the days she could cast magic freely.
She strategically joined the military to gain access to the few areas of the walled city where magic was permitted and began to master her techniques with her raven staff in hand.
Nature's Protector Odessa:
 Odessa spent her childhood growing up within Locaste’s thirty walls. Coming from a family of bakers, fighting was never in her blood.
She got a taste for protecting others when a large, rabid dog broke loose and started attacking some nearby children.
Following her faith of the goddess Archena, Odessa decided on her paladin oaths and set forth to make the country safer for all.
Lolita Vampire Lobelia:
 Little is known about Lobelia the vampire; she seems to come and go as she pleases. It is rumored that she’s a fearsome fighter, but nobody seems to be able to provide an eye-witness account.
In truth, this playful devil loves to mess around with her “toys”—a word she uses to describe the unsuspecting victims of her games.
Her parasol keeps her safe from the sun’s harsh rays, but she’ll use it as a masterful weapon when the need arises.
Deadly Smile Ellie:
 Ellie suffered her first defeat at the age of three when her entire family was murdered by bandits. Sadness was never an option for her; there was one lesson to learn.
“The strongest are the killers, and they’re the ones that survive.”
This mantra fueled her every decision and she soon found herself standing atop a metaphorical mountain of the hundreds of lives she had taken.
“You certainly look strong. Let’s play a little...”
Plague Doctor Rust:
 If you’ve ever received treatment from Rust, consider yourself among the lucky ones. Rumors of this mysterious, seemingly decrepit man are many and varied, but it’s agreed that anyone who sees the shadows that follow him will die.
Rust will not talk to you, and it’s unknown if he’s even able to speak at all. He’s been seen deep in speechless conversation with small animals and birds, but one has to wonder if he looks upon them with evil intentions.
Just what is in those potions of his?
Healing Scripture Basil:
 Basil: the gentle angel sent from the heavens. His calm demeanor is certain to put you at ease as he remedies your ailments with his powerful healing magic, but you can’t help but wonder what his personal goals might actually be.
While the young angel appears to be an ally of the kingdom, he’s said to have been seen healing the crown’s enemies. Is he just so kind that he’s willing to heal those who are good and evil, or is there something deeper behind his actions?
“I’ve ensured you’ll all survive, but I must ask that you be more careful in the future.”
Rain of Fire Kress:
 Kress grew up in the western country of Robur. Here, his family has been stationed on the giant wall called the Thievesguard, where their sworn duty is to keep the thieves of the country Genii from invading their allied nation of Lenus.
Kress understands the importance of his duty on the wall, but what he truly wants is a change of scene. Channeling his innate magic to bring fire to the skies with his bright arrows, Kress tries his best to stay distracted from boredom.
“The wall’s greatest strength is it’s ability to stand still forever—my greatest disappointment.”

Goal
Hello! Our goal is to create a wide variety of high quality 3D printable miniatures priced affordably for $1!

Beginning
We are starting off with our $1 Miniature Set - Viking Raiders. If you back this set we will send the images displayed to one of our partnering professional 3D modelers, who will turn our sketches into 3D printable models for you!

Future
We have a voting page with access renewed monthly. If you select to back our project with a tier including voting rights you will gain access to our SCoFA page for the month the Quickstarter ends + the following month. We will submit ideas for future models to our SCoFA page for decisions on what models we should pursue next, as well as votes for other things we are working on.
We will also make all model miniature sets available on our website once they are developed, and you have our word that any models made under our $1 Miniature Set title will always remain $1 for everyone forever.

Ancient Cityscape
Our $10 tier includes a 50% off ($10 coupon) for our modular city core set. This is available on our website, and is comprised of 17 .stl 3D print files allowing you to build a custom ancient city. It also includes all tiers before it.
If you are interested, we have plans to develop a lot of add-on sets for this which we will make available in the future!
www.iungogames.com
Our $20 tier includes a 100% off ($20 coupon) for our modular city core set. Plus it includes a $3 coupon (worth 3 models) to our Grid Crates terrain scenery models. It also includes all tiers before it (*with the exception of the $10 coupon, as this is an upgrade to that).

Stretch Goals!
Available to all backers $3 and up! 
For every $200 increment above our Goal, you will receive another printable model!
We will hold votes with our SCoFA Voting Members to decide what these Stretch Goal models will look like. Next, we will develop the models with the Stretch Goal Kickstarter funds, and then will deliver them, in addition to our Viking Raiders set, to you!

Why are there double Tiers?
This is our very first Kickstarter, and we forgot to add clear stretch goals at the outset of our campaign! Once someone backs a tier we become unable to edit it, so we had to create duplicate tiers to add the Stretch Goal reward to them.

The Viking Raiders
We paid an artist to illustrate these three characters (Viking Raiders), and with our goal funded we will work with our partnering 3D modeler to make them 3D printable model miniatures!
We had a poll in which our backers voted to decide what position/pose they want these models to be in, and we have updated the illustrations to what they voted on!

Horns on the Helmets
We received feedback from our backers, almost half of them, would prefer a version of the models without horns on the helmets. Our 3D modeler has agreed to create this variation on the two models with helmets for an additional $20. campaign.story:
Animal Adventures brings intelligent animal character to your favourite fantasy roleplaying game! Cats and Catacombs is the second in a planned series of Animal Adventures releases! It is a set of highly detailed miniatures combining some your favourite cat breeds with different classes of the fifth edition of the world's greatest roleplaying game!
Hesta, Indy and Pawkus prepare for a new adventure.
This set features not only the miniatures in preassembled ready-to-play or paint PVC, but also a bespoke set of fifth edition compatible rules for using your Animal Adventure miniatures and playing as cats in ANY campaign setting.
Solan, Whisper and Pawkus lead the way!
You will be able to mix feline characters with your regular adventuring party or create an entire team of kitty heroes to save the world! The miniatures also make perfect companions and familiars for your existing characters in any fantasy setting or game.
Dare you enter the lair of the Necromeowncer?
Indy the Ragdoll Bard
Our range of feline characters are true cats, four legged companions true of heart and pure of souls! We have chosen to further our range of 'non-humanoid' minis to offer as much of a unique play experience as we possibly could.
Each cat has been lovingly designed and sculpted, by some serious cat fans, to be bursting with personality and detail. From the rune engraved robes of Hesta, the Wizard, to the Twin Fish of Harmony & balance on Han, the Monk, care has been taken to add charm and sophistication to every model.
Pawkus the Bobtail Barbarian
Whisper the Sphynx Sorcerer
Solan the Persian Warlock
Brook the Scottish Fold Cleric
Hesta the Abyssinian Wizard
The Necromeowncer
The Meow! Pledge $35/£27
After the success and the incredible feedback we received with our last campaign with Dungeons and Doggies, we have chosen to keep the same simple formula as it makes it easy for us to support and also ensures a smooth and swift delivery.
The Meow! Pledge brings you 13 kitty miniatures along with the Rules and Adventure Companion PDF's as well as art prints from our incredible art team!
Rather than include stretch goals that would complicate the process, in an attempt to encourage more participation, we are keeping things really easy with only one pledge level, that gets you everything we can cram into this campaign!
The future is looking very bright for Animal Adventures, and with your continued amazing support we are going to be bringing more animals on many more adventures!
The cats are all designed to go on 20mm bases and scaled to fit in with existing RPG miniature ranges. And, although we are providing full rules to create your own kitty adventures, each miniature comes with its own pre-generated character, complete with character sheet and short story! Whether you fancy being Verdandi, the Norwegian forest druid or Brook, the Scottish fold cleric, there's a cat for every player.
Alongside our range of miniatures, we are proud to present and include in our campaign a full set of digital rules and a unique adventure that provides a perfect setting for a great one-shot RPG experience, for absolutely free!
Our rules set contains OGL fifth edition racial rules for creating a courageous cat, unique feline feats and class options, feline feats and class options, notes on the Welcoming Dark, the Special Demiplane of cats,  world lore and trickster patrons and a host of feline magic items for your heroes to bat about and knock off shelves! 
The accompanying adventure, titled "The Lair of the Necromeowncer", is designed to be played either with the characters included in the rules or with any party of equivalent level (even dogs!) and tells of a dark magic at work deep underground, where sinister arcane power and mad science threaten devastation and ruin!   
Russ Charles is part of the team and principal sculptor behind Painting & Polygons which brought you Dungeons and Doggies! Russ has worked in the games industry for many years and has contributed to projects as wide ranging as Reaper Bones, Dr Who, Warmachine, Resident Evil 2, Guild Ball, Critical Role and more recently the Humblewood D&D setting. He currently works full time as lead in-house sculptor for SFG. 
Featuring stunning art from the likes of April Prime, who's previous work includes the excellent Baby Bestiary for Metal Weave Games and also our very own Dungeons and Doggies! We'd also like to welcome Vikki Gavrilenko to the team who has worked on DC's Injustice 2!
If you would like to find out more about the work both these amazing artists have produced then give them a follow on Twitter.
 www.artstation.com/april-prime, or by following her on Twitter, @April_Prime
 www.artstation.com/viccolatte, or by following her on Twitter, @viccolatte  
Also returning from the Dungeon and Doggies project is Kate who provided us all with the wonderful tales and lore that we all adored and Baz n' Gaz who provide us with the rules and mechanics allowing our animal friends to really come to life!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
=========
Challenges
=========

This is now our second Kickstarter project, even though our first project met all expectations and was a success, we are fully aware of the potential delays that may happen with products that are produced in China, the common ones being delays in production, shipping, and customs.

We have estimated delivery for January 2020, but please understand this is only an estimate. Due to the global logistics involved in shipping, some regions may receive their pledges sooner than others.

=======
Refunds
=======

We have prepared as much as possible with our production for a successful Kickstarter; however, we will refund pledges if for some unforeseen reason the product cannot be delivered at all.

Refunds may be given within 60 days of the campaign ending, including fees. After that time, refunds may be given minus the Kickstarter and payment processing fees, as we will not be able to claim those back after 90 days.

We are unable to issue refunds once we have begun the packaging and shipment stages of the project (around 6–8 weeks before the actual shipping date).

Refunds within 60 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit/debit card. Refunds after 60 days of the campaign ending are processed via PayPal only.

This is a GBP Kickstarter and refunds will be processed in GBP for the amount received, excluding any applicable fees dependent on the day on which the refund is processed as detailed above.

=================
Terms and Conditions
=================

If you do not confirm your shipping and pledge details within 10 weeks of our notification via email to confirm them, your pledge will be treated as abandoned. We will, however, look at each case sympathetically and try our best to satisfy each customer.

By pledging on this Kickstarter you agree that our responsibility to you is for shipping your order as entered into the pledge management system. You are responsible for import or other duties that may be payable to relevant tax authorities. You also accept that you are fully liable for incorrect shipping details and will risk your pledge being unable to be delivered or lost in transit.

By pledging on this Kickstarter you acknowledge that the final look and contents of the pledges may change and differ from what is presented at the start of the campaign.

If you do not accept the proposed terms please do not pledge on this Kickstarter project and wait for the global general release.

campaign.story:
Hear ye, hear ye!
Introducing Townsfolke 2: the Free Folke, a sequel to the original Townsfolke campaign that was funded in 2018. This time around we've got civilian/NPC miniatures from the varied fantasy races to help diversify your RPG/wargaming experience.
WHAT IS TOWNSFOLKE?
Townsfolke is a range of 3d-printable miniatures designed by us (Ill Gotten Games). This campaign is for the digital files (not finished miniatures). Townsfolke models (like much of our catalog) are designed to be easy to print at stock settings, and print without support material.
The miniatures from the core rewards printed in resin.
Each Townsfolke model can be printed with or without a textured base. Though optimized for stock FDM printing (with detail levels to match), you can print these models in resin as well (and can do so without support that way too).

WHAT DO I GET?
The base pledge ($15) gets you all 15 miniature files included in the core set:

IS THERE MORE?
You bet! Not only do we have an extensive range of existing Townsfolke sets available on our storefront (and included with a higher pledge level), but as we unlock stretch goals, every backer at the $25 level and higher will get bonus sets added to their haul. We'll update this space as stretch goals are revealed/added.

In addition to these new sets, we have an extensive range of Townsfolke sets that are currently available for purchase. These sets will also be added to pledges at the $70 level and higher.
Plus, we have a free starter set, featuring tavern patrons, town guards, a(n ominous looking) ferryman, and more!
And- we've released a special set, the Interplanar Dutchess with Pet Mimic, that's available for free via Thingivere! 

WHAT SCALE ARE THESE MINIATURES?
Townsfolke are firmly in the 32mm scale, which means they'll be compatible in size with Reaper Miniatures, CMON, modern Games Workshop models, Hero Forge, and most other contemporary/mainstream ranges. However, if you play in a specialty scale, you can easily re-size the models before printing. (If re-scaling, you'll probably want to print the base-free versions and base them afterward to keep fidelity with the rest of your collection.)
The guidelines above should work, but when in doubt, eyeball the scale change next to a model that you know is in the scale you want.

WHAT IF I DON'T HAVE A 3D PRINTER?
If you don't own a 3d printer (or know someone that does), some of our Patreon members are licensed to sell our Townsfolke models (along with the rest of our catalog of designs), and you can find a list of licensed printers here. It's not necessary for you to back this campaign to buy printed versions from our patrons, simply reach out to them and place an order!

MINIATURE GALLERY
Dwarf Traveler (on and off base) printed by Patreon supporter, Scott Frega
Various FDM prints (Ender 3) by Patreon supporter, Mike Sheridan.
Dwarf travelers on a journey, printed and painted by Patreon supporter, Stephen Renwick.
Pixie Pickpockets printed by Patreon supporter, Scott Frega
The Interplanar Dutchess taking Blue (her pet mimic) out for an off-leash stroll.

campaign.story:
Hello! welcome to the Monstro kickstarter, a large figure set of chibi styled 32mm miniatures cast in high quality resin. The inspiration around these figures are of old RPGs of yesteryear and the goal of creating miniatures that combine a bit of whimsy and retro game sprites. 
This project specifically is a collaboration between myself and a fellow everything artist David Johnson. We are both traditional sculptors that have transitioned to digital as well as molders and casters with around 20 years of experience combined. Miniatures are made in-house with quality in mind. We hope that will bring confidence of the pricing as well as insurance of knowing we are not only in care of the creation of Monstrous but also the manufacturing. Bases will be plastic unless otherwise stated. 
I have also finished and delivered upon a previous kickstarter and hope to show everything I have learned from mistakes to successes. Thank you for reading and I hope you enjoy the rest of the page! 
Shipping delivery date varies, 2020 is only the latest estimate if things go terribly wrong, but should expect deliveries as early as 3 months after the kickstarter. 
We'll do our best to get these packages to where they need to go and offer the best rates we can at the time. These are estimates and we'll do our best to manage customs costs with our shipping partners. 
Your address and shipping will be collected in the pledge manager
These are estimates and can be higher or lower depending on fees and weight.

Special thanks to
Eric Pyszka, for being a pain in our behinds. 
Kyung-Min, for his mighty efforts. 
Dave's wife Annie for not killing him. 
Nick J. for looking at stuff. 
and the folks at twitch that happen to still follow us despite us not streaming.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Death, death is essentially the only thing that will stop us from getting these figures to everyone. We're very confident on our abilities to mold and cast, which is around 20 years combined. Everything is being done in-house and nothing is being sent off, we control nearly every aspect besides hand delivering these packages to everyone. The timeline has been put down as a year to ensure of any hiccups such as fires, tornados, aliens abductions, or freak resin shortages. 

Joking aside, we both put our reputations in front of us and have much love for what we do, we do not plan to squander such a great opportunity you have placed in our passions.

Hello!, been a week or so and everything is going well in terms of production, had a bit of a hiccup the very first week with the printer with the dragon being not quite printed correctly but have since remedied the issue and now have correctly printed the dragon correctly. The dragon pictured is the final prototype with the base slightly warped due to peeling too early, which has been fixed. The dragon was printed in 4 parts, the base, tail half, neck half, and head but I really disliked how the seam line was a bit problematic at the tail and neck half so I decided to shrink down the body a tad bit to fit in the 3d printer instead it's at around 170mm now but only requires gluing at the head and to the base which is notched. I figured shrinking it down a tad bit would be better than having a very obvious seam line though I do apologize for the loss of about 20mm.

campaign.story:
Over $100k Canadian Raised! Four Stretch Goals Unlocked!
Time for some real Sweet Rolls!
I created Ice Cream Dice to address the severe lack of nearly edible looking dice in the marketplace. I believe I have succeeded.
OK, OK, that wasn't actually why I started Ice Cream Dice. I wanted dice that were fun, unexpected at a gaming table and a little bit whimsical, all while being usable. I started it because I was so tired of seeing the same dice offered on different sites, by different companies with different names. Names like 'Goblin's Blood' and 'Dragon's Blah Blah Blah'. 
When I got to thinking about fun and whimsical, ice cream came immediately to mind and I started on a journey to design the most ice creamy looking dice I could.
Neo, the classic flavor we all love to hate (well a third of it anyway).
Orange Dream, a dreamy mix of orange and cream.
Rainbow, also known as Schubert's Sherbet.
Your Favorite, whether your favorite is chocolate, coffee or caramel, this set has you covered with just a touch of cream.
Bubble Candy, old school bubblegum and carnival cotton candy.
Kiwi, it's even got the seeds!
The matte set on the left and the glossy d20 on the right.
Razzman, the Kickstarter semi-exclusive set. 
After this Kickstarter is done, Razzman will be offered once a year to celebrate the day this Kickstarter was fully funded.
Butterscotch: The epitome of potential. 
Butterscotch will be redone in production to look like Orange Dream. The original intent was to swirl white and a light brown with a highlight yellow/brown. Unfortunately, these are what I got and with no time to order more test sets, you'll just have to trust me. As you can see, I take my dice palettes very seriously, and will deliver on the potential of these dice.
The Dice You See are the Dice You'll Receive
Unlike some dice companies, there are no renders here, these are the dice you will receive. 
Except Butterscotch. 
Butterscotch will get the Orange Dream treatment with a brown and white gemini/swirled result.
Kiwi's numbers will be re-inked in a pale/golden yellow.
The Waffle Dish
This waffle dish is a Kickstarter Exclusive. They will never be made or sold again. These are each individually hand blown glass waffle dishes. They are made with borosilicate glass, which is often used in cookware. They are not as delicate as soft art glass, however, they are still fragile.
They are small. Roughly 1.5" - 2" high and about 2" - 2.5" across at the top.
This shot shows you how beautiful the inside is.
Ssssssssssstretch Goals
I could easily have done what most dice companies do and locked the popular dice designs behind fake stretch goals, but I won't. I could have easily found something that was sort of related to dice and offered that as a stretch goal, I didn't.
I'm a very small company (it's just me) and this is my first Kickstarter, so over complicating things to make it 'look' cooler seemed both dishonest and foolhardy. There's enough moving pieces already, and I'm confident I can deliver on these stretch goals.
QUICK EDIT: If you're stoked about the D6/D10 Sets and mini D6 Bricks, please read update #17. The graphic below will be changed to reflect the updated information later today.








Right about now you're saying to yourself, well, that's great and seems like you can deliver it all, but I WANT MORE! To that, I say, take a gander.
Add-ons, or...more ways to give me your money!
I have worked with small creators in our community to bring you two add-ons. These will both be available to add on to your order in Backerkit after the campaign ends.
Flavour of the Month
For $5 (approx. $4 USD / €3 / £3 ) You can take your kids, your friends or both on an Ice Cream Adventure written exclusively for Ice Cream Dice by Andrew Morley. The local ice cream maker has disappeared! It's up to your party to discover what happened to him. Along the way you may meet yourself some new elementals inspired by Ice Cream Dice. You'll receive a PDF copy of this sweet adventure by late June.
Handmade d4 Dice Bag
For $15 CAD (approx. $12 USD / €10 / £9 ) you will get a custom, handmade d4 shaped bag that holds over 100 dice! 
These are Ice Cream Dice exclusives. I partnered with people that could create things that were special, a bit whimsical and useful. These d4 dice bags aren't likely to be produced again. If you want one, this may be the only time to get one. The inside of this dice bag will be a waffle cone pattern, rather than polka dots.
Pins
For $5 CAD (approx. $4 USD / €3 / £3 ) You'll receive a soft enamel pin that will not only shout to the world you love dice, but also, ice cream.
If you love pins and just need a couple extra for every lapel you own, I got you covered! The pins are soft enamel with a rubber backing.
Ice Cream Dice Custom Dice Box
For $110 CAD (approx. $83 USD / €75 / £65 ) you can get yourself an Ice Cream Dice exclusive dice box made by the wonderful folks over at Dog Might.
For $150 CAD (approx. $114 USD / €100 / £85 ) you can get yourself an Ice Cream Dice box made out of stunning Wenge wood. This rare dark chocolate colored wood is stunning and sustainably sourced.
The folks over at Dog Might reached out to me after seeing my project and told me they had a great idea for a dice box. They weren't lying. These boxes have a lifetime warranty and are gorgeous. Dog Might only works with the best of the best in the industry. I will update this with more details and pictures once I have the prototype in my hands and have all the information.
From Dog Might:  The Dog Might Ice Cream Dice Box is crafted from Flame Birch wood and features a hand applied finish. It comes with a removable foam insert cut to cradle your set of dice perfectly. Remove the foam to easily carry two full sets of polys. Like all Dog Might products, the Ice Cream Dice Box comes with a lifetime guarantee. 
These boxes are prototypes and a couple of small changes will be happening in the final production. The edges of the D20 top will be a little crisper, and the front facing number will be a 20, because we all know that's the number we like to see the most!
The Blue Ice Cream Dice Box
This color combo is called cake by Dog Might, but I call it sno-cone!
The stunning Wenge wood box with Your Favorite. A match made in heaven.
Flat Pack Ice Cream Dice Dice Tower
For $25 CAD (approx. $19 USD / €17 / £15 ) you can get yourself an Ice Cream Dice dice tower made by the awesome folks over at Galaxy Gaming Gear.
The awe inspiring Ice Cream Dice Tower of Doooooooooooooooooom!
Galaxy Gaming Gear makes a slew of flat pack minis, terrain and buildings for all your gaming needs. Their designs are particularly kid friendly and it's great to have them on board. I will continue to sell this tower after the campaign, though the price will likely be $30.
I know, Mom said not to talk about the 'S' word, but we have to...Shipping.
Shipping is the one spell that neither creator, nor adventurer, can break. Being based out of Canada, I feel your pain. I have partnered with a Canadian company that ships straight from China. This is hugely beneficial to all of us, myself included, for a few reasons.
We don't have to wait three months for the dice to arrive by freight ship to North American shores, and then wait further while it's unpacked and sent to different shipping centers which then finally get it shipped to you.
It's reasonably affordable and delivered with tracking number and insurance to everybody.
I save money on not having to ship it by sea, which means I pass that savings on to you.
So here's the shipping breakdown, it doesn't cover every possible currency, but it covers a lot.
There, we did it, we had the dreaded 'S' talk.
Matte or Glossy, that is the Question:
Here are the side by side shots of the Matte & Glossy versions of each set. Some key things to keep in mind: 
The glossy look is achieved by tossing the dice into a rock polisher, so the matte dice are a little larger because they've haven't been polished for as long as the glossy sets. The matte Rainbow and Neo d20's are a little larger than the rest, due to being cast in resin.
The powdery look on the matte Neo and Rainbow will eventually wear off. The colors are still softer than gloss, but the frosty look is not permanent.
If you prefer your colors to be vivid and brighter, you'll want to go with the gloss.
Matte isn't very shiny, I know this should seem obvious, but if you like your dice shiny, go with glossy.
They do feel different, but the difference isn't night and day like it is with matte and glossy paper.
With less polishing, there is occasional color bleed around some of the numbers, it is negligible when it does happen and it only happened on a couple of single numbers on a couple of individual dice in the 25 test sets I got. This may be fixed in production, but I felt it was worth noting
Let's get to the comparison shots...
Neo
Orange Dream
Rainbow
Your Favorite
Bubble Candy
Kiwi, the numbers on Kiwi will be re-inked with a golden yellow during final production.
Razzman
The Final Butterscotch will look more like Orange Dream
Let's End this on a High Note
Thank you. They're two simple words that we often toss around without really thinking about what they mean. I think about them a lot and how they relate to this company.
'Thank' is defined as: to express gratitude to or to hold responsible.
So, let me say it again. Thank you. I hold you all responsible for the gratitude I felt every single day leading up to this launch, and will always feel. You cheered me on and you cheered me up, you shared my dice on your podcasts, streams, tweets, instagram, on Facebook. You made sure people knew about me and Ice Cream Dice. 
This company was inspired by some pretty amazing kids and my desire to make D&D and other TTRPG's more accessible to schools and kids. It is my belief that the skills learned and demonstrated while playing tabletop games, of any sort, are the ones we want our next world leaders to possess. Risk taking, problem solving, learning that you can't do everything by yourself, the value of friendship, exploration, listening to multiple viewpoints, among many other things. 
I didn't get here because of a marketing budget or the right analytics or targeted ads. I got here because of my own work and your support. I didn't get here because I hired a team or had an unlimited amount of money to throw at things. I've said from the beginning, what you see is what you will get. Initially I thought I meant my dice, I soon learned I meant that about myself as well. 
This community we're all a part of is amazing. I am proud, and humbled, to be a part of it. Here's to many sweet rolls with friends new and old!
Thank you,
Marc Schubert, aka Ice Cream Dice
A Really Great Facebook Group!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk in this project is the production & shipping time required to manufacture the dice and get them to you, my backers. I have been working with my factory for a while now and they are expecting my order at the end of March. Production time is usually in the 45 - 60 working day range. So somewhere between 9 - 12 weeks. However, complications can occur, holidays happen and to be safe, I have estimated a 9 - 18 week production range into my timeline. This allows for the custom molds to be created that are required to honor the stretch goals that may become unlocked during the campaign.

I have partnered with a Canadian company that has years of experience shipping dice. They ship from their warehouse space in China which allows me to ensure a lower shipping cost that I can pass on to you, the backers. By choosing to ship from China I save time on the actual mass shipping of the product to North America.

Typically, shipping can take up to three months to get to North American shores, and then you still have to wait for it to pass through customs, get unloaded and then get shipped to the shipping companies who then, finally after a couple of weeks, ship to you. By shipping directly from China, using a Canadian company to do it, it'll take a few days to get to the warehouse and then the shipping to backers will start.

This is my first Kickstarter, and I've done everything I can to ensure that you receive a quality product on time and I have researched and learned from the mistakes of those that have come before me.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Finally, some progress...
It's been a while, and this will probably be a long one, so I'll get right to it.
This whole thing has taken much longer than it was ever supposed to, even with anticipated hiccups that were encountered early on. The pandemic has wrought havoc on the world and this Kickstarter got caught up in it, and is still in it, sort of.

Replacements/Never Received Dice
Things are going to start moving slowly in this respect. I am still waiting for my team to ship everything to me, but I received a small shipment of extra dice from this campaign that I had sent to be sold at conventions while everything seemed to be on track to finish up.
I will start going through the form, and next week I will start sending out packages to the folks that need sets replaced. I will also be refunding anyone that has requested a refund and starting to ship the sets requested from the shop as replacements.

I'm Sorry.
I'm sorry this campaign went awry in almost every way imaginable and then some.
After serious consideration, and talking with my team in China, some final decisions have been made. It will add time to things, but it will also ensure every package is tracked and has a better chance of arriving.

updates.update_content:
Replacement & Missing Dice Form Explanation
Alright, it's become pretty clear that what made sense to my brain (which admittedly isn't operating at full capacity these days) didn't make sense to a lot of you, so here's an explanation of the form, broken down question by question.
First though, I want to apologize for not giving you the option of Neo and Kiwi replacements. I will add them to the form, so that if you do want them, you can receive them. I'm going to go into a bit greater detail here about these. If you're here because the form was confusing, just skip to the next headline.

This Should be It.
We're going to cover a lot here, but this should be the final update. Yes, there will be a form to fill out, and unfortunately, even if you've filled one of the previous ones out before, I will ask you to fill this one out as well. It will ensure that you get whatever you need/want, and it will keep everything centralized so that I can send one last spreadsheet off to the fulfillment team and have all the information. There will be no need to confirm bad dice with pictures this time around.

Tomorrow: Pride Vol 1. Launches
And yes, I know not everyone has received their dice from this one yet. And nobody expected this/wanted this to go on as long as it has for some of you.
I came to the decision to launch the Pride Vol 1 after months of consideration, I've had the samples finished since last September, and was originally planning on launching it in February on the one year anniversary of this one launching, then Covid hit. So I delayed until April. Then I realized a small percentage of packages still hadn't made it to their forever homes, so I delayed again, until now.

Thank You. It's Been More of a Ride than I Ever Wanted
...but it's done. Mostly.
I spent the majority of this last year and a bit focusing on all the things that went wrong. And very little of it on the successes. It's now officially time to wrap this thing up, but it's not quite ready for it's bow entirely.

DRAGONLOCK™ Miniatures are specifically designed to be the easiest-to-print minis you can buy for 3D printing. These miniatures are optimized for FDM-type 3D printers and do not require slicer-added supports to successfully print, as the sculpts are designed to self-support or in some cases have pre-designed supports built in. All of this means you can print highly detailed miniatures easily without having the hassles often associated with printing miniatures at home. Best of all, the miniatures in the photos you see are all printed on a $220 3D Printer (Creality Ender 3 available on Amazon HERE and from Creality) and a standard 28mm miniature only costs around 6-8 cents in plastic to print!  
All miniatures are delivered via DrivethruRPG as a downloadable .stl file, no physical minis are included.
We do not use an after-campaign pledge manager. All pledges must be in before this Kickstarter ends.

 Are you new to gaming? I used to think this was one of the only games out there:

2 years ago I set out to make other families aware of the infinite possibilities out there as well. That's when Getting Geeky with Gamer Leaf was born. It is a gaming podcast from our family's perspective. The Podcast includes:  
Story (we will tell you the story of our gameplay of the featured game) and then our reviews of the game. 
We also highlight Kickstarters that we find interesting or wish we could back. 
AAA (Adventures in Application Acquisition) in which we tell you about both ios and android applications (Some compared to their tabletop games and some that aren't games outside of the app) 
The story of our Role Playing as a family (We started off playing Too Many Bones). We also interview game designers, publishers, game store owners, other media content creators & everyday gamers. This is a family show!
We've come a long way from our 1st episodes! Catch some of our latest episodes HERE:
PLAY

Full episode can be found here! 
And, here's a directory of podcasts!


I could tell you about the podcast till I'm blue in the face. But, Let's see what others are saying: 
Founder of one of my favorite podcast and also runs a board game publishing company both under the same umbrella of Tuesday Knight Games, Alan Gerding had this to say “It is obvious that Gamer Leaf has a sincere passion for gaming and provides an abundant amount of content with incredible consistency.” 
Chris the Founder & Editor-in-Chief  of Casual Game Insider as well as the Creator and CEO of Boardy.TV said "I love the kids' perspectives. They are probably the most blunt reviewers I know of, and their comments can be very humorous at times."
Richard Simpson of We're Not Wizards Tabletop and Board Games Podcast said: "Getting Geeky with Gamer Leaf podcast is the second hardest working podcast in the world"
Josh from who brought us Frontier the Card Game and will be re-launching Monster Maina had this to say: "Getting Geeky With Gamer Leaf is one of my favorite podcasts. We love being featured on it as well as listening to it!"
JC with Wooden Shoe Games says "Getting Geeky With Gamer Leaf is my go-to podcast for getting through the day."

John Christopher said "It's more fun than poking myself with a cattle prod"

Risks and challenges
A season of podcast content requires a substantial and sustained effort. Having completed two years of content already, I'm fully aware of the effort and time commitment required to interview and/or play games, edit, upload, and share content.

Over the course of a calendar year, an assortment of personal/life matters can come up. I endeavor to always stay ahead of schedule to mitigate this risk, but in the event something unexpected occurs, I'll endeavor to get back on track as quickly as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

When painting miniatures, you cannot hold your miniatures with bare hands: You need a miniature handle. Today, there is no straight forward solution on the market: they are either too clumsy, not ergonomic, or overly expensive.
That's why we created RGG 360°, the first natural ergonomic handle for miniature painting.

RGG 360° has been designed by painters for painters and developed with the feedback of pro-painters.

3d printed prototype

RGG 360° is the only natural ergonomic handle designed to create the best connection between you and your miniature, help you adopt the best painting position and minimise unnecessary movements.
The added benefits are greater stability, better precision and minimised fatigue to paint for hours. 

3d printed prototype

Many do not pay attention to the handle of their holder. It is however at the heart of your painting experience. The handle is how you connect with your miniature. It needs to be perfect. We perfected it for months!
RGG 360° is the only handle designed to fit naturally in your hand with its unique shape. 
As there is no strain on your hand and fingers, you won't have to move them and you can enjoy full control of your miniature.
Once you have it in your hand, there is no turning back.

3d printed prototype
360° rotation axis is not an afterthought, it is inherent to the natural ergonomic design. Thanks to the handle, you can rest comfortably your wrist on the desk when painting. The 360° rotation allows you then to access any part of your miniature fast and reliably. No more parasitic movements. You will rediscover the joy of painting.

No additional accessories needed. You have the best handle and the best mounting solution for the best price! Exclusive, save on the retail price, only 10€ a piece during the KS.


Adopt the best painting handle, for a pleasant, fun and perfect painting session

Read below to have all the details!

3d printed prototype
A straight simple handle does not fit your hand comfortably. To achieve a good quality painting, you need to stay focused and to hold your miniature naturally without causing hand fatigue. For that, RGG 360° is slightly curved and designed to feel very natural in your hand. No odd shape. That's why the sculpted handle has been designed to sit comfortably in the hand.
PLAY

RGG 360° has been tested by many pro painters, painters and even by a 9 years old (Vivien's daughter) to ensure a comfortable handling for most hand size.
Quite the opposite because the hand on the handle helps improve your overall precision.
Also it offers more control and allows you to get around your miniatures without removing your hand from the handle. This innovation will help you achieve a better painting on every angle- Effortlessly
RGG 360° can rotate easily yes, but once you stopped the rotation it will just stay in place. You don't need to hold it with your thumb.
Thanks to our custom made mounting putty, you can fix a large range of miniatures from your favorite games! The putty is of course reusable, we have been using the same putty for months. 
Square, round, oval up to 55mm
Round, square, small, large, exotic bases… miniatures bases come in many shapes. When designing RGG 360°, we tried some mechanical designs and all kind of sticky materials but they were either non adaptive, clumsy, heavy, none reusable... anyway, they always had disadvantages.
 So we have created a custom made mounting putty, as the perfect mounting solution for your miniatures: Reusable, adaptable, safe, for long. We have been testing the putty for several months, and it never dried out.
With 15 grams included with the handle, you have 3x the amount needed to stick your miniatures. 
PLAY

    Made in Europe.
RGG 360° is weighted for optimal stability.
Additional custom-made mounting putty included: Our orange putty was customized to have the perfect stickiness and consistency.
High quality axle of rotation: We tried it all, plastic friction, ball bearing... but nothing compare to our special designed axis. It will provide a smooth, accurate and fun rotation, and will last up to several hundred thousand of rotations. Rotate it freely with your thumb, it will stay in place during your painting. Axle of rotation will be graded up to 500k+ rotations.
Made of PREMIUM plastic: we selected ABS as the best plastic for our handle, due to its density and toughness. The weight will just be perfect in your hand and the handle will last for long
Graining and engraving on the plastic for optimal grip: Instead of smooth plastic, we decided to add some areas with slight engraving, to improve the handling.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is definitely a passion project of mine (8 years so far!), and as such I will see it through if at all possible. I can think of 2 things that might delay or somehow jeopardize the creation of this game:

1. Manufacturing & Fulfillment Issues
This is my first project, and I will readily admit that some things might sneak up on me. However, I've made it a point to surround myself with industry veterans, incredible resources, and trustworthy partners to mitigate any potential delay, and handle any bumps in the road.

2. Injury, Illness, or Death
Fingers crossed nothing like this will happen, but because this is primarily my creation, a lot hinges on me staying healthy. So far there's nothing to be concerned about, and I'll do my best to keep it that way. Although because I'm from Alaska, a random bear attack isn't out of the question - but not very likely. Also, rest assured that I have amazing people around me that will make this happen in any case.

If there's anything at all you're concerned about, please feel free to email me at info@terminusbreach.com and let me know. I'll be happy to address any questions or issues personally.

Once again, I want to assure you that if there's any worldly way to make this game a reality, I will find it. It's been a long, amazing road to get here, and I'm so excited about seeing this through.

Thank you so much for your support,
Matt Lloyd

updates.update_content:
Hope you're doing well & getting into summer full swing!  I don't have much to report, but it's been a while since I checked in, and I wanted to let you know that things are progressing nicely!
In fact, I've finally received an accurate quote for the game!  This is what we've been waiting for, so now I just need to go over everything with a fine-toothed comb and approve the quote, then I can make a payment and we can get the manufacturing started.  It feels really amazing to be this close to another big milestone!

Hope this finds you doing well!  Progress continues with the game, although it's taking a long time to get an accurate quote from our manufacturer.  That's our big hurdle right now, but I'm optimistic that we're close to getting some numbers and moving forward with printing.

In the meantime, our custom coins came in!  I can't commend Iron Wind Metals enough, these are amazing.  They look incredible, they have an awesome 'clink' sound to them, and they have great weight.  I felt bad for the poor FedEx guy that had to bring this box up to the door though, it's extremely heavy!

updates.update_userinfo: March Update: This train is still rolling!
updates.update_content:
Hope you're doing well & getting excited about the weather turning soon! 

Okay, I've managed to establish contact with the manufacturing company again, and should have some final numbers very soon.  It's been a surreal experience to have everything largely completed, and just waiting on communications.

Thanks again for all the support, I hope this find you happy and healthy.  There's not a lot to report, but here's what I know.

Unfortunately, I still haven't heard back from our manufacturer & now we're into Chinese New Year, so we'll just have to wait a little bit longer I suppose.  Hopefully they'll get the numbers back to me as soon as they come back to work and we can get the ball rolling on the manufacturing side.

Hope this finds you happy, healthy, and excited about this upcoming year.  2020 was a doozy, but luckily it's in our hindsight now.  I have 2 main pieces of news for you:

The game is done.
Excepting a few items (the Handbook is going through a final edit, the box height is undecided, etc), everything is completed.  All of the print files have been laid out and exported (hopefully with no errors), so as soon as we can get an accurate quote from the manufacturer I'm ready to submit the files, make a payment, and get started.  From here on out I'll mainly be attending to administrative tasks, which will be a nice change of pace.

I hope this finds you happy and healthy this holiday season!

I don't have a lot to report unfortunately, but I wanted to check in and let you know I'm still here and I'm still working on the game every chance I get.  

Here's where we stand:

Thank you all so much for your continued support, I hope this update finds you happy and healthy.

Things have been a bit crazy (for everyone, amiright?), and so it's been a little difficult to find time to really put my nose to the grindstone and get this all wrapped up.  I have been working on it, just not as much as I'd prefer.

Hope this finds you doing well!
Sorry for the delay in Updates, I've largely been working on "one" bullet list item (I have endless lists, as you can imagine).  That "one" item was this, however: 'Re-work the Player's Handbook & get it to my editor'.  It took FOREVER lol. I hadn't realized how much info was packed into the old one, and how much needed to be added or re-organized based on feedback & suggestions from all of the game's playtesters over the years.

Just as a quick reminder, the Pledge Manager will be closing in 2 days on June 1st.  I sent an email to all the backers that still have open orders, so if you can't remember if you did it or not just check that inbox!
Also, this what I've been working on, let me know what you think in the comments!
*it's a rough mockup, but you get the idea

updates.update_userinfo: TB Gets a Facelift & Pledge Manager News
updates.update_content:
I hope this finds everyone safe and healthy in these crazy times, everything is running smoothly here at Terminus Breach HQ.
Since the art is done I’ve had a chance to do what I really love to do - design.  I’ve finally gotten a chance to give my game the look & feel that I’ve had in my head since the outset, and something I could only hint at with my prototypes.  It’s been a fun exercise trying to remember all of the suggestions I’ve gotten from players over the years and really applying them to see if they work.  Most of them have been amazing suggestions (being able to spot flying Drakka at a glance, having rank markers on the different tower levels, etc) that have really elevated the game as a whole.  Thank you for that, I can’t describe how grateful I am for my Terminus Breach community.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is definitely a passion project of mine (7 years so far!), and as such I will see it through if at all possible. I can think of 2 things that might delay or somehow jeopardize the creation of this game:

1. Manufacturing & Fulfillment Issues
This is my first project, and I will readily admit that some things might sneak up on me. However, I've made it a point to surround myself with industry veterans, incredible resources, and trustworthy partners to mitigate any potential delay, and handle any bumps in the road.

2. Injury, Illness, or Death
Fingers crossed nothing like this will happen, but because this is primarily my creation, a lot hinges on me staying healthy. So far there's nothing to be concerned about, and I'll do my best to keep it that way. Although because I'm from Alaska, a random bear attack isn't out of the question - but not very likely. Also, rest assured that I have amazing people around me that will make this happen in any case.

If there's anything at all you're concerned about, please feel free to email me at info@terminusbreach.com and let me know. I'll be happy to address any questions or issues personally.

Once again, I want to assure you that if there's any worldly way to make this game a reality, I will find it. It's been a long, amazing road to get here, and I'm so excited about seeing this through.

Thank you so much for your support,
Matt Lloyd

Hello friends, you may have noticed that I’ve canceled the campaign - for now. Terminus Breach will relaunch in 6 days on Monday December 10th, and will only run for 10 days. This was not an easy decision to make, and there are more than a few deciding factors.
At this point, it looks like we may fund, but just barely. While this is the goal of the campaign, and everything would be fine if that had happened (to be clear, this was not a clerical error), i realized that it was just not true to my vision of the game. Just barely funding would have meant the thinnest cards available, the thinnest cardboard box and board, and a folded paper insert. When this fact was staring me in the face, I realized that the game that I want you to have, the experience I want you to have when you play this game, was in jeopardy. I waited to see what kind of an effect the final 48 hours would have, but it was not as dramatic as we needed in order to ensure the quality of game you deserve, thus triggering the plan to cancel & reboot.

DIORAMA VERSION The Diorama is the most dramatic and dynamic of all the sculpt types and shows the dragon mid scene interacting with its environment. This model can be used in games, but it is meant for the modeller or painter that wishes to immortalize a scene on his mantle piece.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our forth Kickstarter and with three successful Kickstarters under our belt, so we are well versed with Kickstarter ways and envisage no problems.

Delivery dates are a rough guideline and we will always try to deliver before the estimated date proposed.

DIGITAL MEDIA: 
We strive to produce models that will print with as little support and parts as possible. Some models print in one go whilst most are split up into parts which must be printed separately and then assembled.

The file format of choice will be .STL and the models shall be zipped and made available to the user for download. The user is responsible for downloading their product and must have a valid internet connection and email with which to collect their reward, via internet download. We will keep the files on our system for at least three months after the first date of issue. The user must ensure that he collects the files within this time frame or risk forfeit.

Backers must realize that the resolution you obtain on your print is down to the system you use. Our high resolution files will give you almost render quality prints on high end SLA machines, whilst the same files will produce lesser resolution prints on standard FDM printers. At any rate, all the files have been previously tested on SLA and FDM printers and have shown satisfactory produce.

We recommend FDM Prints with at least a 400micron nozzle and 200 micron layer height for terrain. A 100 micron layer height will give you outstanding prints all round. We have also tested the files with larger nozzles, at 500 microns and decent results are possible on most prints, if the layer height and temperature is controlled correctly. 0.5(500 micron) nozzles are not recommended for miniature printing.

SLA printers should have no problems obtaining excellent resolution and finish even at 100 micron layer height although 50 micron layer height is recommended for minute sculpt detail clarity. We will try our best to split models so they will fit in smaller print beds like those found on SLA machines. Although miniatures and figurines can be split into smaller parts, large terrain pieces will require a standard 220x220mm print bed. Standard for FDM Printers like the 'Ender3'

We supply the user with a design that has been tested on conventional home hobby printers and is proven to print.

All the models are tested and sliced with 'Cura' software which is freeware and available to all backers for use. We recommend that backers use 'Cura' as it is fully tested with our models and we can offer customer support, if any problems are encountered. We are unable to give customer support for other slicing software and backers use this at their own risk. 

When using our digital media, we do not hold ourselves responsible for the production or manufacturing process of the design, this is exclusively up to the user.

Users may modify models and files at their own risk and only for their own personal use. Modified files are not guaranteed by us and as such, users do this under their own risk and know how.

The Images shown on the campaign page are just for visualization and although they may come very close, they are not an exact representation of the final design or printed model, which may vary.

We reserve the right to alter any of the models shown, at any time, before delivery, with the intent of improving the design, or efficiency of production.

campaign.story:
The Quirky Feather Confectionery was a place unlike any other. By backing this project you will be able to always have a piece of The Quirky Feather in your home. From the classic favorites like Crossroad Cookies and S'mores Blondies to the most requested treats such as macraons and tiramisu, all of the recipes for your favorite treats will be included. 
Two versions will be available. The recipes only No Frills Edition, which will have simple spiral binding and  a no nonsense layout, is perfect for everyone but jerks, bigots, and people who take up more than one parking space who want to be able to make TQFC treats at home.
For people who loved the atmosphere and spirit of the Quirky Feather we are excited to offer the Recipes and Memories edition, which will not only include all of the recipes from the No Frills Edition presented in an elegantly designed layout but will also include photographs, illustrations, and memory pages that will keep the spirit of the Quirky Feather alive and with you always. Every reward level that includes the Recipes and Memories edition will also include a set of the cocktail recipe cards from the No Frills with a Twist reward level. 
The cover design pictured is subject to change. 
If you would like multiple copies of either book please choose the highest reward level and add the amount needed for the number of extra copies you wish to order during checkout.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main challenge of this project will be getting enough people to back the Recipes and Memories Edition that the price per book will remain reasonable. If this project does not reach the goal we plan to try again with a campaign that consists of only the No Frills Edition.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

This reward level will also include having your named printed on the Thank You page of the Recipes and Memories Edition. The early bird bundle also includes free domestic shipping!

campaign.story:
Known only through whispers and rumors, the DCC RPG Annual is a legend before its time. Those few who have seen its pages are now but blasted ash. It's your turn, mortal. Be careful when you turn its pages...
Thanks everyone for a terrific Kickstarter! If you missed it, you can find the finished product at www.goodman-games.com once it's in print!
Color cover to the DCC Annual! By Doug Kovacs
The Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game, also known as DCC RPG, is the most fun you’ll ever have playing an RPG. It is also a game founded in principle. Important amongst those principles is an aversion to rules bloat. The DCC RPG core rulebook is but a single book. There are no splatbooks, sourcebooks, character books, monster manuals, or other supplements for DCC RPG. They are not needed. Incumbent upon the judge is the need to create: yon horizon is filled with adventure, and it is your adventure. You have worlds inside you: find them.
Yet the urge to create is a hungry god, and gods demand nourishment. It was originally conceived that an annual publication would exist in some form to showcase the brilliance of the DCC RPG community. This would be the DCC RPG Annual, published each year to distribute these gaming creations.
The best of things happened: the DCC RPG Annual was never needed. The DCC community burst forth a verdant jungle of inspiration, with ripe fruit on every limb. Blogs and personal posts; zines; community publications; the Gongfarmer’s Almanac; officially licensed third-party works: there is a vast supply of inspiration from whence the DCC judge can draw and iterate.
And thus we come here to Kickstart a volume which has no place. If you are a DCC fan, you absolutely do not need to support this Kickstarter. Should you to desire to do so, however, you will receive a book that has become a legend, despite never before being published.
Foil cover to the DCC Annual! By Doug Kovacs. Imagine this printed in gold foil on a leatherette background.
The DCC RPG Annual
Spoken about for half a decade in hoary whispers, at long last Goodman Games brings you: the DCC RPG Annual. Much of the material for the DCC Annual was written between 2012 and 2014, when the original need was perceived. In many ways, it springs forth from the original inspirations of DCC RPG, which were psychically close at that time. There are magic swords. There are patrons. There are even more tables for making monsters unique. There are rules for making cleric deities more distinctive. There are rules for patron weapons and magic rings. There is the lost continent of Mu, and the hidden places between worlds. And there are rules for magical moustaches.
The DCC Annual is a hardcover estimated at 160 pages finished length. Like the original DCC RPG core rulebook, it is available in two cover options: a full-color and foil cover edition. It is organized in the same manner as the DCC RPG core rulebook: chapter three is equipment, chapter five is magic, and chapter nine is monsters, just as in the core rulebook. There is no chapter two, because the skills section of the core rulebook has no expansion material in the Annual.
The DCC Annual comes in two cover versions. The color cover is painted by Doug Kovacs and features Hugh the Barbarian and his Band. There's a story in this cover, a chapter of the Band history, for those who can find it. There is also a foil edition featuring a new foil design (and someone’s decapitated head). For this Kickstarter, the foil edition will be printed in gold foil. The distribution version will be printed in silver foil. And never fear, art fans – the foil edition also features Doug's amazing cover art from the color cover edition (reproduced on the interior pages of the foil edition).
You absolutely do not need the DCC Annual to play DCC RPG, nor does any material in the Annual supersede or otherwise change the baseline game experience as expressed in the core rulebook. There is no rules bloat: only new vistas of imagination.
And with every gift from the gods, comes a toll. Not only does this Kickstarter offer the DCC Annual, but it also offers three other artifacts to show your devotion: a new printing of the DCC RPG core book featuring yet more amazing art; a new hardcover edition of DCC #83: The Chained Coffin; and an opening offer of the DCC Quick Start Rules for new initiates. Read on! 
The Shanna Dahaka cover to the DCC Core Rulebook! By Doug Kovacs
New Fans, Welcome!
We invite newcomers to join the Cult of DCC! As part of this Kickstarter, we are offering the DCC RPG Quick Start rules, in print+PDF format, for the ridiculously low price of $2.00. That price includes postage to anywhere in the world. If you haven’t experienced DCC RPG, this is your chance to get in very affordably. The Quick Start Rules include everything needed to get your character from level 0 to level 2, and also include two one-session adventure modules. This pledge level also includes three free PDF adventures of our choosing.
We are also giving away a PDF of the Quick Start Rules for free at this link right here. If you’re not sure what DCC RPG is, this is a great way to test the waters!
And finally, if you as a newcomer decide you want to jump in a little deeper, we invite you to check out the Three Best Pledge Levels, detailed below. The Favored Retainer level offers an affordable way to get started on DCC RPG. 
The pterodactyl-wizard cover to the DCC core rulebook! By Sanjulian
DCC RPG Core Rulebook, 7th printing
Also offered in this Kickstarter are two other items of interest to the DCC gamer: a new printing of the core rulebook, including new cover art, and a compiled hardcover edition of DCC #83: the Chained Coffin.
The DCC RPG core rulebook has been through 4 hardcover and 2 softcover printings prior to this run. (And wow, isn’t that amazing? Thanks everyone for the support!) Now that the hardcover is once again out of print, we are doing another printing.
As always, the content is materially identical to prior printings (except for fixing a couple typos). There will be a new adventure substituted in the back, as we do for each printing This printing includes "Yddgrrl's Maze," a level 2 adventure by Michael Curtis. In addition, this print run will be distinguished by the covers. We are offering three covers on this hardcover edition:
· The “basic blue” cover, the classic Doug Kovacs cover we all know and love.
· The Sanjulian cover. Fans of 1970's fantasy and sci-fi art will know Sanjulian's art from Warren magazines like Creepy and Eerie, as well as his run of Conan covers. This is the red-and-yellow “pterodactyl-wizard” cover you see above. The Kickstarter edition will include an exclusive foil imprint over the DCC logo.
· Doug’s new Shanna Dahaka cover. The Kickstarter edition will include an exclusive foil imprint over the DCC logo. 
The hardcover 2nd printing of DCC #83: The Chained Coffin. Cover art by Ken Kelly
DCC #83: The Chained Coffin (hardcover 2nd printing)
DCC #83: The Chained Coffin was originally released way back in 2014. The boxed set proved immensely popular, and not just for the spinning map puzzle. The Appalachian-style fantasy setting of The Shudder Mountains, inspired by the works of Appendix N author Manly Wade Wellman, provides a unique place for your characters to adventure. Michael Curtis did a wonderful job of bringing The Shudder Mountains alive, and several supplemental volumes were published.
Now that the original boxed set is out of print, we are offering a hardcover book that compiles all material from the original DCC #83: The Chained Coffin boxed set, including all the stretch goal booklets, as well as much, much more:
· All content from DCC #83.1: Tales of the Shudder Mountains and DCC #83.2: Death Among the Pines
· The Shudder Mountain material published in several Gen Con Program Guides
· Moon Eyes and Fire-Flies, a new adventure set in the Shudder Mountains
· Buzzard Hollow, a new Shudder Mountains mini-setting
· Ma Bigginty’s Book of Backwoods Wisdom,a collection of inspiration material that will bring the Shudder Mountains to life in your game
The DCC #83 hardcover is estimated at 160 pages and yes, it will also include the spinning map puzzle! (We are working with the printer on logistics, but the most likely scenario is having the map tucked inside the back cover of each hardcover.)
One last thing. Doug’s original art for DCC #83 is amazing, but you know we like variety. The hardcover edition features new art by none other than fantasy legend Ken Kelly. Fans of 1970s Warren magazines like Creepy and Eerie will also recognize the work of Ken Kelly, whose career also includes a long stretch of amazing illustrations. And his illustration builds on Doug’s original design for the chained coffin itself. And don’t worry, Doug’s original cover art will also appear in the hardcover edition.
DCC #83 will also be available in a foil edition, featuring the same amazing image that was printed on the limited-run foil editions of the original module. This cover art is timeless and deserves to remain in print. The Kickstarter edition will feature a different foil color than the distribution edition.
The original "blue cover" edition of DCC RPG core rulebook. By Doug Kovacs
The Three Best Pledge Levels
If you'd like to buy copies individually, the table below shows their cost. You can add on funds to purchase more than one book. However, there are some bundle deals that offer a great value. See the summary after the table: 
The Three Best Pledge Levels. We are offering three great deals that make it easy to back multiple books in this Kickstarter. If you’re a new fan, a dedicated fan, or a diehard collector, one of these is for you.
Favored Retainer: You are new to the adventure, and you have promise. This pledge level is for new DCC fans and offers a $120 of product for $100. You’ll receive the color-cover editions of the DCC Annual, core rulebook, and DCC #83: The Chained Coffin. If you would like to have the Sanjulian or Shanna Dahaka covers for the DCC Core Rulebook, pledge for this level and add an extra +$20 for the price difference.
 Name Level: Your fame precedes you within the DCC community. This $150 pledge is a $30 savings on the cover price of $180. At the Name Level pledge, you’ll receive DCC Annual (Kickstarter-exclusive foil cover), DCC #83: The Chained Coffin (Kickstarter-exclusive foil cover), and a copy of the DCC RPG core rulebook, with your choice of either the Sanjulian or Doug Kovacs cover.
Landed Lord: Other fans make pilgrimage to witness to your legendary collection. This $300 pledge is a $60 savings on the cover price of $360. As a Landed Lord, you will receive everything offered in the Kickstarter, which is seven books: both covers of the DCC Annual, both covers of DCC #83: The Chained Coffin, and all three covers of the DCC RPG core rulebook (7th printing).
Print + PDF
Every print copy of the DCC Annual, DCC core rulebook, and DCC #83: The Chained Coffin books offered in this Kickstarter also includes a PDF edition.
Kickstarter Exclusives
This is stated elsewhere but also to call it out explicitly: this Kickstarter features cover variants that are exclusive as follows:
· DCC RPG core rulebook, Sanjulian edition: the DCC RPG logo will be foil-printed
· DCC RPG core rulebook, Doug Kovacs Shanna Dahaka edition: the DCC RPG logo will be foil-printed
· DCC Annual, foil cover edition: the foil will be printed in gold. The distribution edition will be printed in silver.
· DCC #83: The Chained Coffin: the foil will be printed in gold. The distribution edition will be printed in silver.
Shipping Costs
Please note that shipping costs are not included in the pledge levels. Shipping costs will be assessed at a later date via Backer Kit. 
USA shipments will ship via media mail, bound printed matter or equivalent rates.
International shipments will ship via a tracked service, most likely FedEx or UPS. We will endeavor to find the cheapest option, and also partner with international shipping partners where possible to reduce VAT charges via local-market shipping. 
The exact cost of each shipment will vary according to the content but please be aware that the hardcover books in this Kickstarter are heavy. International backers should expect to pay minimum postage charges for a single book of at least $20-$25 for Canada, $30-$35 for Europe, and $35-$40 for Australia and Asia. Additional books will obviously add to this cost. Final cost will be assessed via Backer Kit. 
Stretch Goals
We have learned over the years that there are so many ways to make these books cool! We’ve already worked out a couple options as options for stretch goals, which are listed below. As the project progresses we are open to suggestions from fans on others!
At $40,000: CLEARED!We will print new color art on the endsheets of the DCC Annual.
At $65,000: CLEARED! We will print maps on the endsheets of DCC #83: The Chained Coffin. PLUS we will include a free 11x17 poster print of one piece of cover art with every print pledge!
At $80,000: CLEARED!Free adventure! For every book you buy, you'll get one free DCC adventure module in PDF format (exact module to be determined). (The $2 quick start rules don't count!)
At $100,000: CLEARED! We will include satin ribbon bookmarks in the DCC Core Rulebook and DCC #83: The Chained Coffin.
At $125,000: CLEARED!We will include printed 11”x17” posters of the cover art. There will be several “checkpoints” on this stretch goal and we’ll use backer feedback to decide which posters to print – the Chained Coffin cover, the Annual cover, the Sanjulian cover, etc. (Or maybe we’ll just blow past this stretch goal and print them all!)
Beyond that: We have some fun ideas. We would like to print custom dust jackets featuring the Deadly Hands of DCC art that premiered at Gen Con 2018. Some fans have requested books bound in real leather, and that may be an option we unlock. And we’re open to your ideas as well!
The Demon Skull Add-On
We are also producing a version of the DCC RPG core rulebook that features the original iconic demon skull image. You can add it on for +$60. Read this update for full details!
