                                                                                          "Tense, quick co-op filler. Nice combination of "try to do what you can on your own" and "try to work with others despite limited communication", with the latter yielding better results when you pull it off. The time-pressure and limited communication mean the Usual Co-op Problem (of the best player telling others what to do) simply does not manifest; even if the Communications Satellite is out there's no time for that sort of nonsense." - R. Eric Reuss, Massachusetts, USA (BoardGameGeek)
 "If you like real-time games (and you know I do), here’s a quick one—each game of Meteor lasts 5 minutes or less. There’s a swarm of meteors headed toward Earth, and you have to cooperate with others to build and launch rockets to shoot them down. One of the trickiest parts of this game is that you can’t talk to each other. Well, there’s a technology card, the communications array, that lets you start talking, but until then everything is done with gestures and raised eyebrows. Even when you can start talking, it can be a pretty tricky game to beat." -GeekDad.com
"Meteor is a time-limited cooperative game for up to 5 players. The game starts with a set of meteor cards in the center of the board and players are given only five minutes to destroy them all. Players play rocket cards and then power them with one or more types of three resources so that they can be launched at and destroy the displayed meteors.
In addition to rockets there are some special ability cards. Some important ones even allow players to start discussion options among themselves. Yes, at the game start players aren’t even allowed to talk. Each game uses a small set out of a large number of meteors, most with special abilities, giving the game plenty of variability." -Matt Carlson (OpinionatedGamers.com)
"Meteor is...a Blast for me (OK, I could have said Meteor...Rocks! or Meteor...is Rock Solid or Meteor is...Out of this World). It's a fun Coop filler game that plays in 5 minutes and is easy to teach. As far as I know this is the only coop game that is also filler. I love the constant tension during the game, the simultaneous player action and the interaction between players." -Gabriel Ouimet, Ottawa, Canada (BoardGameGeek.com)
 Set Up:
1.Shuffle the Small Meteor cards, the Medium Meteor cards, and the double-sided 6 and 7 Meteor cards together. This creates the Meteor deck.
2.Create the Meteor Field by dealing out the number of Meteor Cards according to the number of players.  Place the cards face down in the center of the play area. Spread them out so that each Meteor Card be seen by all players.
3.Place the Altitude Zone Cards in descending order (5 on top, 1 on the bottom) in one stack near the Meteor Field.
4.Place five Sand Timers near the Altitude Zone Cards. Make sure Sand Timers are ready for play.
5.Shuffle all the Resource Cards together to create the Resource Deck. Give each player the number of Resource Cards according to the number of players shown on the Set-Up Chart below.
6.Choose one player to be the Timekeeper, ideally the player most familiar with the game. 
Timekeeper: The Timekeeper is the player that keeps the game moving forward by performing Altitude Zone Changes and ensuring that a sand timer is always active during game play. When a sand timer runs out, the Timekeeper needs to Change Altitude Zones as follows:
Change Altitude Zones:
1.Remove the active Sand Timer from the game.
2.Remove the top Altitude Zone Card from the game.
3.Start a new Sand Timer for the new Altitude Zone.
4.Each player draws new Resource Cards according to number of players.
Meteor Size: At the beginning of the game, the Meteor cards are placed face down. The back of the Meteor card provides an approximate size, so you have a general idea how big the Meteor is but you do not know the exact size until the Meteor Card is revealed. The exact size of the Meteor indicates how much damage the Rocket needs to inflict in order to destroy the Meteor.
If the Meteor Card is face down when you launch a Rocket, flip the Meteor Card over to reveal the exact size of the Meteor. Leave the Meteor Card face up for the remainder of the game.
There are three different ways a Rocket will interact with a Meteor:
1.If the damage of the launched Rocket EQUALS the exact size of the Meteor, the Meteor is destroyed. Place the launched Rocket in the discard pile and remove the destroyed Meteor from the game.
2.If the damage of the launched Rocket is LESS than the exact size of the Meteor, the launched Rocket has no effect and is placed in the discard pile. The Meteor is unharmed and stays in the Meteor Field.
3.If the damage of the launched Rocket is GREATER than the exact size of the Meteor, the Meteor is destroyed. Place the launched Rocket in the discard pile and remove the destroyed Meteor from the game. Note that the player just caused an Overkill.
There are some Meteors that have unique Traits. The Meteor Traits may affect how a Rocket interacts with a Meteor.
Overkill: Overkill is a big explosion caused by an overpowered Rocket. This big explosion blasts the remaining Meteors one Altitude Zone closer to earth. The Timekeeper Changes Altitude Zones immediately. If an Overkill occurs in Altitude Zone 1, the remaining Meteors are blasted into earth and players lose the game. If the players Overkill the only remaining Meteor in Altitude Zone 1, the players win the game because the Overkill destroyed the Meteor.
Multiple Overkills: It is possible that the players can work together to destroy more than one Meteor at the same time. If this happens and more than one Rocket creates an Overkill, then you are still blasted forward only one Altitude Zone. Overkill does not stack. If the players manage to destroy all the remaining Meteors at the same time, they win the game even if it would have caused multiple amounts of Overkill.
Game End: The game ends when one of the following happens:
1.The Meteors are at Altitude Zone 1, the Sand Timer has run out and the last Meteor has not been destroyed. The meteors smash into the Earth and the players lose.
2.The players destroy ALL the Meteors and win by saving the Earth.
3.The players Overkill a Meteor in Altitude Zone 1 and it is not the last Meteor. The Meteors blast into the Earth and the players lose.

Title Bar
The Dark Castle Tile Set is a printable PDF that includes a big variety of halls and rooms to make a great dungeon for RPG's or other Dungeon crawling adventure games. I want to make sure this is very clear so am including this on the top of the page.  What you actually receive are PDF papercraft files, not a finished product.  While I did all the hard work designing the files so it is simply print and cut and glue, I want to be certain people are clear. 
Inspired by retro video games I took a slightly different approach to the gritty realistic tiles that are often offered. These are all hand designed graphics that are meant to inspire the fun of those classic themes. 
The tiles are designed to print on standard US Letter with 25mm squares.  The prototype tiles are shown printed at standard quality for my printer with no adjustments on cardstock. The following picture shows a single print run, no duplicate prints.  
Full Set
Close-Up A
Close-Up B
Close-Up C
Close-Up D
Exploded Tiles
Backers of the Supporter level will gain access to all Dark Castle Tiles that are unlocked over the course of the campaign (which will later be bundled as a separate expansion).  Also all Supporters will get a free PDF with all the Blue and White checkered floors done in Red and White as a thanks for your support. 
Red and Blue Checker Sample
Here is a preview of the tile set so you know exactly what to expect.  (If you click on it you will get a PDF of the file)
Dark Castle Preview
Serpent Caverns Add-On +$6
 Here is a preview of the Serpents Caverns tileset.  It is still a WIP but I am pretty happy with how it is turning out.  I'd love your feedback though.  As much as this is my project, I want my backers to be involved. 
Second Pass on the Serpent Caverns
 Here are some built preview tiles for the Serpent Caverns, these are not final tiles, and I may do some adjustments still, but I needed to print and build them to get a nice feel for them.  
Serpent Caverns Overview Sample
Close-Up A
Close-Up B
Close-Up C
Stretch Goals
Throughout the kickstarter if things go well we'll add some Stretch Goals, maybe even entirely new tilesets. 
$125 - Unlocked - Dark Castle Water Rooms - These will be a series of halls and rooms which have flooded or water features.  Flooded sections will also have non-flooded corresponding sections.  
Preview of the Flooded Hallways
Water Tile Preview
$150 - Unlocked - Dark Castle Corruption Tiles - Dark Magic is corrupting the castle causing rifts between this world and another.  From this void comes all sorts of unspeakable and indescribable horrors.  These tiles will let you transition back and forth between that realm and the normal.  
Corruption Previews
$175 - Unlocked - Dark Castle Specialty Rooms - This set will include a few larger multi-page rooms, as well as some that are more unique or unusual.  I also hope to include a few puzzle style items.  Like Push Button puzzle components, and some other small props. 
$200 - Unlocked Add-On- $6 - The Serpent Caverns Tileset - The Serpent Caverns tileset is a completely new set of adventures in the fiery caverns of the serpent lords.  With a warm earthy cavern feel and beautiful stone serpent pattern inlaid into the floors it is an excellent alternate setting to the more cold dungeon of the Dark Castle.  This is not a free goal like the previous ones, it is an entirely new tileset, I am still charging the same low price of $6 for this set though, and it will include all Serpent Caverns Expansions for free!
$250 - Unlocked - The Serpent Caverns Lava Expansion - Adding flowing lava to the Serpent Caverns these tiles will make the heroes quest even more perilous. 
$325 - Unlocked - Photo Tutorials - As the 2.5d dungeon layout is new for many of you, I'll be grabbing some help and doing a photo tutorial for the best ways to build these dungeons. It will also include tips for building your own additions, like how to add jars, pillar and such from simple supplies at the craft store.  
$400 - Unlocked - The Serpent Caverns Room Expansion - Even more interesting rooms for the Serpent Caverns.  These will be more along the lines of puzzles and challenges for the heroes.
$475 - Unlocked - Props - I will add a series of 2.5d props, this isn't fully fleshed out yet, so would appreciate your feedback! My current ideas are maybe some really simple fountains, doors and statues.  I want these to be very simple builds more like figure flats than full projects in their own rights.  The beauty of this project was simplicity, so I want to keep it that way. 
$600 - Unocked - Forest Temple Add-On - $6 - The forest temple will add another entirely new set.  This being a heavily overgrown vine covered temple. 
$800 - Unlocked - Digital Tiles - Scaled for use with D20Pro(and hopefully similiar programs) these lower resolution files will be chopped up into exact dimension tiles so they can be quickly added to your D20 Pro games.
$1,000 - Unlocked - Notched Door Fittings - These small hall pieces are designed to fit the Twisting Catacombs doors.  It will require a more specific cut, but it will allow their Standard Width Double Doors to fit into the dungeons perfectly.  This is basically a free sheet, one per tileset.
$1,200 - Unlocked - Random Dungeon Generation Cards for the Dark Castle - This is a simple Card deck with small images of the dungeon tiles on them.  This will let you simply draw what room or hallway to place next.  (due to the designs this will not be perfect, you may need to tweak what rooms you use to prevent your dungeon from being one room long)
$1,500 - Unlocked - Forest Temple Courtyard - This will add a series of courtyard tiles to the Forest Temple set.  
About Us
AdventureCraft Dungeons are a series of pdf files that are designed to build your own 2.5d dungeons using some foamcore (or cardboard), a gluestick, and these files. 
All miniatures shown are from Impact! Miniatures.
Zealot Miniatures - Twisting Catacombs
For those looking for some awesome dungeon scenics to add to your dungeons, Zealot Miniatures is doing a really awesome line of terrain that would suit these tiles really well.

You can also donate via our Paypal button for rewards: http://www.blankmediagames.com/
A game of murder, mystery and deception where town members try to survive the noose or the knife.
Update: We are funded but the work isn't done yet!
Play online at www.blankmediagames.com/TownOfSalem to lynch the Mafia, Serial Killers, Arsonists and Witches!
Town of Salem is a fresh innovation on the classic party games Mafia and Werewolf. It is a game of murder, accusations, deceit and mob hysteria.
Town of Salem takes place in the era of the Salem witch trials in an alternate universe version of Salem, MA. 
Mobile, Steam and Localization 
Town of Salem is currently operating as a free-to-play browser game. Since the launch of the Alpha version our fans have been clamoring for 3 things:  
When is the mobile version coming out?
When is the Steam version coming out?
When will there be support for non-English speaking players?  
That is what this Kickstarter is all about. We need help from the community to be able to tackle all of the difficulties and challenges that will come from doing the mobile and Steam ports, as well as the localization support.
How To Play
The game ranges from 7 to 15 players. These players are randomly divided into alignments - Town, Mafia, Serial Killers, Arsonists and Neutrals. If you are a Town member (the good guys) you must track down the Mafia and other villains before they kill you. The catch? You don't know who is a Town member and who is a villain. If you are an evil role, such as a Serial Killer, you secretly murder town members in the veil of night and try to avoid getting caught. 
Roles
Town of Salem has 29 unique roles ensuring a different experience each time you play. 
Before a game starts, players are put into a lobby where the host can select what roles will be in the game. Players are then assigned roles at random from the list of chosen roles. Players have an in-game role card that explains their role's abilities and alignments. For an in-depth look at the abilities of each role please visit: www.blankmediagames.com/roles
Game Phases
Night
The night phase is when most roles use their abilities. For example, Serial Killers stealthily murder people, Doctors heal people who are attacked, and Sheriffs interrogate people for suspicious activity.
Day
The day phase allows the Town members to discuss who they suspect of being an evil role. Once the voting phase starts a majority vote from the town will put someone on trial. 
Defense 
The defense phase is when you plead your innocence to the town. Have a convincing story or find yourself facing the gallows! 
Judgement
During this phase the town will vote on the fate of the defendant. Players can vote guilty, innocent or abstain. If there are more guilty votes than innocent votes the defendant is sentenced to death by hanging! 
Rewards
Donor Rewards
Sponsor Rewards
Benefactor Rewards
Patron Rewards
Philanthropist Rewards
Humanitarian Rewards
Customization
Players are able to choose many of their own customization options:
Characters
Houses
Maps
Pets
Death Animations
In-Game Name
These customization options are displayed to everyone else in the game unless you decide to hide them.
Play With Friends
 Town of Salem has an in-game friends list that lets you easily play with your friends!
Achievements
Town of Salem has over 200 achievements with an in-game browser to check out which cool achievements you have earned!
Earning achievements grant Town Points which are used to purchase items from the shop.
Raving Reviews
We have already been Steam Greenlit!
We were on the front page of the of the June issue of Indie Game Magazine.

campaign.story:
It all started with a 3 year old and some demo gears. From her excitement, the original Gear Lab Kickstarter was born. In the three years since then, Gear Lab has gone to many Maker Faires, Gaming and Steampunk Cons and art shows. They have been built for schools and science museums, but everywhere we went, people would say " I wish I had enough space to have that at home".  From that desire and our love of puzzles and games, GearLab,Jr was born. 
PLAY

After some at home play testing and a few prototypes, we took it to the 2014 Steampunk World's Fair to get in more play testing and take a few pre-orders. 
The reaction both pleased and excited us. Everyone had suggestions of where we should try to cut deals and how to mass market it. Cogbots Studio is poised to launch what we believe will be a breakout product, but to support it, we need to expand our manufacturing capabilities. Like all Cogbots gears and kinetic kits,the GearLab Jr puzzle game will be made in America from cabinet grade plywood.  Each kit takes approximately 10 hours to cut, so to meet demand, we need to expand beyond our single CNC machine.  
With this Kickstarter, you will be funding extra equipment to manufacture the game, as well as the needed infrastructure to support the equipment. With this growth, we will be able to cut between 15-25 kits per week, instead of the 5 we can currently cut now. 
The first of the pre-orders have shipped, but the item will not be added to the Cogbots web store until all of the Kickstarter orders have been cut and shipped. This means about a 10 month delay in adding the game to the store, or in cutting any bigger deals. We believe we owe that to our backers who are funding the capital outlay that will help us grow US Manufacturing. 
What you get:
Cogbots sells kits that are unfinished and some assembly is required. 
The instructions for how to put it together and tips for sanding and finishing are here:  https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLg2bhP0aPlWSIPOhqan8DpEdLRw8lkzKg
There are a few reward levels that include finished kits, these are a special item and the product will NOT be sold as finished when it is released in the store. 
Kickstarter Special Editions:
Folks at the Steampunk World's Fair and others who have play tested since have already started asking for more and so we have started planning expansion packs and add-ons for more interesting play. The Kickstarter Special Edition rewards will include a special gear set combination that will NEVER be offered in any other venue. This is a one- time only special collector's set that is added to your base GearLab Jr game. A future update will include the images of these add-on gears, as the design team is still making choices. 
A Gear Puzzle Community:
Because the base kit is customizable, we are also launching a community for you to share and challenge each other. The kit comes with a download-able PDF of  the starting challenge cards. Cogbots will be adding new challenges to the community site each month, but there will be a forum where you can add your own challenge and game styles as well. Will you paint on a path to be completed, bonus point markers to be battled over?  Will you play solitaire or head to head competitions? We are excited to see what cool combinations you can add in an open source game rules community.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Although they say every project has risks, we have done our best to mitigate the risks here. We chose an all or nothing model for the Kickstarter so that we did not end up in a situation where we did not raise enough to expand as needed to meet demand in a reasonable amount of time. 
The game has been designed, play-tested and refined. There are a few lucky souls out there who already have one in their hands. 
The only thing that would delay us from making these when we get funded would be something catastrophic, and we carry insurance to help cover those cases. 
We are being careful and conservative in the games we promise for Christmas- which is why there is a premium on those. After that, the orders will be shipped in a first in/first out queue. 
Cogbots has been cutting and shipping functional wooden gears around the world for almost 5 years now, so this is an expansion of existing capabilities, not an attempt at something never tried.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

We want to thank all of you for your interest and support of GearLab,Jr.  
This was a market test for Cogbots and although it did not prove out a mass market, we continue to get amazingly positive feedback on the game.  
Here are my thoughts on why a "failed" kickstarter is a success:  https://roguepuppet.wordpress.com/2014/09/27/the-success-of-a-failed-kickstarter/

We have had more than a handful of teachers wistfully wishing they had budget for a classroom full of GearLab Jr games. As you may know, most teachers end up spending their own cash for supplies for the classroom, and teachers in the US are rarely rolling in cash. 
To help them out, and to give you a chance to expand the STEM materials in your favorite schools, we have added three new reward levels at a special STEM reward level. These MUST be shipped to a school address when the survey completes.

It's a late update tonight, but we just got back home from spending all day at Makevention in Bloomington, IN. If you are reasonably local, we highly recommend this independent Maker gathering. We had excellent feedback and had so much fun when we put up two tabletop challenges, two game boards and let the attendees have fun. 
One of the things we love about this game is how it brings together families as they work together to solve a challenge.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've been sculpting, moulding, casting and selling miniatures online since April 2002 and am well accustomed to how much work is involved. I have very high standards of quality control and utter dedication to getting it right for my customers. I've also had to overcome a massive challenge in the form of the Dragon model that I also now manufacture in-house. This last one has taught me a massive amount about the vagaries of resin casting and I am supremely confident that after the Dragon, anything else will seem simple by comparison.

I already did a test run of castings for the NetherLord in April that have exposed where the main problems lie (most of them with the NetherLord face, arms and legs ripping the moulds!) so I am aware of what issues to watch out for and which areas of the model may cause problems during production, etc and have altered the models to mitigate this. 

The main challenge with this project is how much time it takes to make the moulds and cast the parts, and the fact I have to cast 140 dragons between now and Christmas before I can start casting the rewards for this project. Doing multiple sets of moulds will take quite a bit of time but will make the production run much faster, so it should balance out. If this campaign goes well I will even be able to hire some help to speed things up!

If the project gets enough funds I will be able to first of all take a few weeks off from the "regular" orders to concentrate on casting as much of the Dragon queue as I can to clear the decks for the time needed to make the dozens of production moulds for the models featured in this Kickstarter. or, if there's more funds than that and I can find the right person to help out, buy more pressure casting equipment and hire a new minion to train up in resin casting to overcome this.

Regardless, I should be finished the current dragon queue by Christmas if things proceed on schedule, so I'm estimating that shipment of the NetherLords and Azaroth models can begin in late January after the Christmas Break. if I manage to get a staff member thanks to this campaign, that will help things move faster. Fingers crossed!

The worst that could happen is that it takes a bit longer to get all the monsters moulded up and ready to production cast than i thought, but I'm allowing a fair amount of time in the shipping dates. If all goes as hoped Dragon-wise, I will be able to start proper production casting and shipping in the third or fourth week of February 2015, but if not, it will be March at the latest when things start going out.

I've got a reputation for utter honesty with my customers, and so if anything does go a bit wrong you'll be kept informed at every stage. Equally if things go well and stuff starts shipping early, I'll be sure to let you know right away! I'll keep constant updates on here and on my Facebook and Twitter feeds, and a regular update on my site and blog, too.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
"Wow, an update," you cry, wondering what Kickstarter this was again. Yes, I'm still here, just about, despite one of the worst 12 months of trading i've ever had since 2002 and still slowly but surely grinding out monsters and sending them around the world whenever I can. 
Many of you have elected to follow me on Instagram or Facebook or Twitter, but most of you probably haven't, and I simply haven't had the time to sit down and write a blog in absolutely ages; so I'm sorry about that, particularly for those of you wondering where your pledge is because all the models you pledged for are seemingly on the site. In  about 20 percent of the remaining 99 pledges from the pledge manager , you're probably waiting for Madame.  I've had some difficulties with mould lines on her that have slowed things down, but I've come up with a new way of casting her body to eliminate those. I'm in the process of making 5 new big moulds that once all are done will speed up the remaining 20 or so castings for those of you waiting. (2 done at the moment, making a third this weekend, half a dozen good castings waiting to be packed). Meanwhile, a lovely paintjob has been done by Steve Wingate on a master casting so if you weren't thinking of painting her all rotten and manky, you could go all pale and disgustingly sexy:

So nice to see her in colour at last! Jakob Unge of Sweden is the first person to get her assembled and painted! He's gone for a motley rotting scheme, which is just glorious, Darlings! I sculpted her so that she could be painted like that for fans of plague gods, or in a pastel scheme for the lust god lovers...
I'm slowly accruing a lot of tentacles in the workshop so that I can send her out to all the backers, it's just a question of getting the chance to get them produced, it takes ages! Hoping to get another ten of her out the door next week if I can.

IMPORTANT
I've said this before, but this really does matter and is worth repeating. I've just been checking through the pile of pledges that were put through on the Pledge Manager Store when it was open during 2015 and it look like there's a good 140 or more pledges that are now eligible to be sent out once enough Azaroths, Centaurs and NL1 wings are cast up (and once I've remade the Dungeon troll moulds again over the next couple of days) so if you have moved house since you put through your pledge details and haven't yet messaged me to say so, please do! I will be sending stuff out to the addresses already on file unless you let me know and this has already caused some problems for some of you that had moved and forgot to tell me.

updates.update_content:
Farewell, My Minion...
Not one of the happy updates, but I pride myself in keeping you informed of all significant events rather than just the sales promos etc, and this will impact on the completion rate (just when we were about to break the back of the beast)
I'm sorry to announce that due to the ongoing poor day-to-day sales of Heresy, the money has officially run out. This has meant that I had to tell Dan, who joined me in December 2014 to help me get both the Dragon and The Kickstarter out, that I could no longer afford to pay him; he can't work for free, he's a real person, so from this point on it's back to just being me doing all the packing and casting and moulding and running the business and sculpting.

We are back in the workshop after a short period of time off last week to try to recover from the last 4 months of frantic work. I've made myself a bit ill with too many 12 hr days/7 days a week so i'm promising my wife I'll start taking weekends off at home (to sculpt the remaining big models, the NL2 and the Giant, and the Light Vs Dark diorama etc. You can see a potential NL2 wing on the Instagram link below)
Currently tidying after Salute and building shelving to contain the huge amount of moulds and mould frames from all the stuff I've made so far, in a desperate attempt to get the space to make the new moulds for Az and Madame. To give you a clue what we're up against, check the instagram link:

Don't fret over the apparent quiet, it's simply that I'm working so hard to try to get things done that taking the time out to post a proper update with pictures of everything that is on the desk or being moulded is time that I simply don't have! Almost everything is sculpted/fixed up now, except for the NL2 (both versions), the Angel & B'Hakoth, some little bits like the arms of the Tunnel Dweller, and of course, the Giant. I have just finished months of work doing Madame Ner'Gabba - her tentacles took weeks - and master moulded her, now trying to prep the parts for production moulding alongside everything else - and when I say that, I mean EVERYTHING else needs new moulds. They really do wear out a phenomenal rate.

updates.update_content:
Dear God, It's 2016!
Where does the time go?
There have been a few surprising setbacks from unexpected directions in the last six months, such as Meatpie the Fat Ogre having some different fault go wrong in each of 4 moulding attempts that prevented me from getting a high quality casting each time we've tried (BIG seam line down the legs, for instance, easily cleaned off but not at the high standards to which I hold Heresy) but by and large things are still progressing slowly but surely. At the moment I am trying to spin a lot of plates and do little bits on everything to try and keep everyone content that yes, their pledge is being worked on, but I'm now focusing on the little fiddly details that are holding back several kits: the Centaur (new hands, thicker spear and improved arms that aren't just tubes should be the last tweak needed - just making sure the joins are up to scratch with him this weekend), the Deathball Ogres (all new arms and hands in addition to the tweaks made to the torso and legs - the previous DB Ogre hands are too dated, being massive beyond all measure in my 2005 style, so I've made smaller ones with new punch-weapon options and ones that don't have weapons at all, which I can then use on any brand new DB ogres or regular ogres that I make), Skullsmasher (subtly changed the pose of the right arm so that it looks less Bruce Forsyth and more head-down shoulder-charge as well as tweaking a few muscles and the hooves so that they are more cow and less banana, improved fitting on the head options) and I've finished tweaking the KS-exclusive Original Ogre With Club so that it looks the same but better (again, humongous hands replaced and some tweaks so that the body looks a smidgeon more anatomically plausible compared to the original metal one).

Maggotmen Now Squirming Out Into The World
Minion Dan has now started to cast the resin figures, which is freeing up my time to finally sit down and get things really sorted with the tweaking and moulding. The Maggotmen and Waspquitoes are now in production and we have almost completed the amount of packs we need to fulfill all the pledges that people have put through so far on the Pledge Manager Store. Today, Dan will be packing the 40 or so pledges that have been waiting for Maggotmen and Waspquitoes and these will begin to arrive around the world over the next week or so, depending on your local mail service's efficiency!

campaign.story:
It's Paris, and it's 1909. You are a master chef, just graduated from the city's most prestigious cooking school.
And so are your enemies.
Fish Cook is a game about cooking fish. You vie to become the best chef in France by earning money, prestige, and the respect of your peers. (And since it's based off of a tabletop game, prestige and respect are conveniently measured in money.)
Fish Cook is originally a tabletop game by James Ernest, and has been well-received since its publication in 2013, with favorable reviews from Gaming Bits, Push Your Luck, The Dice Tower, Dice Card Go, and Blog Critics.  And now we are excited to bring to you the digital version of Fish Cook, including gorgeous upgraded art, fun chef avatars, AI opponents, and remote multiplayer support!
Concept of how local multiplayer will work, with one screen displaying public information and private screens for each player to keep track of their private information and inventory

The game takes place over several "days," which are divided into a morning and an evening. In the morning, you take turns buying ingredients from the markets, and in the evening, you take turns cooking recipes. You can cook your own secret recipes, or you can copy good ideas from the recipes that have been cooked before. 
The strategy of the game revolves around spending your money wisely. The market price of each type of ingredient goes up as it becomes more scarce. So you need to make buying decisions that get your ingredients as cheaply as possible. There is also risk management: you can use a bigger fish for a smaller recipe, but you might have paid too much for it. And if you don't cook a fish by the end of the day, you have to throw it away. Is it worth the risk to buy a big fish first, and possibly waste it on an inferior dish? 
If you want to know more about the history and development of Fish Cook, James has written a designer's diary.

We love tabletop games, and playing together in-person.  We believe that the experience of the tabletop game can be preserved while adding to it with the convenience of going digital. Players use the free Jovios Controller app to view hidden information on their own phone, while the main view of the game lives on a shared device. The Jovios Controller allows you to view your own hidden information and look through other game information while other players are taking their turns.
Unique app features include...
Play the game in real-time, with all of your friends around one table, utilizing separate screens for public and private information 
Play online against your friends or random strangers 
AI opponents for single and multi player games
Gorgeous updated art
Fun chef avatars

James has great plans for his games, and we have talked to other great designers about their games. This campaign covers much of the structure of the tabletop apps, and we'll keep it going as long as you keep wanting more tabletop apps.
To demonstrate how the app would work for local multiplayer, we have published an Alpha version up for you to try out. Get the free controller for iOS or Android.  Check it out!
As part of our campaign, we're pleased to offer several exclusive in-app bonuses and rewards to our backers!
Kickstarter Exclusive Celebrity Chefs: We've teamed up with several well known writers, artists and game designers to be featured among the character portraits that players select to represent themselves in the game. Original Art vs. New High-Res Art

Get early access to the game, be part of the action and contribute to the development of the app by reporting bugs and requesting features to make the game even better!  We expect to have remote play ready by the time the campaign ends (cross your fingers).  Beta access is available for backers at the $15 level and above.
Coins: Campaign Coins made special limited-edition 39mm metal coins for the Pairs and Get Lucky campaigns, and we're pleased to continue this tradition of rare, high quality bling with our own Kickstarter exclusive Fish Cook coin.  The Fish Cook coin is included in backer levels of $25 and above.
Fish Cook kickstarter exclusive coin design, with Pairs coin as finished example

Fish Cook Print Edition
Cheapass Money and Fish Cook Themed Dice Set: We've joined forces with James Ernest to create a new print run of Cheapass money for all your gaming needs. Or you can just roll around in a pile of fake money. This consists of a total of 90 playing card quality bills.  The fronts include the characters from Cheapass Games and the backs are uniform, for when secret money counting is required. The Cheapass money is available to backers at the $75 level and above.
Have or want the Fish Cook print edition but don't have any dice to spare? We can solve your problem with this dice set from Chessex, curated to color match the Fish Cook ingredients. Because seriously, who doesn't love to roll a giant handful of dice?!  The dice set is available for backers at the $75 and above.
Become a Chef Avatar: Become a part of the game and work with us to create a personalized chef portrait. Send us a picture of yourself, friend, family member or some lucky person of your choice and we will create a chef portrait based on it. You can even help design the outfit and the prop that your chef avatar will be holding.  In addition to including it in the game, we will send you the digital hi-res version of the final artwork.  If you ever wanted a portrait of your pet hamster dressed as a chef proudly holding a pumpkin seed to hang and admire on your mantel piece, this is your chance.  We do keep editorial control to change anything we view as too inappropriate, as well as limiting the number of revisions.
Add-ons
$5 - additional copy of the game for any platform
$9 - add the Cheapass money to any backer level
$16 - add the Fish Cook themed dice to any backer level
$5 - International shipping on add-ons if no physical good is included in your chosen backer level.
Cheapass Games is a tiny game company in Seattle, run by designer James Ernest. They specialize in low-cost games that are funny and fast.
James Ernest (Tabletop Game Designer): Founder, president, and lead game designer at Cheapass Games, he's responsible for a slew of tabletop games, including Lords of Vegas, Kill Doctor Lucky, Pairs and Brawl.
Cat Duo is the company behind Jovios, a platform that turns mobile devices into hidden hands to accompany the tabletop game, enabling a real-time, multiplayer gaming experience that you can play anytime, anywhere. We are also a proud member of the Kickstarter community, KickingItForward.
David Geisert (Software Engineer and Project Manager): CEO, primary software developer, and product lead for Cat Duo. With a background in games, finance and management, he is working diligently on the app to create the future of games.
Stephanie Lee (UI/UX and Graphic Designer): A mechanical engineer by day and a graphic designer by night, Steph has a strong background in product design and development at startup companies.
Candice Trebus (Marketing and Community Manager): Social nerd and technophile with seven years of PR/Marketing experience and a passion for games of all kinds.
We chose to crowd-fund this project for a few reasons:
Tradition and Exclusive Collectibles: James Ernest has a fantastic history of Kickstarting his games, including Pairs, Get Lucky, Deadwood Studios USA and Unexploded Cow. We would like to continue this tradition of success and offering backers Kickstarter exclusive collectibles, such as the limited edition coin and celebrity chef in-app portraits.
Transparency and Accountability: A major part of the Cheapass Games philosophy is to include player input in the game creation process. We wish to continue this tradition by being open and transparent to our backers and including them in the app creation process through frequent updates and participation in our beta.
Grow the Jovios Controller: Crowd-sourced projects do an excellent job of testing the market for adoption of new and innovative products. We want to know if the public is ready for a new way to play mobile games. With the success of the Fish Cook app, we have a green light to develop more Cheapass Games through this platform, and develop the technology even further.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have made mobile games before and have experience from both independent development and large companies, such as Zynga. However, this is our very first time on Kickstarter. What we lack in direct personal experience in crowdfunded projects, we make up for with fantastic mentorship and enthusiasm. James has four successful Kickstarters under his belt, and has been an integral part of the planning of the campaign and the development of the Fish Cook app.

Making a mobile game, especially a good mobile game, takes a lot of time and effort. We still have a lot of work ahead of us, but we are extremely dedicated and excited to be working with so many fantastic people in the gaming and geek community. We are completely dedicated to making this app happen, and will work as hard and as long as it takes to finish it to a high quality standard.

That being said, with the celebrity chefs, this campaign has the potential to grow very large. As the project grows, there is the increasing possibility that certain elements (primarily the artwork) will take longer than expected.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Based on the Alterna Comics graphic novel by creator & writer Peter Simeti, penciler Kevin Christensen, and editor Erin Kohut - THE CHAIR follows the story of Richard Sullivan (to be played by Brian Thompson), an innocent man struggling to escape execution on death row. Witnessing the torture and murder of his fellow inmates at the hands of the prison's sadistic and psychotic Warden (to be played by Bill Oberst Jr.), Sullivan decides that the only way to survive is to fight back. But as he matches the savagery and brutality occurring in the prison, Sullivan is forced to come face to face with his own sanity. 
Many strong themes are prevalent in the film, including domestic violence, child abuse, mental health care, the criminal justice system, and capital punishment. 
A battle of nature vs. nurture, THE CHAIR is a dark and gritty psychological horror film without monsters, zombies, or vampires - a film that shows the capacity for good and evil that exists within all of us.

Tell us in the comments!

Freyja, the God of love, beauty, fertility, war and death!

Tyr, the brave and courageous God of law and heroic glory!

Freyr, God of virility, prosperity, holy judgement and sacred kingship!
Bragi, the Norse God of poetry, wisdom, bards and the power of speech!
Heimdallr stands on the burning rainbow bridge that leads to Asgard, protecting the Gods from the jotun. His mighty horn, Gjallarhorn, signals Ragnarök and the death of the Gods!
Njörd is an ancient God of the Vanir, father of Freyja and Frejr. He is God of the wind, of the sea and of wealth!
Thor is the slayer of giants and wielder of Mjölnir. He is the mighty God of thunder, oak trees, strength and the protector of mankind!
Frigg, Queen of Asgard, is the prescient God of motherhood, childbirth and constellations!
Odin is the God of war, battle, victory, death, wisdom, poetry and magic. He is the Allfather, patriarch of the Gods and ruler of the nine worlds!
Thank you for sharing your gameplay ideas and we'll see you in purgatory!
You can download all the Norse Gods here!
In Jotun, you play Thora, a Norse warrior who has died an inglorious death and must face the challenges of Viking purgatory to prove herself to the Gods and enter Valhalla.
Jotun's core loop revolves around collecting Runes to summon and fight the jotun, gigantic Norse elementals. The game focuses on the balance between atmospheric exploration and ferocious combat. Imagine the mysterious romantic mood of Journey mixed with the scale of the boss fights in Shadow of the Colossus in top-down 2D.
The world is randomly-generated and filled with different areas to explore and environmental puzzles to solve. Traveling to the far reaches of Purgatory is key to finding Runes, Shrines to the Gods and many more Viking mysteries.
The combat in Jotun is fast-paced and brutally hard. Using only your massive two-handed axe, you take on foes that are hundreds of times your size. Every hit from a jotun's attack will take out a huge chunk of your health.
Features:
Beautiful 2D hand-drawn art style
Epic boss fights against the mighty jotun
A vast and mysterious randomly-generated world to explore filled with environmental puzzles based in Viking culture and mythology
An overarching story to discover for both Thora and Purgatory itself
Shrines to the Viking Gods
An amazing musical score, specifically composed for every gameplay moment
WOW, we were Greenlit in under 6 days!!!
 Which means we'll be on:
Jotun's gameplay is a love letter to classic games such as The Legend of Zelda. It has simple controls, action-packed boss fights and a mythic Viking world to discover. Jotun is not a "hack-and-slash" RPG. We prefer to avoid numbers and text when possible: there are no experience points and few stats. Like the Vikings, you must prove your valor to the Gods using only your wits and your skill in combat.
Controls
Jotun can be played with a keyboard or a gamepad. Your basic actions are attack, move and dodge. You control Thora from a top-down perspective and can explore the world in any direction. Thora has both a fast and a "charge-up" attack; the attack's power is determined by how long you hold the attack button. Dodging is crucial to avoiding traps and incoming attacks from the mighty jotun.
Combat
Inspired by the mechanics of The Legend of Zelda and Dark Souls, the combat in Jotun is fast-paced and organic. Fighting the jotun requires the ability to dodge projectiles, use proper positioning and attack at the right moment. The jotun have several attacks and defenses. Recognizing them is key to executing your strategy. When in combat, the camera zooms out to give you a full view of the battlefield.
 More details on combat:
Jotun's music is core to the game's experience. Every gameplay moment is accompanied by an appropriate piece. Whether it's a fight against the mighty Frost Jotun or a peaceful contemplation of a beautiful vista, the music is an integral part of Jotun's mood, atmosphere and experience.
"When the prospect of writing the music for Jotun came along, I was filled with excitement at the idea of putting the vast universe Thora will explore during her journey into song. The characters, landscapes and story behind Jotun have already inspired many musical themes that I can't wait to bring to life!" - Max LL
We chose Kickstarter because we want to involve you in the development process. We want your feedback, comments and critiques. Whether you love or hate Jotun, we want to know why. We want to build a community of passionate people all rooting for the same cause. We want you on board with us for the entire journey!
Jotun was born from our love of mythology and epic literature. From Greek mythology to Beowulf, we've always had a fascination for centuries-old stories. Jotun is a tribute to Viking mythology and to classic, honest gaming. We are a passionate and experienced team who can bring the game to fruition. We hope that you'll join us, connect with the game and that you'll enjoy your time with the Jotun family!

campaign.story:
Tired of trying to survive? Sick of scrounging for ammo and dodging the dead? Problem solved. Take control of the zombies and and go!
Welcome to the "Walk in the Park" kick starter.
The goal at the beginning was to accomplish a few things
1: A simple game. No rule bloating.
2: A fast paced and entertaining game.
3: A line of miniatures that could be used with almost any modern style game.
4: A game where players could be the zombies for once :)
5: Finally, and most importantly, a game that is both affordable AND flexible.
6:  A large graphics pack with printable props suitable for any table top game included with rules.
To that end, we present: "Walk in the Park". What sets this apart from others is the fact that you do not need miniatures to play along with some dynamics not found in other games of this type! Provided in the rules are printable tokens for those who don't like to have crates of figures for every game :)
The Game:
Humans Vs Zombies
Player Vs Player with players controlling both sides, including optional rules for human vs human combat.
Multiple Scenarios with Bonus figures for the scenarios as needed.
No Need for miniatures! Tokens are included with game as well.
Boards and grids are optional. Movement can be done with ruler if you don't want to use the grids/maps.
The games setup and scenarios invite role playing into the mix. This will be expanded on next release. Some of the role playing aspects will be added in this release as a stretch goal! Once funding is met, player sheets with bonus abilities will be added.
Simple turn based combat, scenarios to spice things up, and of course a clear goal for each team with scenarios changing the game regularly.
NOTE: Scenarios can make it or break it for EITHER side.
Players controlling the zombies, the dinner bell has rung- GO!
Players controlling the humans...You know the drill.
The  Graphics pack:
The graphics pack is another feature we are offering with the rules and provides many more options for table top play. Including props such as billboards,buildings,vehicles,crates and containers to make game play [and in some cases scenarios] more interesting and ever changing.
*There is almost as much time into the graphics pack as there is the miniatures
Also included are blank grids for designing and creating your own custom maps and skirmish fields.

Hi. LeVar Burton here. You may know me as Kunta Kinte, from ROOTS, or Geordi La Forge, from Star Trek: The Next Generation. 
You also may have grown up with me on Reading Rainbow. 
It was my mother who taught me that, by picking up a book, I could "go anywhere" and "be anything." Ever since Reading Rainbow began in 1983, I have dedicated myself to fostering a love of reading in children, just as my mother did for me. 
Over the past year, I have watched Kickstarter bring communities together to support artists and inventors. Again and again, I have been inspired by watching like-minded people team up to accomplish impossible dreams, and to change the world. 
Now, I am hoping you will join me on my mission: to bring Reading Rainbow back for every child, everywhere.
Together, we can change the lives of millions of children. But you don't have to take my word for it: just keep reading!
I believe that every child has a right, and a need, to be literate. We have a responsibility to prepare our children… and right now, the numbers show that we, as a society, are failing in that responsibility.
And here’s the problem:
And: numerous studies reveal that children who can't read at grade level by the 4th grade are 400% more likely to drop out of high school.
And: as of 2011, America was the only free-market country where the current generation was less well educated than the one before.
These problems won't solve themselves.  Real change will require us all to work together. We cannot afford to lose generations of children to illiteracy. And if we work together, we don't have to.
Through Reading Rainbow, we've been working to solve these problems for over three decades. Starting in 1983, Reading Rainbow successfully used television to turn generations of kids into lifelong readers... with great results.
Of course, when Reading Rainbow began in 1983, we were using television to bring books to kids, meeting them where they wanted to be. In 2014, TV is not that place anymore. Now, we’re trying to reach a new generation of digital natives.
That’s why, two years ago, I launched the Reading Rainbow App for tablets. Building on the basics of the television series, we put hundreds of quality books – and educational video field trips – right in a child’s hands.
The response has been encouraging:
But despite this progress, there are big challenges left to face.
First, not all families have access to tablets. Our goal is to cultivate a love of reading in all children, not just those that have tablets. To reach kids everywhere, we need to be everywhere: we need to be on the web, on mobile devices, on game consoles and on connected televisions. 
Second, a resounding number of teachers have told me that they want Reading Rainbow in their classrooms, where they know it can make a difference. We will provide it, along with the tools that teachers need, including teacher guides, leveling, and dashboards. And with your help, we'll provide it to thousands of disadvantaged classrooms for FREE.
Every Home. Reading Rainbow’s digital collection already contains hundreds of books and video field trips… but with your help, we’ll be able to make the Reading Rainbow library available on more of the devices modern kids use to consume content. Now that we've met our initial goal of $1,000,000, we will be able to launch a new version of Reading Rainbow on the single most-used digital platform: the web. And now that we've reached our stretch goal of$5,000,000, we'll also be able to bring the service to mobile phones, Android, game consoles like XBOX and PlayStation, and set-top boxes like AppleTV and ROKU.
Every Classroom. Together, we want to provide Reading Rainbow to as many classrooms as possible FOR FREE! Now that we've reached our stretch goal of $5,000,000, we'll be able to provide year-long subscriptions in over 7,500 classrooms – and every additional $100K we raise lets us help 500 more!
No matter how much we raise, we promise that every dollar you pledge will bring Reading Rainbow to more platforms, and provide it for free in more classrooms.
We can make sure that millions of kids learn to love reading, but we can’t do it without you. That's why I hope you’ll join me in making a difference!
I believe that spreading the love of reading is its own greatest reward. But if you're going to join our cause, we also have some wonderful prizes. But you don't have to take my word for it... Take a look!
Aside from the signed book, the rewards above will be available to anyone who pledges! 
But we also have several LIMITED EDITION rewards... so be sure to get them before we run out! (And if we DO run out, keep checking back -- we'll do our best to add more when we can!)
Or, if you prefer, you can also pledge for a reward package that will be gifted to the classroom or school of your choice!
And, if you're just interested in Star Trek related rewards, and don't want all of the Reading Rainbow goodies above, we've also got a few special reward levels created just for you:
This Kickstarter – and Reading Rainbow – couldn't happen alone, so I want you to meet the full team behind our Kickstarter.
Everytime I walk into the office, I am reminded that the Reading Rainbow team is made up of passionate, talented artists, producers, engineers, and so many more. Most of them grew up on the show, have families of their own now, and dedicate their working day to improving the lives of the next generation.  
It's an honor to be surrounded by my Reading Rainbow family every day, and we can't wait for you to join us. And if you do, you'll be hearing from several of us throughout the campaign, and after that, in our backer updates. Click on the picture below to learn more about us!

Kingmaking? Gloating? Cheating? Recursion? Silliness? Player Elimination? Broken Cards? Denial? Kibitzing? Ganging up?
All this and more are packed into this tiny game, each with its own card and effect on the game making this:
But this title isn't entirely accurate. Even though it was initially created as a silly exercise in game design, when those elements we all love to hate were combined, I realized I'd stumbled upon a game that is QUICK to play, EASY to learn, and a ton of FUN!
Want to see for yourself? Print out the Print N Play version and give it a try
www.siadek.com/worstgameever.pdf
(Rules in Pig Latin and English)
Worst Cards Ever
Complete Card List at bottom of page
An example of how this game takes something that can be a drag like "Deck Searching" and makes it fun is that instead of one person reading all the cards, the deck is split up so everybody gets to search. This way there is no downtime except for the player who played the card but they get their pick of the searched cards and the player who picked that card gets one of the rest.
If you would like to get a properly printed game, it is going to cost somebody some money so we can publish it.
When we reach the goal of one dollar, I'll have enough money to print out the game on my printer as a hand made prototype with 50 cards in it. I fronted the dough for the snazzy logo and art for 9 of the cards. You can be part of bringing this collection of pet peeves to market. Every dollar we get makes this game that much more professional.
The stretch goal of $3k will allow us to actually going to press with a real printer.
$500 Logo - REACHED
I'll get a professional logo for the card box and card backs.
$1,000 Actually Printing the Game
REACHED!
This would be a pretty weak printing. I'd go to kinko's and run it on fairly stiff card stock and cut it myself on a cutter. It would be a step up from the prototype but not far.  If we don't get to this level, you're all getting prototypes that I hand-make from "Cannibalism" cards leftover from my first printing of Lifeboat.
$3,000 Chinese Printing
REACHED!!
This will be a quality printing in a telescoping box that frankly is better than this game deserves but as a valued backer YOU deserve this and more!
$4,000 Art on all of the Cards
REACHED!!!
We can pay the artist to do art for all of the cards except the ones with too much text.
$5,000 Fifty more cards
REACHED!!!!
I don't know what these cards are yet. I'm assuming based on the fact that everybody I've playtested with has had an idea for a card that we'll find plenty of material. The low hanging fruit is gone but I know of some games that expand into thousands of cards. Even if you don't back the game please add your peeves in the comments section.
$10,000 Die, wooden cubes and Plastic winks included in the game
It took me a while to figure this out but if we get to this level, I can put a die, some wooden cubes and plastic winks included in the box.
$30,000 Custom Die included in the game
At this point, I'm just grasping at straws. Nobody needs a custom die but I want to somehow justify the fact that I'm getting $30 Grand for the worst game ever. I hate custom dice because you can't tell whether the special face is a 6 or a 1. This die will say "Worst Game Ever" on one of the faces. I haven't decided whether it will be the 1 or the 6. Both?  Maybe we'll do a poll for that.
$50,000 Celebrity Endorsement
I'll find somebody more famous than me to say this is the worst game ever. How hard can that be?
I've always believed my brilliant rules and pithy remarks speak for themselves. I've always been wrong. Let's make this funny little game great by dialing up the production values with high quality printing and spiffy art!
Here's a list of all the cards and which have been sponsored with the $50 card sponsor backer level. Find a card you want to back and post in the Comments section after you back at the $50 level.
Get Your Card Now!

campaign.story:
I've been sculpting these figures in the scant spare time I get from commission sculpting since December last year. A great deal of imagination has been put into each figure and a great deal of time in figuring out how to make a range of great looking unique characters that are in almost all cases single part figures so you can have less time prepping the figure before painting and more time gaming! The figures will be cast in either white metal or resin depending on how you want to receive your reward. 
With my new line of "Tooth & Sword" Chibi adventure miniatures I'm seeking to expand what Meridian Miniatures will have to offer the gaming community. I've had a lot of fun learning to sculpt in this style, it providing a perfect counterpoint to my "Steam & Aether" range in both technique and mood. I've have a great deal of enjoyment developing this menagerie of adventuring animals and now the time has come to unleash them. I've sought to cover a fairly wide spectrum of adventuring classes and animal species, something that proved quite challenging when I came to combining the two factors! The first eight figures that I'd like to make available are very loosely grouped as "lawful" and well, less than lawful but they needn't be played that way by RPGers or wargamers! 
Important, these "neutral" figures are now unlocked and can be pledged for ONLY by choosing the relevant metal or resin pledge level. As individual figures they are available a in resin as usual.
These fun looking figures should inspire imaginative players to create their own player characters and fantasy skirmishers alike. With several companies now producing figures in the Chibi style I feel that players have the opportunity to create their own immersive game play with a wide range of figures. With this in mind I've set out to bring my own unique animal adventurers to life, they can easily slot into place in your favourite fantasy world and will become part of my own "Tooth & Sword" players resource setting. I've come to Kickstarter as I've built up quite a range of characters to produce and need to raise funds to cover the moulding costs, artwork and game resource development. With your funding I can get the figures into production and onto your tabletop quickly and in one wave rather than in dribs and drabs over a year or more. Should the figures prove highly successful I'll be able to produce even more goodies to say thanks to you all. 
How it works.
The miniatures have been grouped into two sets for casting in white metal: "the good guys" and "the wicked ones" these sets are the most affordable way to receive your reward and the most cost effective way for me to produce the figures. The moulding and casting of these white metal sets is being handled by Griffin Moulds Ltd, some of the very best mould makers in the UK. You can choose to receive one or two sets at the applicable reward level. For those of you that only want a specific figure or want to mix and match I am offering high quality resin figures as an alternate reward, simply select single figure reward level and set your pledge at a multiple of the level depending on how many individual figures you want. You can even add additional figures to your metal sets by adding to your pledge level
Stretch goals.
Once we reach £3500 I will be giving EVERY BACKER a set of free stickers to say thank you, this is enough on top of the goal to realistically to cover the printing costs, if there's chance I will add more stickers as the campaign goes on.
FREE STICKERS AT £3500
I'm planning on making art prints and more to give as freebies too but all will depend on backer support, more details will come as the campaign progresses. If the demand is there I will sculpt a timed exclusive figure to add as a stretch goal, this can be discussed as the campaign goes on. 
Add ons.
I will be making the various art prints and post card available as add ons during the campaign as well, so long as all goes well. To add anything extra to your pledge just adjust it by the appropriate amount. I will find out exactly what you pledged for when I send out the surveys after the campaign finishes. 
New add-ons!
Add on the resin Hippogryph model for £12 per figure. Picture shows work in progress, check back for updates.
 I am offering these pieces of artwork as high quality A3 prints to anyone that would like to add them on to their pledge, this isn't something that I'm really going to be making profit on, as the postage costs are unfortunately high but I can't not offer them as I'm so happy with the artwork and I'm sure a few of you are going to really enjoy having them up on the wall of your gaming room! If you would like an A3 art print and you are in the UK then just add on £10 for EACH print (lion/mouse or wolf/bat) that you would like. If you are in the rest of the world then please add £14 for EACH print that you would like. These will ship separately to the rest of your pledge and the rates for international postage are especially high for postal tubes
CHARACTER POSTCARDS IN PROGRESS.
The future.
I've got an extensive range of figures planned along with a whole setting  to explore, I've no current plans to release a game system but will be making all sorts of gaming resources available for free. Thanks to every one that has helped contribute towards my venture and to those backing this project. Special thanks go out to all at Impact! miniatures and Mr Honoel A. Ibardolaza, cheers!

After the project is over, learn more about Tiny Epic Defenders and how to order a copy at www.GamelynGames.com
EVERY BACKER MAKES A DIFFERENCE!
"Tiny Epic Defenders is a deck-builder where the deck belongs to the enemy." - Richard Ham
"Packed with meaningful decisions and press-your-luck excitement, Tiny Epic Defenders is not only a clever game, but an amazing cooperative experience!"  - Chris Leder
*Watch a gameplay video below in the Reviews & Videos section*
BASE GAME - ONLY $16! (MSRP=$25)
DELUXE CONTENT INCLUDES
These are mock-up images and not a true representation of the final product. Elements are subject to change. Not to scale.
*Kickstarter Limited Exclusives - VERY limited quantity printed. Will never enter regular distribution channels but may become available via contests, conventions, and/or the BGG store.
GENERAL INFO: Cooperative, 1-4 players, 30 minutes.
THEME: Fantasy, set in the world of Tiny Epic Kingdoms.
HOOK: Fast paced, portable co-op, with a unique turn-deck mechanic.
WIN: Defeat the Epic Foe!
LOSE: Let the Capital City get destroyed!
STORY: After the Great War (Tiny Epic Kingdoms), many of the factions, shattered and defeated, looked for something to cling to. One final hope before the last of their race would flow like the river into the ocean of history, gone and forgotten. It was the sages of the Order of Gamelyn who answered their prayers. They provided a new perspective on unity, and a way of life that would welcome peaceful members of any faction. A utopia for all. With very few options and a will to survive, this world alliance became an inevitable truth in the eyes of many of the factions’ leaders. Even factions who hated one another had nothing left but each other. Under the guidance of the Order of Gamelyn, a Capital City was chosen and factions from all over the world came to call this city their new home. At last, the world was at peace… but not for long. A great storm is coming and in the darkness of the mist, there be demons.
Players are going to be working together, managing threat and attempting to keep up with the evolving Turn Deck. Defending the Capital City is of the utmost importance!
Start by selecting a Hero!
Each Hero brings unique benefits to the party.
Then design your World!
Using THIS pattern, players choose the placement of the Outer Regions!
Next, select your preferred difficulty and prepare your Turn & Horde Decks accordingly.
Both Enemy turns and Hero turns are thrown into the Turn Deck. SHUFFLE and UNLEASH!
 ...now get PLAYING!
The Horde Deck acts like a timer as it feeds cards into the Turn Deck each round. As the Turn Deck evolves each round, it will be up to players to adapt with it. Learn your deck, win the game!
As the game continues, each round is getting harder and harder!
As Enemy Cards are drawn, Region threat is increased. Without progressive turn-management they will begin to burn, exposing the Capital City.
The game will continue to evolve as Dire Enemies are introduced.
Dire Enemies bring threatening powers into play but offer great rewards to the Heroes tough enough to defend them!
Acquire Artifacts and you may survive long enough to see the Epic Foe!
Defending a Dire Enemy yields a powerful one-time-use item that can shift the tides of battle in your favor!
So, you've made it! Enter the EPIC FOE!
You made it this far, but do you have anything left!? Now the REAL pain begins!
If you are able to do enough damage to the Epic Foe and kill it, you've just won the game! You are now one-of-a-kind in your gaming group and will surely have a great week!
You can download the prototype rules below. This version of the rules has not yet received the wonderful treatment of the graphic artist.
Click HERE to download the TED Rules of Play (prototype)
NEW Tiny Epic Kingdoms Premium Print 'N Play Add-On!
