WELCOME BACKERS:
Financial help is requested in the amount of $300,000.00 to aid into the launch of Pegasus Games. I'll be left with $280,000.00 to achieve my goals after Amazon and Kickstarter each take 5% commission. My initial Kickstarter campaign had a total of six game units, which I had estimated would require an expense of $100,000.00 or more to process for manufacturing and distribution. However, it was brought to my attention that I should start my campaign with less unit and request a lesser amount.
I do understand that it is an exceeding amount to ask for, but I am not interested in licensing the game to a toy manufacturer. I am currently looking to venture into this endeavor on my own. It all starts with a vision and like all dreams of success, you must first take the initial steps into achieving that dream. I see Kickstarter as my first steps into my dreams of success since without your financial backing i am unable to fund for my own project.
Currently, I do not have a professional prototype to show, but as a graphic designer I am able to provide a design for this product. Hopefully, you will be able to understand the creative concept behind Pegasus Gaming Units from its Game Rules and Game Designs that are provided below. My intent as the license holder and sole game creator is to use your funding to seek manufacturing and distribution for the following game editions;
PEGASUS: PRO EDITION
PEGASUS: MINI EDITION
DOMINUS: A PEGASUS EDITION
I am here because I believe in this game since it is a new abstract strategic game that was developed from three other classic game concepts like, Draughts (Checkers), Reversi (Othello) and the legendary game of Chess. It is only with your assistance and generosity that this vision will be achieved. So, it is through my humble words and great honor that I present to your attention, Pegasus Games.
PEGASUS -PRO EDITION
Pegasus is a two player strategic game where each piece must be placed on the game board. The Game is a 10x10 pegboard; each user has 50 pegs black or white; Each peg or pawn has a bottom and top, the top is the game player's home color, the bottom is the opponents' color. The objective is to jump your opponent's pawns and take over his army. The end results will be determined by the color of the game board and chosen color of Pegasus.
Age: 12+ and over
Product Details: 100 Pegs, 50 White/50 Black, 2 Home Boards, 10x10 Game Board/Reverse Cover, Storage Case and Game Timer (optional)
How To Play:
1.Choose a side; Black or White Game Pawn
2.Each player takes turn placing their pegs on board, one at a time
3.Once a peg is placed it can not be moved, unless under Game Rules
4.Player may not place pawn and make a diagonal move with another pawn.
5.Player loses turn when choosing to jump before Pawn placement
6.A player can only pass play after his or her Game Pawns are out of home board.
7. Game Pawns can be used to build Walls, to Gallop and Free Captured Pawns.
8. Captured Pawns have minor restrictions under Game Rules.
9. All Pawns must remain on board until a victory is declared, unless under Game Rules.
10. Capture as many of your opponent's pawns to claim control of the game board and color of Pegasus. Avoid jumping and confront your opponent's pawns head on.
Player Pawn Rules:
1. A Player has the choice to place pawn or move pawn from the board.
2. Solid Color pawns may only jump an opponent Game pawn, under jumping rules;
3. Solid Color pawn must jump an opponent's pawn to capture the peg into their side of play.This is also known as a Turned Pawn.
4. Solid Color pawn may not jump over its own solid color; unless Game Pawn is captured by opponent's side.
5. Solid color pawns may not jump over an own pawn's in captivity.
6. Captured Game pawn may jump over Solid colored Pawns. The jumped pegs is removed from play and returned to opponent's home board.-The term is known as Striking.
7. Captured Pawns may jump over Opponent's turned pawns, The jumped pegs is removed from play and returned to player's home board. -The term is known as Sacrificing.
8. Solid Game Pawn may jump an Opponent's Captured Pawn. The Player's Game Pawn is unturned and remains in Game Play.
Diagonal Jumping Rules:
1. Diagonal jumping is allowed, no forward or side jumping by single peg
2. A Gallop is to jump over several of your opponents pegs in a single move
3. After diagonal jump, the peg is then captured and turn bottoms up to reveal the players home color; it is not returned to opponents home board, unless jumped by turned pawns
4. Captured Pawns may jump over opponent's solid Game Pawns.This is known as Striking.
Wall Formation/Forward Jumping Rules;
1. Set of four; in diamond-shape or cube is called a wall; it also resemble Pegasus' four legs
2. Build as many of these units as possible to avoid being jumped
3. A wall allows a single peg to forward jump or be moved from pocket in any direction
4. A wall can only be rebuild from home piece; no back pegging allowed
5. A wall may not consist of turned pawns.
6. Any Pawn moving from Wall may move in any direction when galloping, as long as their is a space in between each jumping motion.
Captured Pawns Rules;
1. Solid Colored pawns must jump an Opponent's Colored pawns to capture the peg into their side of play.This is also known as a Turned Pawn (Offense) or Captured Pawn (Defense).
2. No turned or captured pawns are allowed in wall formation.
3. A Turned Pawns may jump over a Defending Colored Pawn.The jumped colored pawn is then removed from play and returned to the opponent's home board. This move is known as Striking.
4. A Captured Pawn in Offense may jump over a Turned Pawn on the opponents' side of play, The jumped pegs is removed from play and returned to player's home board. -The term is known as Sacrificing.
5. Solid Colored Pawn may jump a defending Captured Pawn. The Game Pawn is then unturned to its solid color and remains in Offensive Game Play.
6. Captured Pawns may Gallop in diagonal formation over multiple turned pawns and rules must be applied to each jump.
Captured Pawns Rules Simplified:
 Solid to Solid = Opponent's Captured Pawn - Player' s Captive Pawn
1. Player's Captive to Opponent's Solid = Send Pawn Home
2. Player's Solid to Player's Captive = Releases Pawn -Turn Color
3. Player's Captive to Opponent's Captured = Send Pawn Home
4. Player's Captive to Player's Solid = Same Team - Not Possible
5. Opponent Captured to Player's Solid = Sends Pawn Home
6. Opponent's Solid to Player's Captive = Releases Pawn -Turn Color
7. Opponent's Captured to Player's Captive = Send Pawn Home
8. Opponent's Captured to Opponent's Solid= Same Team - Not Possible
How To WIN:
1.Winner is declared by overall control of game board and the color of Pegasus
2.Game ends after both players have no remaining pegs, pass play or board moves
3.Tie Breaker or Play By Points; Turned Pawns +5, Player Pawns +1; Walls +10
Materials: All Pegasus and Dominus Games will be made of Phenolic Resin or Bakelite. The pegs are guaranteed to be made of Bakelite. The final look will be appealing to consumers and perhaps made of other composite materials that compliments to pegs. Bakelite is commonly used in the manufacturing of Dominoes and Billiard Balls. My product will not be made of thermoplastic polymers, which is light weight and easy to chip or crack, this material can be found on every commercial game boards.
DOMINUS : A PEGASUS EDITION
Features: This is Pegasus Games' version of Checkers. It is played under the same game rules, except it is played on a flat Game Board with false Gold and Silver metal tokens inlaid with Black and White bakelite discus instead of the standard colored pegs.
PEGASUS :MINI EDITION
Features: 6x5 Game Board, 30 pegs, Red/Black, 15 Pawn Game, Box Storage. Great For Office or Desktop..
Accessories...Collectable colored pegs in Quadri design and peg replacement packages of 10 will be available; New Pawns can be developed in various designs and materials such as metals, granites, glass or Team logos. They can be collected in groups of 50 and used on any Pegasus or Dominus game boards. Below are some probable designs that will be included as an accessory for this product.
Conceptual Development: Pegasus is a new strategic board game. This is a modern game that helps build situation awareness and decision making; No dice or assembly required. The idea for this game was developed from the Pencil and Paper game, Dots and Box and Peg Solitaire. The results was an abstract strategic game that was given similar rules to Chess.
FUTURE  PEGASUS GAME CONCEPTS;
PEGASUS :COLOR
Features: Same as Pro Edition in Red and Blue Pawns.
PEGASUS :PINK
Features: Same as Pro Edition in Pink and White Pawns,
PEGASUS :TRAVEL
Features; 100 magnetic micro pegs, Black/White, 50 Pawn Game, Case Storage and Sleeve; Unspecified dimensions; For Travel.
PEGASUS :QUADRI
Concept Only: I'm working on a Four Player Team Game; Colors; Green, Yellow, Red, Blue; Teams Rules Not Developed Yet.;
PEGASUS: OBELISK
Concept Only; It is played under Pegasus Rules; On a Hexagonal Tower with 108 Pegs; 54 Game Pawns per player game on six 6x3 peg plates with unique peg design;
History;
Pegasus; was a winged horse from Greek Mythology and son of Poseidon and Medusa... Its depitction has been featured in several different colors throughout the years.
Official Pegasus Logo -Copyright(c)2014
Webster Dictionary:
The Definition of Dominus: 1: an owner as distinguished from a user ; 2: a principal as distinguished from an agent
Official Pegasus Games Logo -Copyright(c)2014
Symbolism
Pegasus, it symbolizes the main objective of the game as one is to choose the game winner when one declares victory over Pegasus color or allots the most colored pegs onto the board game.
Dominus;The word is used as a title of sovereignty and later became a term known for high ranking official. It is the precursor to the title of lords, sire and sir.
Official Pegasus Dominus Logo -Copyright(c)2014
BACKER REWARDS
A select number of Pegasus Games is offered in return for your generous pledge. You will be the first to own this game before it reaches the stores. All rewards will delivered no later than December 2015. I do not want to exceed anyone expectations with rewards that I could not fulfill. I know if this project is successfully funded then a fully developed game unit will be the easiest and most earnest reward that I could offer. Thank you all for believing in my game concept and helping me bring Pegasus Games into production. You can expect to be updated along this journey, until it is finally launched to the world.
How To Game Test At Home Without Prototype:
 1. Study the Game Rules Carefully.
2. Right Click on Image, Save Image As...Onto your computer.
3. Open Image on any Photo-editing software, like Photoshop, Microsoft Paint or online at Picasa.com
4. Crop All Four Game Pieces, Black and White Boxes
5. Copy and Paste Game Pieces with Each Move
6. Fill in White Circles to Keep Track of Game Pieces that remain on Homeboard. Remember, Moves from Game Board do not count, since Game Piece is already out of Homeboard.
7. Keep track of the development of the Game, as the appearance of the Game Board will be constantly changing as the game progresses...
* Abstract Strategic Game Factorial; 100! = 9,332,621,544×10e157
This means there's 157 Zeroes after the larger number, which is also the exact calculation of permutation for the possible combinations of 100 pegs on a 100 pegboard. This is the amount of combinations possible on both Pegasus and Dominus game board. The game is never at constant since we are always manipulating the formation of the pawn as the game prolongs.
However, the odds of winning is undefined, because I'm not that advanced in Combinatorics. It would take a robot to test each permutation until revealing all the probable winning combination. The average Chess Game has a factorial of 64! or a total of 1.26886932 X 10e89 strategic combinations for capturing a game piece.

campaign.story:
WE DID IT!!! We are so grateful and humbled for every donation, every share, every ‘like’ that has brought us to crossing our goal of $180,000 in just 25 days! With 5 days left for our record-breaking campaign, we are excited to announce what is referred to on Kickstarter as a Stretch Goal. Our campaign goal of $180,000 will cover all of the costs of Filming the documentary - Crew, Equipment, Sound, and Transportation. Whatever we are lucky enough to raise beyond this until June 1st will go towards the Post-Production of the film including Editing the film, Original Music by incredible GRAMMY Nominated Artists (who are ready to go - amazing!), and Distribution efforts including Film Festival Submissions and getting this film In Theaters Worldwide so Team Lizzie can see what we did together!
PLAY

In 1989, a young girl named Elizabeth “Lizzie” Velasquez was born to two excited first time parents, Rita and Lupe. Doctors soon discovered that Lizzie was one of only three people in the entire world who possess an extremely rare, unnamed syndrome, which prevents her from gaining weight. Lizzie’s parents were told not to expect much physical or mental advancement from their daughter. Now, at 25 years old, 58 pounds, and with more accomplishments than most achieve in a lifetime, she is ready to share her full story.
At 17, Lizzie found a video on YouTube calling her “The Ugliest Woman in the World.” The video, made by an online bully, also attracted some of the cruelest comments anyone could ever imagine; the very first of which said she should “do everyone a favor and just kill herself.” Lizzie decided shortly thereafter that she was not going to let someone who had never met her, bully her – much less, define her.
Lizzie had dreams of graduating college, becoming a motivational speaker and publishing a book. With hard work and a wildly resilient spirit, Lizzie accomplished her goals and is a graduate of Texas State University, one of the most sought after speakers in the world (her TEDxAustinWomen talk has garnered over 9 million views to date) and is about to publish her third book in the Fall of 2014. Now, Lizzie has a bigger dream to accomplish: to make the online community a more positive place than when she found it. Or, rather, when it found her.
This summer, we set forth to make a documentary about Lizzie’s extraordinary life and her story of adversity and proud survival. We follow her on an incredible journey to address online bullying and inspire a trending movement to change it for the better.
If nearly 10 million people have become her champions from 13 minutes, imagine what 90 minutes can do.
Check out Lizzie's Interviews since we launched our campaign!
The View    
E! Online
Yahoo's Trending Now
MTV Act
We believe that we can’t ask of you what we wouldn’t ask of ourselves. We’ve already invested our own money and are looking for your help in securing the rest of the budget to get the film made and distributed to as wide of an audience as possible. For those new to Kickstarter, if we fall short of our goal by our 30-day deadline, we will lose all of the money raised and the opportunity to make this film.
Our goal is this: to raise $180k to fund the crew, lighting, sound, transportation and many other aspects that are necessary to complete physical production and shooting of the movie over the course of 10 weeks.
We don’t want to presume that we can raise ALL of the funds necessary for shooting the film all the way through to distribution, and we are very aware that few documentaries and films that have set a goal in our range end up raising the full amount. We are honored to be a part of the Kickstarter community and sincerely value each and every person that has viewed this page, and are grateful for however close we can get to our end goal of raising enough for our entire production and post-production.
Kickstarter is the best example of what can be accomplished when a community comes together. We thank you for your time, your donations and your shared belief with ours that -- as as a unified community -- there's nothing we can't do.

Risks and challenges
We recognize that we have a higher budget than most films on Kickstarter. Because of Lizzie’s syndrome, her body gets tired more easily and, since she's our real life heroine, we have to create an extended shooting schedule that is mindful of her physical needs. This means that we have to shoot over a longer period of time, so she can build in proper rest and recovery time in between.

Our team is made up of successful former film studio alums and we are hoping to get cooperation from our friends at the big video and social networks to participate. Our intention is to make things better, not point fingers. We are optimistic that Lizzie's experiences and championship of YouTube through her own video series, will help open the doors to hear her real-life story and be the catalyst for further change with online bullying.

updates.update_content: Women Rising is continuing to engage in projects that champion female heroes like Lizzie Velasquez in A Brave Heart, Alexis Jones in ProtectHer, Shelby Hadden in Tightly Wound, and Delaney Colaio in We Go Higher. The documentary, Nevertheless, is one of them. Directed by Emmy-award winning filmmaker, Sarah Moshman, Nevertheless will dig deeper into today's headlines about sexual harassment in the workplace. campaign.story:
Endless: Fantasy Tactics is a tactical miniatures game designed by On The Lamb Games. With a focus on boutique anime style miniatures and an art aesthetic harkening back to the golden age of JRPGs, you can build your own custom team of knights, wizards, and monsters. Equip them with items and pick their abilities. Fight it out in story scenarios, or recreations of your favorite games. A standard game takes about 20 to 30 minutes to play with 5-10 miniatures, uses a D6 pool-based system of gameplay, and is meant for 2+ Players.
Here is a full gameplay video:
This is a follow up campaign to our previous Kickstarter in November 2012, we hope to expand the number of available models and fund the art costs for EFT’s first campaign supplement entitled ‘The Miasma War’. This story based campaign provides new & old Endless gamers with new scenarios to play, new and variant stat cards, and more insight into the world of Terra. During the course of the campaign, players will gradually expand their party to build an army to take on the forces of The Miasma.
Long time fans of OTLG know that we often struggle with being able to provide enough art in our books, and with this Kickstarter we’ll be able to fill the book with great pieces of art from our talented artists.
About the Miasma War 
The Miasma War is an expansion for the core EFT Rulebook.
Adventure Mode - New rules for Single Player and/or Co-Op play, allowing you to do battle against the table itself with AI parties (1+ players).
A full story campaign with scenarios appropriate for playing with the AI Parties or in 'Classic' mode with an opposing player.
New units to add to your parties.
Taisen Mode - Rules for playing large battles.
'Player Avatar' - The ability to create your own character.
Download the Miasma War Sample Scenario here.
About the Artists
We'll mainly be using two artists for the Miasma War: Noah Page (Brushfire, EFT), and Heath Foley (Brushfire, EFT, Deadzone, Dreadball, Counterblast, Blackwater Gulch).
Heath is responsible for the majority of the art in the core books for Endless: Fantasy Tactics and Brushfire. Noah did the Miasma War banner shown in the KS Icon, and several of the classes in EFT.
About Fals & Rewards
To make reward selection as easy for you as possible, this Kickstarter will use a 'picking' system. Each pledge level provides a certain amount of "Fals" (the fictional currency of Endless). Each miniature or other item will cost a number of "Fals", starting at 1 for normal sized miniatures (25mm Base), with larger miniatures (50mm+ Base) costing 2 or more. This way you know from the outset how many miniatures or items are coming with your pledge level, rather than having to wait for your chosen bundle to get more added to it.
This is the "Fals" icon, in the chart below the available models are broken up into different sections based on how many Fals they'll cost you and if they are unique for gameplay purposes.
Click Here for a High Res version of the above chart.
Click Here to access the Pledge Calculator. Currently there are 50 Fals worth of items available, 47 of which are miniatures.
In Update #4 we created several party suggestions to help new players with what sort of models to pick. Feel free to send us a message, or post a comment if you have any questions about selecting rewards.
 Further Goals will add additional Miniatures for you to select from, along with funding more art for the campaign book.
The miniatures will be sculpted by Patrick Keith (Bombshell Babes, Counterblast, Reaper Miniatures), Sean Bullough (Warmachine/Hordes), and Bob Naismith (Warhammer 40k, Kings of War, Brushfire). Bob did the majority of the sculpting for our previous Kickstarter; and Patrick has done the Dragoon [F], Lyra Cosine, and Crusader [F] models for us.
Patrick Keith will be sculpting the Lunarian, the Barghest, Chain (Heroine of Time), the Rune Fencer, the Rhapsodist, the Berserker, and Rin Azel.
Sean Bullough will be sculpting the Mandragora, the Kappa, the Gargoyle Demonite, Zebolg, the Deep Troll, and the Fire Troll.
Example Miniatures
Dragoon [F] sculpted by Patrick Keith.
Beastmen Laborer & Engineer sculpted by Bob Naismith
The Crusader, sculpted by Patrick Keith
All models are supplied with a 25mm (or larger) Square Base and a stat card. Models are cast in resin, and require assembly and painting.
Work in Progress, Not Finished of the Lunarian by Patrick Keith..
About the Game
Endless is a Tactical Miniatures game that recreates the playstyle and feel of classic 90’s console RPGs on your table top. To get ready for a match of Endless, you will need to follow these steps:
1. Create a Party - Select which Models you want to bring in your adventuring party.
2. Select Commands - 1 and 2 Crystal Models may only take a limited number of the Commands listed on the back of their card.
3. Select Items - From your deck of item cards, select which items are carried by which Models.
 4. Play! - The following is just an excerpt of the basics, the full rulebook will give you more information.
A normal play area is between 10”x10” and 20” x 20” with a square grid. You can easily find RPG game mats at gaming stores or build your own boards with 1” squares. Tactical RPGs have multilevel battlefields, where the elevation of certain squares can change a battle. If you are designing your own map, make sure to include changes in elevation. Using a dry erase/wet erase marker on a square, you can mark the height of the square if you are unable to build a three dimensional battlefield.
Creating a Party
The basic Party size is determined by the scenario being played. If two players simply wish to have a skirmish, they can agree upon a Crystal Limit to play a game. In such situations the standard Limit is either 5 Crystals or 10 Crystals. The Crystal cost for a Model is often shortened to ‘C’ as in 1C for a Squire, or 3C for Lyra Cosine.
Crystal Icon
An Example party for a standard match could be:
Mandragora x3 (1C each), Cleric x1 (2C), Rune Fencer x1 (2C), and Chain x1 (3C)
VS
Dark Knight x2 (2C each), Zebolg x1 (3C), and Yulea Seablade x1 (3C)
Select Commands
1C and 2C Models have Command Lists on the back of their cards. These lists include check boxes that can be marked off, while the card is in a protective sleeve, using dry erase markers. Alternatively, you can use scratch paper. The commands you mark off are the only ones the Model can use in battle. 1C Models select 2 Commands, and 2C Models select 4 Commands. 3C+ Models have a fixed Command List, but placing them in card sleeves will still help with tracking HP and MP.
Party Restrictions
Models on Red or Purple backed cards are considered Unique. All Unique Models may only be taken once per Party. As they are Unique, with their own histories and personalities, their Command List is fixed, and they have all of their available commands.
For more information on how to play, download the free Quickstart Rules here.
Rewards
$10 Conscript - Get any and all digital rewards, including the Miasma War PDF & EFT Rulebook. Conscript is included with all other levels.
$15 Squire - Get 1 Fals worth of Item.
$40 Scholar - Get softcover books for both the EFT Rulebook & MW Expansion Book.
$50 Knight - Get 5 Fals worth of Items.
$85 Sergeant - Get 10 Fals worth of Items.
$175 Commander - Get 25 Fals worth of Items.
$325 General - Get 50 Fals worth of Items*.
$3,000 Rhapsodist - Get 25 Fals worth of Items, and more*.
$5,000 Hero - Get 50 Fals worth of Items, and more*.
Skykadia Pledge Calculator - There are currently 39 Fals worth of items available.
*See Below for more details.
This level is digital goods only.
Digital Rewards Currently Include:
Endless: Fantasy Tactics Rulebook.
The Miasma War Expansion Book.
Stat Cards for all units included in EFT & TMW.
AI Cards for all units included in EFT & TMW.
As with all On The Lamb digital products, you will need to have an account with WargameVault to receive the PDFs.
 While this level starts off with getting a lot of repeats (Nothing wrong with getting 50 Mandragora), this will get you enough Fals to cover all currently planned stretch goals should they unlock.
This level includes the Commander level, netting you a bunch of EFT models, but also includes getting your own custom Class, Monster, or Character (Including a Mini & Stat Card).
This level includes the General level, netting you a ton of EFT models, but also includes getting your own custom Hero (Including a Mini & Stat Card) made after you and having them depicted fighting Zebolg in a piece of art in the campaign book. You'll also get a print of this art piece.
After the campaign is over we will use a survey or pledge manager to determine what models you're getting.
Add Ons
Add-Ons may be added to your Pledge of Sergeant, Commander, General or Higher. You may add the cost of these addons to your pledge while the campaign is active by using the 'Manage My Pledge' button, or you may add to it after the campaign ends by using our Pledge Manager.
Extra Fals! - You may add any number of Fals for $6 per Fals to those listed levels.
For Example:
10 Fals = $60
15 Fals = $90
25 Fals = $150
Printed Books - While we're including PDF copies of everything, we know a lot of folks prefer to have their rulebooks in dead tree format. Printed books may also be added to the Knight level.
Endless: Fantasy Tactics Rulebook (138pgs, Color, Softcover) - $20
The Miasma War Expansion Book (~140pgs, Color, Softcover) - $15
Shipping Times
The delivery section of the Kickstarter is an estimate, and almost never accurate. We’ve put a date listed there that we think we’ll be done shipping by, but sometimes things happen and dates can slip. On our previous campaign we began shipping early, but over all took longer to get everything delivered then we had planned.
We have better control over our casting this time around, and should be able to begin shipping shortly after the greens arrive. We are also limiting the pledge options to several Waves of shipping to give a better idea of when to expect your items. As a pledge level begins to fill up we will add a new one with a slightly later 'shipping date'.
Social Media Links
OTLG Facebook
Official Forums (Hosted by DakkaDakka) | News & Rumors Thread
OTLG Twitter

campaign.story:
Please Note: The Anova Precision Cooker will have support for Android, iOS, AND Windows mobile devices.
To use the Anova Precision Cooker, you simply attach it to a pot, put your food in a ziplock bag and set the time and temperature. The Precision Cooker circulates water around the pot, ensuring a consistent temperature throughout. AND, the Precision Cooker Connects to your phone, allowing you to cook amazing meals by simply touching a button. The food is amazing, tender, and moist, every time.
Watch Chef Ming Tsai talk about the Anova Precision Cooker and precision cooking / sous vide:
    Background on Precision Temperature Cooking (Sous Vide)
Once limited to the world's best restaurants, precision temperature cooking (sous vide) is now the fastest growing kitchen appliance category. Last year was a huge year for precision temperature cooking, as it was the first year that precision temperature cooking devices became very affordable for home chefs. The Anova Precision Cooker represents the next evolution of precision temperature cooking technology, making it easy and affordable for anyone to reap the benefits of this type of cooking.
Did you know that precision cooking (sous vide) is used in the majority of high-end restaurants?
Most people don't know how pervasive precision cooking is, but it's now used by a majority of high-end restaurants. It's also used at chain establishments, such as Chipotle.
While high-end restaurants have been using precision cooking for years, the technique has only become popular with home chefs in the past four to five years with the advent of reality cooking shows. 
Despite the publicity from these cooking shows, until last year, most sous vide devices were still too expensive for home chefs, as models cost between $500 and $1,000. Anova was the first company to begin selling an affordable device for the home chef, with a price of only $199. Now, precision cookers / sous vide devices are the fastest growing kitchen appliance category.
What does sous vide mean?
For years people have called this type of cooking “sous vide,” which is French for "under vacuum." This refers to the process of vacuum sealing food and putting it in a water-bath. However, that's a bit of a misnomer. You don't need to vacuum seal your food to cook sous vide. 
Instead, this technique is really about bringing food to a very precise temperature and holding it there for a period of time. A better name for this technique, then, is "precision temperature cooking" or "precision cooking" for short. That's why we've named our system the Anova Precision Cooker.
How it Works
Precision cooking is extremely easy. It usually involves these three simple steps:
1. Attach the Precision Cooker to a pot and set time and temp. Use the simple interface to set the time and temperature. Or, you can use the app to find what you're cooking and just hit "start."
2. Put food in a ziplock bag and then you clip it to the side of the pot. Simply put your food in a sealable bag. The circulator moves water around the pot, ensuring a consistent temperature throughout
3. Finish by sear, grilling or broiling. Some people like to finish their cook by searing their food, throwing it on the grill, or by broiling it. This gives the food a nice look.
The Advantages of Precision Temperature Cooking
Precision cooking produces results that are impossible through any other technique. Precision cooking gives important advantages over traditional methods, including the following benefits:
Consistency. Because you cook your food to a precise temperature for a precise amount of time, you can expect very consistent results. 
Taste. Food cooks in its juices. This ensures that the food is moist, juicy and tender.
Waste reduction. Traditionally prepared food dries out and results in waste. For example, on average, traditionally cooked steak loses up to 40% of its volume due to drying out. Steak cooked via precision cooking, loses none of its volume.
Don't worry about overcooking. Traditional cooking can require your constant attention. Precision cooking brings food to an exact temperature and holds it. There is no worry about overcooking.
Precision cooked steak vs. traditional steak
Steak cooked via precision cooking is done perfectly edge to edge. In the image below, you can see that the steak on the right appears smaller. That steak was pan-cooked. In comparison, the steak on the left was cooked by the Anova Precision Cooker and it is consistent from edge-to-edge.
Precision cooked eggs vs. eggs cooked traditionally
Precision cooking eggs allows you to control how eggs turn out. Traditionally cooked eggs are a bit of a crap shoot. It's very difficult to time them perfectly to get the desired result.
Salmon cooked traditionally vs. precision cooked salmon
Much like steak, fish cooked by the Anova Precision Cooker is done perfectly, edge-to-edge. When pan cooked, the surface temperature of the pan is higher than the ideal cooking temperature, resulting in the edges being overcooked.
Everything Tastes Better When Cooked Perfectly
It's not just steak, fish, and eggs that come out better when cooked with the Anova Precision Cooker. Chicken comes out moist and tender. Vegetables are bright and flavorful. Pork is tender and juicy. The Anova Precision Cooker can be used on a wide variety of foods and the results are delicious and healthy.
Our Story
Jeff Wu has been using immersion circulation technology since the age of 13. While still in college, Jeff became an engineer for a scientific equipment manufacturer and started working with classmate, Natalie Vaughn on designing and selling scientific equipment.  
Jeff has always been obsessed with two things: (1) designing and building laboratory equipment and (2) cooking. He had no idea that two could go together until on a visit to Harvard in 2007, he saw two grad students using laboratory-grade circulators to cook. Not long after that visit, Jeff tried to build his own device to cook sous vide-style meals. He also began using lab equipment to cook sous vide. 
Jeff became determined to build a sous vide device for the home chef. In 2010, he did just that and created an early proof-of-concept of an affordable home sous vide.
The Proof-of-Concept
Anova I
In 2013, Jeff teamed up with Natalie to launch Anova Culinary, LLC. The first product, was the Anova 1. At $199, the Anova 1 became the first affordable immersion circulator for the home chef.
The reception for the first commercial unit was overwhelming. . . .
"So is it amazing? Yes. I’m kind of hooked." - TechCrunch
"If you're looking to get into sous vide, the way to go is the Anova sous vide circulator." The Sweethome
"[Anova] is the one to beat" - WIRED
"The Anova Sous Vide Immersion Circulator is an easy to use device that both beginners and pros will enjoy." - CNET
We Can Do Better
Despite the popularity of the Anova 1, we wanted to do better. We felt we could improve upon the following three major areas:
(1) The price. We think this type of technology should be affordable to everyone. We want to work to produce a unit that is extremely affordable.
(2) The unit must be more flexible. One of the limitations to current systems is that they require tall pots, which limits the type of equipment you can use with the device and makes its use somewhat cumbersome.
(3) The Precision Cooker should be a connected device. The interface should move to the iPhone, making the device even easier to use. People shouldn't have to search for hours for time and temperature settings. They should be able to hit a button and start cooking. 
The Redesign
In addition to our three chief goals (low-price, flexibility, and connectivity), we also wanted to incorporate many suggestions from our users. The result is a redesigned system, specifically tailored to meet the unique needs of the home chef. It’s simple, yet powerful, flexible and accurate. It’s incredibly light, weighing only 2.5 lbs. Its small, and easy to store. It truly represents a breakthrough in precision temperature cooking devices.
The Clip
We’ve redesigned the clip, so that it’s detachable from the system. It’s secure, but flexible. You can use the device with virtually any pot or container.
Vectoring / 360 Degree Pump
The clip allows the unit to turn, which means you can point the pump flow to any direction This gets water to flow around the pot, ensuring a consistent temperature throughout
Interface
The interface is completely new and incredibly easy to use. You slide the wheel up and down to change the temperature. Then you press start.
Bluetooth Connected
The unit is Bluetooth enabled, which for the first time ever allows you to cook perfect meals with your smartphone.
Removable Skirt

We’re going to release an SDK, so that people can develop their own apps to work with Anova. We anticipate people will make nutritional apps, apps that make it easy to share what you’re cooking with others, recipe apps, and time and temperature apps.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Anova has a team with extensive manufacturing experience. Specifically, our project benefits from the following key facts:
- We have a history of designing and manufacturing quality products in-house
- The Anova Precision Cooker is the result of detailed and careful planning
- We have previously designed and manufactured a precision cooker

Despite our expertise and careful planning, there are risks to the project. We've identified and outlined the following key risks to our project below:

1. RISK DUE TO PROBLEMS WITH THE INJECTION MOLD:

Injection molding is a process that can often set hardware products back. We're fortunate to have experience in injection molding, but in the event that there is a problem with the injection mold, our project could be set back several weeks.

2. RISK DUE TO EXCESS DEMAND:

We're fortunate to do our own manufacturing. Should we receive support in excess of our anticipated demand, there could be delays in backers receiving their products.

If demand is extraordinary, we could be forced to open a new manufacturing facility, which would further delay our project. 

3. RISK DUE TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOFTWARE AND THE CONNECTED DEVICE: 

Our team has experience building and developing connected devices. Specifically, we've built devices that connect to software via Bluetooth. However, development of our connected device is currently in progress and is largely conceptual. Despite the proficiency of the team, it is possible that the development schedule could slip and we will not be ready to release source code to developers in time for them to build apps for backers.

Further, our schedule could slip to the point that there is no app for the initial batch of units to use, as we believe it is important to ship units as they become available, which could pre-date final delivery of apps.

4. RISK DUE TO SUPPLIERS:

We have long-standing relationships with our suppliers. In addition, we have a very robust supply chain for components. However, it is not impossible that our project gets delayed due to problems with a supplier. However, it is not impossible that our project gets delayed due to problems with a supplier.

campaign.story:
Have a question? Be sure to "Contact Me" to get an answer >>>>>
For two years I have been looking for a great dice game.
DRAGON SLAYER is that game.
Dragon Slayer has everything I wanted in Indie Boards & Cards' first dice game:
It's fast playing, games take 15 minutes, so you can play while waiting for friends to arrive, in line, or over and over again all night long.
It has dragons that you are trying to kill.
It has dragon dice, dragons that are trying to kill you.
It's a "press your luck" classic, roll till you stop, go too far and you'll die.
Did I mention that your friends are trying to get you killed?
That’s right, it is a dice game with a twist – real player interaction! Think your friend pressed his luck too far – challenge him to keep going. If he does, he can score big – but if he fails or worst yet doesn’t take the challenge, he’ll lose points and you get some.
Dragon Slayer plays 2 - 5 players, but we are including everything you need to play with 6 in the box.
Fast, Fun and Full of spite – what more could you ask for?
 Dragon Slayer is a great game, but you can’t know that yet. So if you are getting a reward from our recent Coup Reformation project, then we can add Dragon Slayer to your Reformation rewards and pass along the combined shipping savings to you. A great game at a fantastic price is good deal for everyone. Didn’t back Reformation? Dragon Slayer is still a great game, and you can add extra copies at the same price. And you’ll help us reach our stretch goals.
It’s a dice game with 12 custom dice, nice art, detailed rules and six challenge tokens for 7 bucks – so you know that we can’t get crazy. But I would like to give backers a few extras in addition to a fantastic price. And since this is mass produced, we need to make a minimum number to be able to offer special items.
So stretch rewards are based on number of backers (not counting those that aren’t getting rewards, just counting those that are in at the $7 level and above)
1000 Backers – Metallic Ink Dice: It looks cool, it is cool. Everyone will know that you got the special edition as soon as you take them out.
Achieved!
3000 Backers – Foil Box: We all like shiny, and a nice shiny game box is a great way to get your friends to play. We can’t understand why, but we all know that it happens. So help us get more backers and we’ll get a box that screams “Play Me!” 
Achieved!
4,000 Games - Battlemat: The Battlemat is a convenient way to track your turn during the game. It's been designed to help you quickly learn and teach the game by emphasizing the core game rules and steps in your turn.
Achieved!
5,000 Games - Score tracker:  a compact scoreboard with small cubes to track each player's progress and tokens to remind everyone what color they are!
Achieved!
6,000 Games - Score tracker for 6 players & and a 2nd copy of the Battlemat: Even though we are listing the game as supporting 2-5 players, there is no theoretical maximum number of players. We are including challenge tokens to support up to 6 (or have an extra if you lose one), so it makes sense that we could also include scoring markers for that 6th player as well. If we get 6000 committed games in this project, we will include the 6th player in green.
ACHIEVED!
ALL STRETCH REWARDS UNLOCKED!
Note - These stretch goal upgrades won't be included in the retail version of the game that is sold via distribution.
Nick Hayes (a full time game designer, as well as a illustrator & graphic designer) did a great job on the box and game component art as you can see here:
As you might have expected in a PYL (push your luck) game, there are dice! 12 dice, 10 different with only the 3 warrior dice repeated. Each of the dragon dice have different head, wing and tail designs that really add to the "wow" factor. And yes these are molded dice - not silkscreened, so they will be durable. Also in the box are the challenge tokens - enough to support games with up to 6 players, though we are listing on the box that this will play 2-5.
Game designer David Mortimer really made this game shine - creating a new PYL game is a deceptively difficult challenge, and he did this one right.  The rules can be found here. Like all great PYL games, the rules are simple, format of repeating the Dragon Hunt until you decide to stop. The very interesting twist is the player challenges. The ability to challenge, and rewards for passing or failing when challenged, add a dimension to everything that you do on your turn. What order do you go after dragons? When do you stop? When do you challenge? Who do you challenge? How do you get others not to challenge you?
Don't get me wrong, it is still a classic PYL game with rules that are easy to learn and teach - it is just that the challenges really do add something very interesting to the genre and nicely complement the rest of the great design ideas that David has incorporated in Dragon Slayer.
I really wanted to be able to get a lot of little extras made for the biggest fans of the Indie Boards and Cards, and be able to offer this fantastic deal to those that helped us blow the roof off the Reformation project. Kickstarter really is a great platform to do that through.
Thank you for supporting us!
What are Kickstarter Funds used for?
Your pledge dollars go directly into making the pledge rewards, and shipping them to you. We have invested in getting the project to this point where it is ready; your support ensures that we have the cash to pay our printers to make the games - the most costly part of game production.
About Indie Boards and Cards
Indie Boards and Cards started in 2009 as an independent publisher of great game designs. In 2010 we released three games, all of which have been well received by critics and fans alike. Our biggest seller has been The Resistance - a game of secret identities, deception and deduction that is now or will soon be available in 20 languages around the world. In 2011 we released Flash point: Fire Rescue, which has also been very well received and now available (or soon to be) in 10 different languages. In 2012 we released the humorous game of certain death - Gauntlet of Fools and in 2013 we added Coup and Snowdonia to our portfolio. Be sure to look for all these great games wherever you shop. If your favorite game store doesn’t carry our games, please ask them to!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Indie Boards and Cards currently has another project that is due for deliver (Coup Reformation expansion), that game will be produced at the same time as this game. As the artwork is already done for both games this should not present a great risk.

Indie Boards and Cards has successfully delivered a number of previous kickstarter projects to thousands of supporters. We expect that our previous experiences will enable us to also deliver this project on time. That said there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. Indie Boards and Cards will use contract manufacturing to make this game, freight forwarders to get games through customs and 3rd parties like Amazon, the US Post Office and FEDEX to ship the games to you - we don't control everything and there are lots of opportunity for delay. Other conditions may also cause delays - earthquakes, alien invasions, asteroid attacks, zombie plague are but a few of the myriad of reasons we may not be able to deliver this project in a timely manner.

This is a first edition of the game - by pledging to this project you are agreeing to be an early adopter and the extra items that are included in this edition (that aren't in the retail version) are your rewards and incentives for being an early adopter. But even with multiple edits, and constant proofing there may be minor typos, or grammar usage that is annoying to you in your rewards or other little things that would have been nice to have avoided but don't affect how the game is played. Mistakes that materially affects game play will of course be addressed but sometimes there are are minor errors that might be distracting but do not affect game play that I can't justify correcting. So if minor errors get under your skin and make it itch then you probably don't want to be an early adopter and are better off waiting till you've had a chance to see the final product and then buy it in your local hobby store. Kickstarter is not for everyone and I leave it to you to decide if you should be getting in on a first edition of this expansion.

My pledge is that I will deliver what I said and have written this project page as concisely and clearly as I can. So please read everything on this page - every kickstarter project is unique, and the commitments I am making to you regarding this project are completely defined here.

A particular challenge to a project like this is negativity - I love your input, and really enjoy all the great suggestions that come from the large majority of our supporters. I can't include all the suggestions that I get, nor can I give you specific feedback other than noting that I do read all the comments and messages sent to me. So think before you post - threats, ultimatums and entitlement are unlikely to get you what you are asking for, and very likely that everyone else (myself included) will get less.

Refunds - things happen and sometimes you need to get your money back. If you ask (before it's been submitted for shipment to you) , I'll refund your pledge less 20% to cover the costs that I can't recoup and costs of processing that refund. So think before you pledge - you can of course always remove your pledge before the funding deadline - but don't expect to get a 100% refund just because you forgot to remove your pledge before the project end ;)

Changes - Images shown here are of the final art - however while it is not expected changes may be made before final production both to the art work and game contents. Variations in the production process and monitor calibration may cause alternations from the screen images to what appears in physical form.

Have an issue? Send me a note - and please don't support us if you aren't satisfied with what the project is returning to you. Nothing would make me happier than having 100% of my supporters be 100% satisfied with their pledge rewards!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

The object of the game is to play your Minions in order to amass a powerful force and defeat your opponent.  But don't worry, when minions themselves are not enough, you can call on a wide assortment of amusing items and terrifying spells to lay low your enemies!
120 UNIQUE cards in the base set. No wasteful mana/currency cards!
2-4 players with an average play time of 30 minutes
No booster packs required!

  Product varies depending on pledge amount. The Collector's Edition design and contents shown is a prototype and may differ from final product.
With an amazing art style brought to you by the award-winning artists behind World of Warcraft TCG, Airmech, Legends of Cryptid, Galaxy Saga and more, Minion is beautifully illustrated with a grandiose and humorous feel.
Every single one of the 120 cards in the base set are uniquely illustrated - no duplicates anywhere! And speaking of 120 cards, that's all you'll need to play!
*UPDATE* April 16, 2014 - New Card Design & Layout
Let's check out the anatomy of a card!
 Check out some of the cards!
All them Minions
Items, Spells, Enhancers & Traps
Here they are in person! (PAX Prototype deck)
PAX EAST 2014 Prototype Cards
So how do you play? We're glad you asked!
Each turn you have $3 to spend and a fistful of cards. Play your Minions and Items, then tilt them to take advantage of their attacks and abilities.
Every card has a play cost. This usually ranges from free to $3.  Each player has $3 to spend per turn, although sometimes this can increase or decrease based on other cards in play.  Each turn you may play as many cards as you can afford.  Make sure you spend your money, you cannot save it up between turns!
Check back soon for some gameplay videos from PAX East!
Shared Deck
All players share and draw from the same deck - this makes it easy to travel with the game, and allows a ton of freedom in game mechanics. Take cards right from your opponent's hand and play them, or maybe your opponent will snag up the card you just discarded. The possibilities are limitless!
Two Draw Piles
Not one, but two draw piles - one face up, one face down.  Whenever you draw cards, you get to draw from either pile - but beware, the face up pile has traps and you won't want to hit those!
Card Flipping
Ever feel like your cards are too hard to protect?  A Pretty Overpowered Laser from your opponent is all it takes to nuke down your Brobarian. Fear not - use the Flip mechanic to flip your cards face down and protect them for a turn.  But wait, what if your opponent is the one with the Brobarian? Go ahead and use flip on his card to flip it face down and make it unusable next turn! This dual purpose mechanic has a ton of flexibility both offensively and defensively.
Example of the play zones
We're different.  We don't want to sell you booster after booster - we don't want to reel in all your cash.  Our business model is simple: one box, that's all you need.  No more random booster packs with none of the cards you wanted.
But wait, 120 cards isn't enough for you?  We have stretch goals to create expansions and additional core sets of Minion - but always keeping with our core values: charging a fair price with no gambling on which cards you get.
We're going to PAX!  On April 11th-13th we'll be exhibiting at PAX East in Boston to launch the Minion Kickstarter! Come check out our awesome booth at the entrance to the tabletop section - right as you exit the video game show floor, look for us across from the WOTC floor!
Stop by and play a game to get a copy of our PAX Promo card!
PAX EAST 2014 Promo Card
Don't forget Addons!
Minion Overlords, we’re pleased to announce exciting new Stretch Goals! Our hope for Minion is to create a huge and hilarious game with tons of diversity in cards and gameplay – so our primary stretch goals will be just that – expansions! 
 We want backers to have the ultimate involvement: being able to select the expansion and mechanics we focus on first! 
 But we don’t just want expansions, we also want to make the Core Set just that much more epic – so we’re adding in some awesome free stuff!
Below is additional information on the reward tiers and the specifics of some of those awesome rewards!
SuperSecretDatabaseAccess - Our website will have a database of all cards by default. This access allows you to get even more info about each card - history of the card, the mechanics, the art, and why we made different decisions. It's an expose on each card!
Set Preview - Access to view the sets and cards before they're even out! See spoilers of sets in progress and watch how they change as we move through development. A top secret look at how the game gets designed.
Designer Voting - When we're having trouble deciding which cards and mechanics should be in the next set and we really can't decide, or maybe we need help picking the funniest cards - we'll turn to you! In the SetPreview section of the site you'll be able to periodically vote in polls, as well as always leave comments and suggestions on cards that you see.

campaign.story:
Find us at KitchenGoose.com after this Kickstarter Project ends!!!
If you've enjoyed some of the many culinary innovations lately, you may be aware of a rare treat known as ‘the golden egg’. Most people have never tasted the exquisite flavor of an In-shell Scrambled Egg. 
'Golden Eggs' can be enjoyed hard or soft boiled, deviled or in egg salad, fried, pickled, atop noodles, or as a surprise on Easter Sunday. There are many preparations yet to be discovered, perhaps you will be the first to invent a new recipe?
Golden eggs are known to be a delicacy, but you'll have trouble finding a restaurant serving them and there are no utensils designed to create Golden Eggs... until now!  
Introducing the Golden Goose
The Golden 'Goose' is a low-tech, hand-powered kitchen gadget. It has been meticulously designed and tested to smoothly scramble the contents of a shell egg. The device uses ‘centrifugal force’ to scramble an egg without breaking the shell.
It works by alternating the rotation of an egg back and forth. This mixes the white and yolk inside the egg-shell without introducing outside air. It is easily used at any angle. The flavor profile is fresh and delicious, and there is no 'whipping' or bowl needed if you enjoy scrambled eggs on the stove.
The Goose was developed with the home cook in mind, but can just as easily be used by anyone. In fact, some users have suggested it's a good way to store scrambled eggs in a restaurant kitchen.
Creating with the Goose
We've made some delicious treats and shared them to the amazement of our friends.
I had never eaten soft boiled eggs until now.
If you're feeling creative, you can substitute golden eggs anywhere regular hard boiled eggs used to be.
I think we might actually be the first folks to eat a fried golden egg!
Golden eggs go nicely with salads too...
But let's switch gears and talk about how we arrived at the final Goose design.
Details of the Goose:
The Goose features lightweight & recyclable materials, comfortable handles, and the highest quality 1/8”” abrasion resistant cordage system. The Goose main shell is hinged during manufacturing, as part of the Polypropylene shell, to provide ease of use and keep the halves together. The ring turns 12 degrees to securely lock the shell together with an audible 'click'. The Goose features an elastic food-safe & dishwasher-safe 'egg cradle' designed to fit the variable sizes and shapes of eggs. It features specially designed fins to balance the egg and adjust the center of gravity providing smooth and efficient motion.
We never intended to develop a Goose. In fact, when we first heard that it was possible to scramble an egg in its shell, we were so curious that we stayed up until 4-am breaking every egg in sight. 
The following day I was reminded of an old Victorian Era toy that rotates back and forth, so I stole the shoelaces from my tennis shoes and combined them with a plastic jar to create the first rough prototype.
We knew there had to be a better way for us to make Golden Eggs without struggling, and that’s when Y Line Product Design hatched a plan to create The Golden Goose!
The design process took months of careful exploration and testing. We did loads of sketches and built functional and aesthetic models by hand and on the computer.
Some of the prototypes worked better than others, so we incorporated the use of computer aided modeling and 3D printing to refine our performance criteria and eliminate unnecessary features. We eventually dialed-in the performance, feel, and look of the Goose.
The Goose is designed to be effective, and easy to use:
 It only takes a minute to learn, and even kids like doing it.
Nest an egg in the cradle
Close and turn the ring until you hear a click
Swing, then pull the handles to spin it until you hear the egg scramble
Purpose:
The Goose is for Fun. It’s not going to change the world. The Goose is a kitchen utensil that empowers the user to create new recipes, and hopefully creates unique and enjoyable experiences. 
It would be cheaper to manufacture with other materials, but we chose Polypropylene, Nylon, and TPE because they meet our criteria, and are recyclable.
The Goose is easily assembled & disassembled. This means that we save cost and energy in the making of a Goose. We did extra work to ensure it can be easily taken apart so folks could wash or replace parts easily. We hope that users will be empowered to recycle the Goose many years from now when it reaches the end of its life cycle.

As one of the first 200 supporters, you’ll have dibs on the pilot production run and get your hands on a Goose ASAP! Plus, you'll have access to the digital Instruction Manual and Recipe Guide. You will also receive the Postcard with download instructions. Plus Free Shipping in the US.

For those who want to stand out, but avoid the hassle of selecting an alternate cordage assembly color, we're got you covered. This reward features a pair of yellow nylon cords, plus we'll toss in the original white ones just in case you change your mind. You’ll receive your 'yellow' Goose and the printed Illustrated Instruction Manual, the Recipe Guide, and the Postcard. Plus Free Shipping in the US.

You'll be one of the first folks to the Golden Egg revolution (pun intended). For the serious hobbyist or decorator, we'll send you all the parts you need to fully customize your Goose, You'll be able to mix and match colors. Plus, we'll provide you with the 3D printer files for the Stretch Goals regardless of meeting the stretch funding. These files can be used to experiment from home, plus you'll have great options for material selection by sending them out to a high quality print-shop which can be found online!
The Farmer: Pledge $2,300 or more 
We’ll send you a Goose to play with, plus a voucher good for 35 (but who's counting?...) hours of design & innovation services from Y Line Product Design LLC.

Whether you have an idea you want developed, or your looking for a brainstorming partner, this is a fitting reward for such a generous donation!
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Stretch Goals !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Goose Roost: $90K

We'll send you a silicone manufactured egg-cup, designed by us, with a built-in suction cup so it won't topple from your plate!
Golden Bevy: $240K
This product line extension is for a niche' connoisseur. It has been suggested we consider Duck and Goose eggs respectively. Most folks are going to stick to the good ol' chicken egg, so this item is definitely a stretch, but who knows! Little golden treats...Yum!
Cup Cup Goose: $260K
If we've actually come this far, then we should probably supply you with a Quail-egg cup so you can enjoy the Goose's little buddy!
BirdShot: $290K
Let's face it, this is a whole Kickstarter project of its own. We're shooting for the Moon with the BirdShot! This little gadget is the perfect accessory to the Goose. 
The Birdshot is a 'Rapid Infuser'...using the same forces required to scramble an egg, the Birdshot infuses 1.5 ounces of liquid with the essence of the user's chosen ingredient. 
Use it for flavoring vinegar and anything else you can imagine! 
Special thanks to everyone for honoring us with so much attention!
Who is responsible for this Goose?!
Goose is created by designer Geraint Krumpe. He is an innovator with more than 15 years of experience in the Design field. In his professional career he contributed to more than 60 Design and Utility Patents. His work is awarded, and featured in the press, blogs, magazines, for sale, and in homes.
-"It has been hard work and long hours, but anybody who is curious at heart is going to have fun!"
I've recently ‘hung a shingle’ in Chicago with the introduction of a small design studio, Y Line Product Design. In my 'free time' I'm a 3D printing enthusiast, so I want to share the Goose with other enthusiasts. That's why we are offering, as a reward, the option to download and print your own Goose!
More on the egg itself:
What does it taste like?
The short answer is ‘scrambled’, but that’s not entirely accurate. The flavor is rich and subtle. If you are a fan of eggs, and a fan of scrambled eggs, then there is no better way to enjoy them. The science behind it is based on how proteins and fats react to each other inside of the egg without the intrusion of outside air.

The texture is silky, and depending on how long you boil, or at what temperature, you can create a range of flavors and characteristics. In addition, it is a great way to scramble eggs without dirtying a whisk and bowl, and golden eggs poured directly into the frying pan taste better than any scrambled eggs you've ever had...
How else can I prepare a Golden Egg?
Known methods include hard-boiled, soft boiled, deviled, scrambled, egg salads, Scotched, served with Ramen Noodles... and so on...but there are dishes yet to be discovered by the intrepid explorer!
OK, so how do we produce it?
The Golden Goose is not a product, so we have to make it a reality by investing in manufacturing tools & materials. We need to fund both the manufacturing and assembly of each Goose. The design is finalized, and we have quotes from manufacturers domestically and in Asia. The plan is to mold the Goose parts in Asia and assemble them in the US.
Here is a breakdown of our target time-line:
June: Pilot production samples and proofs
Mid-June: Shipping schedule and assembly procedure
July: Travel to factory for pre-production confirmation
Mid-July: Final samples approved
August: Pilot Production run
Mid-August: Shipping to US
September: Product received & Assembled - Bumps receive rewards!
Mid-September: First production run rewards shipped
Early October or Late September: Second production run rewards shipped
These are general targets for production and shipping, but we will get the rewards to you sooner if possible. All non-manufactured rewards will ship ASAP. 
Either way you slice it, your donation will help us achieve a concrete goal, and you will be rewarded with gold!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Kickstarter is the world’s most successful funding platform, but that doesn't mean there aren't inherent risks involved in a project. 

Nothing is for certain, but I can guarantee that there are experienced and smart people working to make the Goose project a success. 

Injection molding is far from an exotic manufacturing technique, and our design has been carefully crafted to be produced efficiently and assembled quickly and easily.

As we encounter challenges or setbacks we will address them methodically and creatively. When we reach our funding goal, we are going to do everything humanly possible to ensure the Goose takes flight!

8 Iterative rounds of prototyping and design refinement have culminated into the production ready model. We have secured competitive bids from two of the largest and most reliable manufacturers in Asia, and we have been promised lead times of 40 days or less.

The parts produced will be made from high quality materials.

We will confirm our pilot models prior to committing to production, and I will personally inspect the production samples for quality before committing to manufacturing the rewards.

We'll package your Goose with care, and maximize the density of Geese for shipping to further reduce fuel use and our environmental footprint.

Y Line Product Design has invested a great deal of time and energy into the development of the Goose. We've nurtured it as long as we can, and now it is ready to leave the nest. We’re hoping you will weigh the risks involved in supporting our project and decide to help us give the Goose wings!

campaign.story:
The first of it's kind, Project 13 adopts principles of both ARTS and MOBA Games like League of Legends, SMITE and DotA, then combines them into an amazingly great paced and strategic Tabletop Game featuring an original cast of Super Heroes and Villains vying for control over the very fate of reality. Pick your Super and join the fight with your friends... or people you just want to stomp in game!
*Note: If you are looking at the Delivery Date for the $60.00 reward and wondering why it says August 2015, well it is meant to say 2014, as in this August, we simply couldn't edit it since in the first hour someone had requested it, so no, all rewards we currently are at will be shipped by August 2014.
Exclusive Character
KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVES HERE
Now, through development we have been asked a series of questions regarding how we transitioned the MOBA-Style to Tabletop, and to that I say check out these videos below;
Where can I find back story on the characters?
Here in our first Update!
How can the pace of the game feel like the pace of a MOBA when it's in Tabletop form? How do Team Fights work and feel? How do you capture the feeling of "Gank-ing" when there is no "Fog of War"? For these questions, look below at the examples.
For a look at the rules, here is the Rule Book we used during most of our play testing time (Note; some things obviously aren't in there, like art... and specific set-up rules, but trust us, they will be in the finished product) Play Test Rule Book
Project 13 is a MOBA and ARTS inspired Tabletop Arena Game that allows players to select one of the competitive Game Modes and then battle back and forth between their “Supers” and their Towers, hoping to take control of the board and reality.
Each Hero and Villain in Project 13 is designed and created by Chris, then brought to life through past inspirations and the amazing styling of local Artist and Rare Find Games teammate, Tessa Schram or Erin Simenson. 
Arena Mode: 2 - 10 Players  approx. Time - 30 minutes per Match
Find all the details about Arena Mode HERE.
Conquest Mode: 2 – 6 Players approx. Time – 30 Minutes to 2 Hours (3v3 or possibly 5v5)
In this game mode, teams of 3(Possibly 5) will attempt to take down the other side's Obelisk! Each side can be made up of both Heroes and Villains.
The full Game Board Setup
The Game Board shown above will be in 8x10 Game Board Tiles, allowing for the 2 sides of the map to be interchanged. This also allows us to expand on the game board as time goes on or via Stretch Rewards, scaling the game for more players and different Terrain.
Throughout the game, Players will upgrade Powers and purchase Enhancements to further their attempts at defeating the opposing team. Minions will continue to spawn and advance, hoping to give momentum to each team, much like a MOBA or ARTS game would function.
- 8 (10x8) Map Tiles (2- Sided)
- 20 Unique Supers (3 Cards  and a Dry Erase Character Sheet Each), 18 Enhancements (6 Each)
- 20 Hero Tokens
- 12 Tower Tokens  
- 2 HQ Tokens
- Minion and Jungle
- Health, Endurance, Status and Destruction Tokens
- 12 Combat Die (6 Green Physical Die, 6 Red Power Die)
- 1 Full Color Instruction Manual
- 1 Full Color Scenario Book
- 1 Conquest Setup Sheet
Printing. That’s it. Honestly the game has been play tested beyond measure, the art is almost done (We have some minor rulebook art and such to finish). We simply want to print the highest quality game possible, which means we need a big professional printer, the kind that prints games like Magic; The Gathering, and to do that, we need far more capital than we have. 
So each dollar we get will go towards that, and then after the goal, improving the game and adding to the Season 1 Set “Crisis”, so be sure to check our Stretch Rewards and Goals Below!
 Stretch Rewards!
When we set out to do the game we had worked to balance the game with more than the original 20 Heroes and Villains in the game, so above all we want to get to the point where we can add them in, look below;
$4,000: We are FUNDED!!! and we appreciate all the love and support you guys gave!
$6,000: Super Revealed! Another Hero or Villain joins the mix!
$8,000: Super Revealed! Another Hero or Villain joins the mix!
$10,000: Super Revealed! Another Hero or Villain joins the mix!
$12,000: Super Revealed! Another Hero or Villain joins the mix!
$14,000: Project 13 Dossier for everyone that donated at least enough to receive the Game! We have so many things planned to go into this amazing book!
$16,000: We have an amazing Map already laid out, double sided and wonderfully diverse, but adding more tiles in would be great for replay-ability and 5 vs 5 games that we know you all want!
$18,000: With the game already coming with an amazing amount of Lore and story involving the Supers and how the universe of Project 13 came to be. But as you can see, the Stretch Rewards at this point would have added a ton of Supers, so why not build the Story for them too!
Beyond $18,000: Jason and Chis have A MILLION more things planned to add as time goes on, so if we get this far, we will be posting even more Stretch Rewards!
We are willing to ship a copy of Project 13 anywhere really, provided you are able to cover the cost of shipping outside the US. As for delivering you a box, well, while we would love to stop by your house in the UK, sadly we can only make stops in the Continental US and some parts of Canada (Sorry Hawaiians).
So lets break down Shipping for you guys,
United States: Free Shipping
Canada: $5.00 That's it. Add that for shipping to Canada. We have shipped things in and out of Canada with day jobs and have that part down pretty well.
International Backers (UK and Europe): For you, it's approx. $30.00 dollars to send it out to you guys for us, depending on the place, so just add that to the donation and we will be set. For some reason parcel services hate Americans sending anything out of country. if you guys have suggestions, we would absolutely find time during this time to explore them, but until then, it's $30.00.
As for our Launch Event? If you guys can get here, we would love to have you with us and hanging out, so if you can work it out, we will make space for you, but otherwise, that is more for Local Supporters.

campaign.story:
550 FireCord is the next evolution in outdoor gear preparedness. 550 parachute cord or "paracord" has been the standard go-to for most cordage needs as it has tons of utility. From zipper pulls and handles to keychains, bracelets and lanyards and as simply as lashing.
Now, imagine if you could also use your paracord as fire tinder...enter 550 FireCord, the fire preparedness solution that will ensure you are Always Prepared!
Fire is paramount to survival and being able to create fire is crucial. People have a tendency to overestimate their ability to create fire under adverse weather conditions such as rain, snow, cold, windy locations or darkness. Humidity, time of year, and altitude are also conditions to consider as well. Likewise, material selection is a key prerequisite to successfully building a sustainable fire. Even then there is no guarantee it can be accomplished in a survival situation.
The most vital component of fire is its  ability to provide heat to dry wet clothes and to regulate the body’s core temperature as maintaining body temperature is vital for survival. The most common cause of death in the wild is hypothermia. Even in desert scenarios, freezing night temperatures have been known to claim lives.
Aside from the above mentioned physical aspect, fire can offer mental comfort as the light and smoke can be used for signaling rescue and it can be used as a predator and insect deterrent.
Fire will also contribute greatly to food and water preparation. The heat will kill the majority of parasites and bacteria when cooking game, fish, insects and wild edibles. The smoke will dry and preserve food for later. Having a hot meal can also boost the mental state giving you a psychological edge

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are Airlock Games, an established company with a brand new name. As Bombshell Miniatures we successfully completed three Kickstarter campaigns and with each one we've improved our production capabilities, fulfillment process and on-time rate. Our most recent project helped us streamline backer reward selection and made international shipping more economical for our friends abroad.

Even with all our previous experience we are still a small company dependent on a few people to do a lot of work. We know backers expect to be treated fairly and receive their rewards in a timely manner, so on-time fulfillment and backer satisfaction has been and always will be our top priority. That's why we decided early on to have the core set miniatures sculpted and ready to go to mold as soon as the project completes. In addition, we're providing a preview copy of the rules during the campaign so everyone can get a feel for game play in the Counterblast universe. In short, we want you to know exactly what you'll be getting from us as a backer of this project and that we are very serious about making Counterblast happen.

Despite our best efforts the unexpected can occur. We are dependent on outside manufacturers to produce our products and delays can sometimes happen. Fortunately, we have established good working relationships with our main suppliers and do not anticipate any delays.

One of our goals is to attend GenCon this year with brand new Counterblast product in hand. That's why our "Early Bird" levels are not at a discounted price, but at an earlier fulfillment target. We didn't want to risk being victims of too much success and letting some of or backers down if we went to GenCon before sending out everyone's rewards. We feel we can get rewards in the hands of a limited number of people before GenCon and to everyone else soon after.

The last risk has to do with our reward levels and stretch goals. As a small company we do not have the same efficiencies and production capabilities as larger organizations that frequently use Kickstarter as a means to launch new products. We're trying to get Airlock off the ground which means money is tight and our margin razor thin. We've tried to come up with creative offerings that we hope backers will find intriguing and enticing enough to trust us with their hard earned money.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
