Zombicide is a cooperative boardgame for 1 to 6 players, from ages 10 and up. 
Each player takes up the role of 1 to 4 survivors, each with unique abilities, and play with his teammates against zombies controlled by simple rules and a deck of cards. The more zombies you kill, the more skilled you get and the more zombies will appear. The only way for your team to survive and achieve victory is... Zombicide!
Gameplay introduction
New rules highlights
This Kickstarter is the follow up to the boardgame hit of 2012, and introduces the Toxic City Mall and Season 2: Prison Outbreak. All products are fully compatible, except that Toxic City Mall requires either Season 1: Zombicide or Prison Outbreak to play
Toxic City Mall
Shopping malls are a classic zombie movie setting... experience Toxic City Mall and “shopping” will get a brand new meaning! Toxic City Mall is an expansion usable in Season 1 AND Prison Outbreak.. It contains new features to expand your Zombicide games and enrich your experience with new friends and enemies, as well as new game tiles, equipment cards and rules.
4 mall-themed reversible game tiles 
43 miniatures including 4 new survivors in their human and zombivor versions, 29 Toxic Zombies miniatures and the Zombivor versions of Season 1 survivors. 
28 Equipment cards
Tokens to improve your missions, such as barricades and rubble coming in two sizes to block paths and maximize the tactical aspects of your missions.
New rules and game modes such as Zombivor rules, how to play dead, and Ultrared mode to reach superheroic levels and use the marvelous Ultrared weapons.
Expected MSRP - $50


Engage in the 10 missions of the rulebook or create your own! The Mall tiles expand game opportunities and strategies, especially if you use the new barricades or rubble to improve your Zombicide gaming

Season 2: Prison Outbreak

Season 2: Prison Outbreak, is designed as a playable game in its own right, in the same way the Season 1 game was. A new player can enter the Zombicide universe with this box, as it contains everything needed to play as a standalone game. Even more mutated zombies roam the streets, becoming more terrible than ever.


9 brand new, reversible, prison-themed, game tiles
90 miniatures including 6 survivors in both their human and “zombivor” versions, with 78 zombies including berzerker zombies
New equipment cards such as baseball bats, shotguns, katana, concrete saws and even gunblades... 
Tokens to customize your missions: doors of various size, objectives, switches, barbwire, observation towers, and a security gate meant to rotate on the board to change the way you move around the prison corridors! 
Expected MSRP - $100

In Prison Outbreak, Six survivors of various backgrounds, such as a family man, an urban native or a heavy metal fan, battle to purge a zombie-filled prison into a shelter. Many challenges and surprises await you along the 10 mission-campaign featured in the rulebook…complete with an alternate ending! 
Your team will engage in close-quarter combat in dangerous prison blocks and interact a lot with the board itself. Switches will open and lock doors, security zones will change the way you move around and observation towers will expand your view of the surroundings. 
To succeed, however, you’ll have to go toe-to-toe with the bloodthirsty Berserker Zombies, who are immune to ranged weapons. The battle will be very personal and really dirty. 
Zombie Dogz
As a special bonus, we’re also throwing this mini-expansion. These critters may be dead, but their teeth are still sharp and they’re more deadly than ever. If you see these Zombie Dogz coming, it’s time to RUN!
Expected MSRP - $20
Get 20 of these canine terrors in each box!
Pledge Levels
Contaminated - Get Toxic City Mall delivered to your door when it's released.  Note, you'll need either Zombicide Season 1 or Prison Outbreak to play.
Inmate - A copy of Prison Outbreak + Zombie Dogz, and any stretch goals applicable.
Fugitive - A copy of Prison Outbreak + Toxic City Mall + Zombie Dogz and any stretch goals applicable. The complete Season 2 experience!
Raise the Dead - A copy of Zombicide Season 1 + Prison Outbreak + Toxic City Mall + Zombie Dogz and any stretch goals applicable. If you missed Zombicide, here's everything in one swoop!
I am Zombie - Everything in the Fugitive pledge level (and applicable stretch goals) and get featured as a Zombie in Season 3!  Guillotine Games will work with you to get your likeness and desired design (within reason and scope of the Zombicide universe) into the game!
I am Legend - Everything in the Fugitive pledge level (and applicable stretch goals) and get featured as a Survivor and Zombvivor in Season 3! Guillotine Games will work with you to get your likeness and desired design (within reason and scope of the Zombicide universe) into the game!
Also, all Inmate and above pledges will get Brad and his Zombivor version!
Expected MSRP - Not available at retail!
Who are we?
If you read this far, you're almost a true believer, so here's a little more about the designers of Zombicide!
Nicolas Raoult 
Nico worked in Rackham from 1999 to 2008. While wearing the “red dragon” shirt, Nico accompanied Rackham in its ascension. He worked on Rag’Narok, Confrontation 2nd to 4th edition,
In 2008, Nico lent his hand to Kraken Editions for the background of Alkemy Genesis. The Jade Triad arbors his signature.
In 2011, he worked with Studio Cyanide, developer of the Confrontation videogame, as a consultant, freelance author and playtester.
Jean-Baptiste Lullien, a.k.a. Ogre-Mercenaire 
With a background in linguistics and information, J.-B worked for several years as a game designer for Rackham, on several projects including girls games with little horses and a fashion academy, numerous miniature games (even a kind of “marbles” monsters!), videogames and comics.
Raphaël Guiton
Raphael is one of the founders of Rackham, and together with another ex-Games Workshop employee Jean Bey, created the iconic game of Confrontation in 1996, and eventually leading its creative team.
Now a co-founder of Guillotine Games, a studio of french designers, Zombicide, a cooperative boardgame of survivors VS zombies, is his first project to be published as a game designer. 
Percy de Montblanc
Percy has never worked in Rackham. Co-founder of Guillotine Games, he is in charge of all the tasks the other associates hate and he prepares coffee.
He is the executive producer of Zombicide and from time to time he has one or two good ideas that are systematically ignored. Since Zombicide Season 1, he's been locked in the office and let out for occasional walkies.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
From past experience, there are some vagaries in terms of timing when it comes to anything produced in China, such as:

Production delays 
Shipping delays 
Customs delays

We've done our best to minimize this as far as possible, and we are always happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all. Since the game is 90% complete, we don't believe this is in the least bit likely - we've successfully delivered Zombicide and Sedition Wars, our first two Kickstarter projects, and will be shipping Guilds of Cadwallon shortly.

We also have two other ongoing projects, Relic Knights and Rivet Wars that are both in production - please refer to those individual project pages if you'd like to check the progress there. These projects are entirely independent of Zombicide: Season 2 - they have completely different development teams and have no effect on the production flow or development of Zombicide: Season 2.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

And here's another video preview of the game from UndeadViking!
Hundreds of unique and gorgeously illustrated cards.
The idea is pretty basic:
A storyline is laid out before you. It is your job, as Author of your own Oz story, to populate it with characters. Each character's vitality is worth so many points to the story. At the end of the game, the Author whose characters have the greatest total vitality wins the game.

Sounds simple enough? But it can't be that easy. It isn't.

In The Card Game of Oz, you're sharing your storyline with other Authors. There may even be multiple storylines at once. Characters come and go from various locations, each having a different effect on the story. The locations themselves might even change right out from under the feet of your characters.

Characters might be unexpectedly shifted around. Objects and other characters can affect the story. Not to mention Effects, Events, and Spells that can change everything in a blink of an eye.
- Jim O'Connor, Orion's Bell
Check out the rules for The Card Game of Oz here.
You can Print and Play The Card Game of Oz now to try it out!
You can watch this How to Play video from Grey Elephant Gaming.
You can watch this Live Play video from Grey Elephant Gaming.
We sent out a number of preview copies of The Card Game of OZ and the reviews and comments are starting to come in.
"I'm a big fan of the Oz books (have a collection of the whole series) and I think James did a great job of bringing the world of the books into the game." -- Stephen Conway, The Spiel Podcast
"I would highly recommend this game for any one who loves the world of Oz... the books, the movies... You're just immersed in the land of Oz the whole time you're playing. It's really great! ...I've really been enjoying this game a lot. The more I play it, the more I want to play it." - Grey Elephant Gaming
"...[The Card Game of Oz] looks like one to keep an eye out for and I'm interested to see more of the classic world of Oz outside Dorothy, Toto, Cowardly Lion, and so forth come into the gaming consciousness." -- Jeff McAleer, The Gaming Gang
"...I know people that would enjoy this game. The art is beautiful and once learned should play quickly." -- Jason, Play Board Games
"...if you like games based on stories, check out the Card Game of Oz...I played this with a friend who said he hates The Wizard of Oz but still thought the game was promising nonetheless." -- Jonathan Liu, GeekDad
"[The Card Game of OZ] looks gorgeous, with a full complement of wonderfully illustrated cards, and some cool-looking story dice." -- Scott Firestone IV and Jeremiah Isley, Theology Of Games
"Beautiful game with some CCG aspects. Worth checking out if you like those types of mechanisms." -- Doug Garrett, Garrett's Games and Geekiness Podcast
"[The Child Geeks] found it challenging, but very much something they could wrap their minds and imaginations around….The Parent Geeks were delighted by the game and very much enjoyed themselves when they played….The Gamer Geeks were very impressed with The Card Game of Oz."  -- Cyrus, Father Geek

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Publishing a board or card game is a cash intensive endeavor. Long before a game project appears on Kickstarter, the designers and developers will have spent hundred of hours on play testing the game and thousands of dollars on art and design to get the project to state where you will take it seriously. In the case of small design studios like Orion's Bell and small publishers like Game Salute, this money is all paid up front from a VERY limited budget. THE CARD GAME OF OZ is a small project as games go, but even so, it can't be made without your help.

THE CARD GAME OF OZ is virtually "Print Ready" so we plan to send the final files to the printer within a week or two of the project's close. That means we hope to have it available for release in 2013. Every game project is subject to potential production delays, but we believe this date is achievable.

The final challenge is getting the game and rewards out to the backers. Game Salute is well versed in Kickstarter reward fulfillment and we are prepared to meet this challenge for THE CARD GAME OF OZ.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Over the past five years, I created three large scale works of art that attempt to catalogue the entire 'Cartoon Universe.' I loved creating this work and continue to be blown away by people's responses.
This year I am creating a series built around crowdsourcing content though coherent themes. Here are some examples: a picture of only cereal mascots; father figures; video game ghosts; famous apes or characters voiced by Bill West.
I January I successfully funded a picture of 120 people's favorite characters. Now I'd like to make a picture of the greatest baddies of all. I've started with six of my favorites: Bowser, Ursula, Mom, Roger, the Governor and Joker. I'd like to populate the rest of the picture with some of yours.
For $15.00, the villain of your choice will be drawn into the picture. Because this project is about the backers as much as it is about the characters, please feel free to tell me your story about the character or a certain appearance of theirs that meant something to you.
In addition, you'll get one of 250 Limited Prints of the piece. Characters will be added in the order backers join, with a list at the bottom of this page. After pledging, message me with your character request.
Posted below is a video by Yuyu Chen for the New York Times East Village Local Blog. It serves as an excellent primer if you are unfamiliar with my work.
Thank you for your interest and continued support. I am still amazed at the kindness and enthusiasm that this mode of working allows. It's a true gift that the audience can be as big an inspiration as the subject.

campaign.story:
Recent Updates
We will be launching a new, redesigned campaign on Kickstarter on Tuesday March 12, 2013. In addition to offering things of interest to iPad and board game players, this campaign will focus on developing the game on Android Tablets and Steam PC. 
Read our Small World Reboot update and stay tuned for a relaunch in March!
________________________
The World of Board Games
The world of board games is different from the rest of gaming: You get larger boxes, lots of cool components, and games that can still be played 20 years later. You don’t need to worry about what platform it’s on!
But even in that world, we've developed a reputation for being a bit different at Days of Wonder:
- we focus on developing board games with the coolest components, best theme and gameplay, not on producing the cheapest games possible;
- we develop all digital versions of our games ourselves, in-house, rather than licensing them onto third-parties;
- and we never, ever, discuss new products and future plans ahead of their actual release.
But this time, we'd like to Play different! So read on...
The Project: Small World 2
A year after the launch of Small World - the Board game, on the first day the original iPad became available, we launched Small World for iPad, pioneering a whole new world of board games on Tablets! 
The game earned critical acclaim and hordes of devoted players, but soon took a backseat to our own Ticket to Ride - the train game that pays the bills at Days of Wonder.
The game didn’t die though. While fans kept playing the original iPad version, deep in a corner of our Paris office, a dedicated team started creating the next generation of Small World.
Small World 2 is now well underway...
With up to 5 players, Small World ain't so small anymore - just a bit crowded!
... and it will ship later this year, no matter what!
Why Kickstarter?
We will be launching a new, redesigned campaign on Kickstarter on Tuesday March 12, 2013. In addition to offering things of interest to iPad and board game players, this campaign will focus on developing the game on Android Tablets and Steam PC.
Stay tuned for our relaunch!

OUR NEW CAMPAIGN GOAL
